Author: Loren M LaLonde
Title: Light use only
Body: The stroller is inexpensive, moves well, and for the last two months did its job well. Unfortunately, the wheels started screaming on our weekend away. I didn't think we put it through extra harsh conditions, but it looks like we wore out the bearings on the rear wheels.I'll try some grease on the wheels, and see if that helps. I expect we'll have to retire it.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Lana
Title: Perfect stroller!
Body: Easy to fold and light weight!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Happy Purchaser
Title: Great Stroller
Body: I bought this stroller for my daughter to push my 16 month grandson who is big for his age. They both love it. It's lightweight for her and easy to open and close. Grandson likes how roomy it is. and he likes climbing in for a stroll.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: PWellington
Title: Good for the price
Body: Practical for the price... good for taller toddlers..large canopy..cheaply made, but sturdy enough for travel which was the primary function needed.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: nancheee
Title: You NEED this, trust me
Body: I can’t believe it took me so long to get this stroller. I’m a first time mom, so I previously purchased a stroller that came with the combo of baby car seat & then toddler stroller seating. It was great, but very bulky and heavy. If you have a young toddler and you like going out to theme parks or brief outings, this lightweight stroller is a must!Pros: it’s light weight, doesn’t take up too much space in your trunk, folds easily, the umbrella cover is actually big enough to provide shade, has a tray to give your child snacks.Cons: the storage is minimal (just something to keep in mind), the cup holder for child is small and our cup didn’t fit. It barely fit on the adult holder at the top, it says it has shocks, but as we traveled through a semi-rocky path, it was bumpier than our older stroller.Personally, I feel the pros outweigh the cons for me. Plus the price was right. I couldn’t go without a child tray, storage and lightweight and this has them all.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Erika
Title: Excelente para ir de viaje.
Body: Es fácil de armar.Muy liviano y al ser pequeño no ocupa espacio. Muy cómodo para que mi hijo de dos años pueda estar sentado por mucho tiempo. Se reclina un poco hacia atrás para que el niño pueda dormir.Me encantaNo pesa así que es más fácil para el uso diario de una madre.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Andybeagle1
Title: Wheel and pin broke while grandson was in stroller
Body: Wheel and pin broke on stroller. 3 months old unable to repair. No exchange or refund available.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Dody Harmon
Title: Nice for the price
Body: Almost everything about this is pretty easy. Easy to lift, easy to fold, easy to store stuff underneath. My kid loves it too. The mesh around the seat keeps him cooler and the sun shade is great. We love the amount he can lean back which helps him sleep while we are out. The only problem I have seen is when locking it so stay folded. The locking latch is easy but the wheels kinda get in the way of each other and if you do it wrong the plastic on the wheels may warp when stored in a hot car. But we do love this stroller
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Zachary R.
Title: Son loves it
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Definitely lightweight but ours is falling apart after 2 months.
Body: Not easy to fold, fails the maneuverability test as well as after 2 months the wheels look like they are about to break off and the wheels also have a mind if their own. It is definitely lightweight!!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: SKnowles(firelady)
Title: Love it!
Body: It's light and easy to fold up unlike the stroller I had before. I thought the sun would be in my baby's face so I purchased a sun shade for him, but we don't even need it. The canopy provides enough shade!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Shon White
Title: Light weight
Body: This stroller is ok but not great. It is not as easy to maneuver as the higher end brands. And the safety straps could be a little more secure. My daughter is 1yrs old 32inches tall and weighs 30lbs and the straps doesn't stay over her shoulders like I would like. The tray and cup holders are great. The cargo space underneath is perfect. Overall its a good choice for the price.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kristy Bonilla
Title: Seat always reclines
Body: Seat doesn't come up to a comfortable place. Hard to adjust seat back position.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: James W. Goodale
Title: Light weight but flimsy
Body: Overall the stroller is ok for quick trips but as an every day stroller pay more and get something better. The handle is low and doesn’t adjust. It’s fine for me but not my tall husband. The ride is ok but one wheel seems to shimmy. I don’t hate it but don’t love it either
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Valerie Williams
Title: Worth it
Body: I purchased it to take with me on trips as i travel a lot. It definitely take up little space and is very lightweight. Although there isn't a lot of storage space, i use bag clips for anything purchased while out. The seat reclines, which comes in handy when the little one falls asleep. Definitely worth getting.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Trisha Miller
Title: Needs bigger useful cup holders
Body: Cup holders are useless and way too small for any normal drink. Needed for trip and wasn’t gonna hold anything needed. Just felt ehh
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: R K
Title: Super durable
Body: I love this stroller it folds up nice and small, leaves lots of room in the car for groceries
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: J Rowland
Title: Hard to fold
Body: The stroller is great, my taller toddler fits in it great and still has room to grow in it, but it's really hard to fold. I exchanged it for another thinking it might have just been user error or damaged but the second one is the same way. Would not buy again
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sheila khan
Title: Unfortunately, stroller that was dirty and stains on the shade and sitting area!
Body: Unfortunately, stroller was dirty stains on the shade area and sitting area not good!!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Lightweight and versatile
Body: I wanted a stoller that fits in my trunk and this one is it. Very good product.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: The 1st stroller my son Loves.
Body: I love the color, its easy for me to control, close and so far clean. The sun covers my son very well. He weighs 30lbs and is 2yrs old. This is the first stroller he actually wants to be in, even indoors cause its compact. I also like it has his small snack n juice tray and i also have mine for my cup and my husbands. Was a very good buy..its a great stroller. P.s. it reclines easy, big basket underneath, and my sons feet don't reach the ground, big safety issue.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jinissa Y Smith
Title: This has become our everyday stroller!
Body: I had a travel system with multiple parts to it that was starting to become a pain as my little one got older. I was in the market for a lightweight stroller that was easily portable for trips and outings but still had some important components to me like an under basket, cupholders for me and a tray for my child. Some of the negative reviews almost deterred me but I ended up buying it anyway and it was the best decision I could have made! You can practically fold and unfold it with one hand, it folds to almost nothing in size, and its sooo lightweight and easy that it has become our everyday stroller! It's been with us on all sorts of terrain from rocks to grass and bumpy roads and it still going strong! If it breaks, I'm just gonna buy another one because this amount of ease is priceless. BUY IT!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ace007
Title: Primarily an indoor mall stroller
Body: So many positive reviews about this stroller baffles my mind. I feel compelled to list every con about this item in hopes of other people not wasting their time or money.1. The stroller is way too light. I am actually afraid it will tip over. Maneuvering it is actually scary.2. The stroller is built way too low. If you are a person 5 1/2 feet or above you will feel very awkward maneuvering this thing as it is that low.3. The top peek a boo window has no flapIs no one concerned with the lack of a flap on the peek a boo window? I mean seriously how much more thought could it have taken to put one one? Did the manufacturer even think about the hot sun beaming on my child’s head? Seriously can anyone please give me an explanation as to how something so simple as a cover could have been overlooked?4. The wheels feel like styraphome. No way will they hold up being utilized outdoors.5. The back rest is made out of a simple piece of cardboard.6. The front tray cup holder is smaller than the parent ones. My baby’s bottle would not fit in it.7. The front is designed so that when my baby drops her bottle or whatever she may have it will fall to the ground. This is a problem most strollers have and can be corrected with a simple plastic basket.8. The soft handgrips make my hands sweat unlike the rubber coating of my big stroller.9. The back breaks have to be set on both wheels unlike my bigger stroller where one click locks both sides.I can go on and on but I’m going to summit up in just three simple words DON’T BUY IT!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: elizabeth
Title: Good quality for good price
Body: I got this stroller in January and was waiting to see how it held up to write a review. This stroller is super durable, and has held up for months and the quality is still the same. We use this stroller almost everyday for our daily walks to the park. I love the big storage basket and have never had anything fall out through the exposed front. The adult and child duo cup holders absolutely sold me on this, my son also loves the tray that he can use for snacks or toys. Definitely recommend.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amy Montez Frye
Title: I returned it because of the cup holders 🥴
Body: I will say it was decent for the price… I wasn't a fan of the straps to hold baby in. I think the straps are most likely uncomfortable for the kiddo riding (no padding and not really any support so definitely not for a new sitter). Also the cup holders can’t fit hardly anything. Sippy cups, bottles, soda cans, to-go cups… literally nothing fit in them.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Marianna
Title: Almost perfect
Body: Descriptions are great other than it laying back. It does lay back a little but just night quite enough. Everything else is great. Very lightweight, easy to navigate, easy to fold, storage space is good. Cup holder for adult is a little small. Will fit normal bottled water, maybe some cups that are smaller at the bottom. For day trips with a lot of walking, usually I want a yeti cup to keep my drinks cold, the regular size did not fit, but there are yeti’s with the cup holder bottoms, hopefully that will fit.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Best for the money
Body: Best stroller for the money. As adversity is light weight and easy to fold (takes a few times to get used to it) holds water bottles of normal size. It is awesome!!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Shanna K
Title: Look No Further
Body: Whipped this bad boy out for a vacay once and never put it away. I actually swapped out my main stroller for this one. I love how lightweight and roomy it is. The basket is pretty spacious. The peekaboo window is awesome and the shade is decent. Recline is not too shabby either. I also like to put snacks in baby’s cupholder. Overall, I love this and so glad I purchased it.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Cup holder doesn’t fit sippy cups
Body: Doesn’t fit my sons sippy cups the cup holders are too small for him and it’s a little frustrating for us both. Also for the price I thought it would be better quality. Not impressed
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Naaman Malik
Title: It is lightweight
Body: Dislike the size of the bottom basket
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Nancy L.
Title: Great Stroller
Body: Great stroller for a great price. We wanted something lighter and more compact compared to our Graco Jogger. It takes half the space in my trunk and half the effort to load/unload and fold/unfold than my Graco one. We went on a whole coast trip with this stroller and it was very easy to maneuver the wheels turn smoothly and easily on sharp turns to avoid any corners or people walking by. Highly recommend this stroller to all parents.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: E.R.S.
Title: Great stroller, small cup holders.
Body: I love how easy this stroller is to use and how light it is. The only thing I do not like about it is that the cup holders and storage tray are so small. You can only for skinny cups or bottles. Same goes for the cup holder for your child.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Bney O
Title: Light weight easily collapses
Body: Got this as a gift easy to put together light weight very easy to collapse
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Great product!
Body: This stroller is a perfect “in between” of a large size stroller and teeny umbrella stroller. Bought for a vacation and it folds easily, lays pretty flat considering there’s a tray and cup holders, and maneuvered well in small spaces and uneven pavement. Large storage space underneath. Held a Kavu shoulder bag and multiple small shopping bags as well. My son is a large 17 month old and he was well supported, shaded, and has a good amount of room to grow. This was a great purchase!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: NH
Title: Tiny cup holders, not correct weight limit
Body: This stroller is terrible! My daughter weighs 35 lbs and we can barely push it with her in it. The weight limit says 50 lbs, so I’m thinking they need to lower the weight limit. The wheels squeak the entire time we’re pushing it, and it’s so hard to turn when she’s in it. It’s easy to fold up, but the flimsy latch that is supposed to keep it folded falls off the bar constantly and the stroller comes unfolded. The main reason I bought this stroller was for the parent cup holders/tray and the child cup holder/tray, but if you plan to drink anything bigger than a bottle of water, the holes will be too tiny and you won’t be able to use them. Same goes for the kid cup holder- none of my daughter’s sippy cups can fit in the hole so they’re constantly falling on the ground as we walk because she has to leave it on the tray. The adult tray is also too small to hold my phone. We bought this stroller as a cheap option to use in the airport, and I guess we got what we paid for.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Cynthia S.
Title: Great stroller
Body: Bought for my great grandson his mom and dad said it was so easy to push going through grass at the park
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Luis
Title: Travel friendly
Body: This was great for traveling to DR!✈️🏖 Easy to assemble and use. At the airport we had no problems with it
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Luana K
Title: Perfect compact stroller with good support and more basket space
Body: We bought this stroller to take to Disneyland. We needed something compact and lightweight for traveling, but with enough space for storing all the crap we needed for the baby in the park for the entire day and night. This stroller was great! The only downside is the cup holders on the kid tray and up on the adult tray were so small they wouldn’t even fit his sippy cups or our drink cups.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jessica Bianchino
Title: Great purchase!!
Body: This is a great light weight stroller. Pretty easy to fold if you move the front wheels the right way. Doesn’t take up much room in the car.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Caroline
Title: Flimsy and hard to push
Body: This is more like a child’s toy stroller than a real one. It’s very hard to maneuver and flimsy. Too much of a pain to return but I can’t imagine using this for more than a few minutes.I do not recommend.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Siddique
Title: Comfortable
Body: Very comfortable
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jen
Title: Don’t like it
Body: I wanted to like this but the seat is slanted forward. My toddler was so uncomfortable and she couldn’t sit up straight. Have to return, it just isn’t built right. Maybe this would work if I barely needed her to sit in it, but if I wanted her to sit in this for any stretch of time, it would not work at all. She almost slides out under the tray because of the angle of the seat bottom. Bad design
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: OLive
Title: This is good for all baby from 5mths-5yrs
Body: I use this to carry my baby around
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Cara Pena
Title: Cup holders were too small. Horrible design.
Body: Easy to fold. Lightweight. Great for traveling. But the cup holders were made way too small. Horrible design.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Gus B.
Title: BUY THIS FOR TRAVEL! Dominated 2.5 weeks of cobblestones and gravel roads in Europe!
Body: I was looking for an inexpensive and lightweight stroller to take with us on our Europe vacation for our 1-year old. We have a $300 baby jogger that we use at home but it is not easy to travel with, especially when we knew we'd be doing a lot of walking/transferring. This stroller is a CHAMP! The terrain we used it on for 2.5 weeks was NOT easy, and this thing dominated everywhere we took it. Very rough cobblestones, gravel roads, dirt paths, grass, streets, etc. Nothing could bring it down! We were completely impressed by the end of our trip. Not to mention the storage basket in the bottom is very spacious, the snack tray is clutch for eating on the go, and it's SO LIGHTWEIGHT! Easy to carry with one hand while we carried all our other luggage. Only bummer is it got stuck in London on our way home so I'm anxiously awaiting our reunion with it. LOL! Buy this stroller for your next trip!!!!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Nancy A.B.
Title: It’s perfect!
Body: We were looking for a lightweight stroller for vacations and this one is sheer perfection! So easy for me to put together. My son didn’t scream when we put him in it like he does with our large Britax one. I love the parent and child cup holder- not many small strollers have that feature! Large under basket. I’m seriously in love and so is my toddler. Just buy it :)
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Brian
Title: Definitely serves it's purpose.
Body: Perfect for us grandparents to have for our grandbabies. It doesn't have all the bells and whistles like the more expensive strollers but it's sturdy and folds up easily and compact. We've used it several times with no problems.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Celeste T
Title: Yes!
Body: We needed a stroller for our autistic child. He gives us a hard time outdoors and throws tantrums if he can't stop and play with every bit of grass or rock. He is 2 and I felt he was too big for a stroller but we desperately needed one to help make our outings a bit easier and faster. After looking at the reviews, I felt like he would fit comfortably in this one. It's lightweight and doesn't take up space in a car trunk at all. My son fits perfectly in it now, though he might grow out of it soon. Perhaps by the time he is 3 but for right now, it's very helpful. My only concerns are that it can't be adjusted for his head to lay back as much as I would like but that's minor. Also, it says easy 1 hand fold but for me, it's a bit tricky. I think I need some practice lol Regardless, it is serving its purpose. Wheels work fine and the tray is good for snacks. Cupholders are small, in my opinion. His nuk sippy cup had to be pushed in to fit but water bottles can fit fine. With all that said, it's definitely worth the price and I would recommend to other parents.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: NOT SAFE
Body: I bought this product to have a lightweight easy to open and close stroller to keep in my car. I have young grandchildren from infant to 2 1/2 year-old NONE of them fit. There is virtually no support for an infant, the back rest does not make for a comfortable ride at all and does not fold down all the way. An infant would slide right out. It’s a pretty small stroller. For my six month old grandson, it is a very uncomfortable fit, for my eight month old granddaughter the straps are super uncomfortable and the backrest is very uncomfortable no matter what adjustment we made. she kept sliding and was being pinched no matter what. and by 2 1/2-year-old grandson who is fairly small is too big for the stroller. I wish I could exchange this and get my money back.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Marko R.
Title: Very good !
Body: Finally a good travel stroller - easy to fold and easy to maneuver and it has a very big basket. Also the seat reclines with a strap so the child can sleep.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Build quality is lacking
Body: Super lightweight and easy to turn.Folds down quick, and also stands on its own.Negatives are the seatbelts. They are small straps that are not too comfortable for a baby.Our the wheels started squeaking while turning after about 2 weeks of use.Overall, you get what you pay for. If you don't mind the cheap quality, then this is a good one to get. I would personally spend a bit more on another stroller if I had to do it all again.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Es
Title: Love our red stroller
Body: A perfect little stroller, light, easy to use and the red is beautiful!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kidist Alene
Title: Riley chep material
Body: The material is not safe for baby it's looks like easily broke i don't like at all
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Deborah Simmons
Title: Love it
Body: Easy to use. Light weight. Easy to fold. Seems to be sturdy.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jacqueline Crooker
Title: Get what you pay for
Body: I am having trouble returning because it needs a box it won't close its defective.This is literally a piece of garbage. Does not close and UPS refuses to take it until I box it up but can't box it because it won't close!!!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Andres
Title: Poor quality
Body: Back bored came out within a week, it was literally a piece of cardboard. I guess you get what you pay for.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Nicole Ramirez
Title: Not good
Body: This stroller is not really that great. I prefer a summer brand umbrella stroller over that.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Karen Mcgill
Title: Awesome stroller
Body: Great stroller!!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Yenlik
Title: Good stroller but ...
Body: But you can't find a cup which can fit to this tiny holder. And it's not that easy to maneuver. But overall good stroller considering the price. I recommend it
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Burles
Title: Good, Affordable, but a bit bulky for storage
Body: Our first stroller was a click-in Chicco stroller for our infant car seat. It was just a simple, cheap stroller much like this one and we were happy with it. So we decided to get another simple looking stroller. This is that. It's simple. Not many frills, but it does have a cupholder for the adult, a tray for the child, and the under-seat storage which is key! My one con is that it doesn't click and lock closed when you fold it up. There is only a red latch you can fold down to help the stroller stay shut. This latch comes undone easily and makes it a bit more of a hassle to load in and out of the trunk of our car. It stands up well when folded, though. Happy with the purchase.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Difficult to fold up.
Body: This stroller is not a simple button click to fold up and put somewhere. Much more complicated than that and not doable with three Littles. It is lightweight and seems durable but I needed something simple to fold and put away, that was a dealbreaker and returned.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Darlene
Title: Trust me as a mother with injuries do to an accident best one hand easy to carry strollers
Body: Easy light weight one hand stroller
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sherry T.
Title: All in all, nice convenient stroller for travel.
Body: I bought the stroller as a gift for travel. Very lightweight, easy to maneuver, and overall handling. I wish the cupholders were a bit larger and the seat would recline more, but for the price it’s great!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sarah D.
Title: Cheap wheels!
Body: Wheels made lousy! Getting around on anything other than a smooth sidewalk, including grass is a nightmare!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Joyce
Title: PERFECT stroller for traveling!
Body: This was the perfect stroller for traveling. It is light weight, durable and easy to fold
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Wnfr
Title: Es buen material
Body: Esta bien pero no para bebés tan pequeñitos porque no se inclina completamente para acostarlos, y también no hay nada que sostenga sus piecitos cuando se duerman
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: One wheel short
Body: Packages arrived with 3 wheels and not 4
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: monika
Title: Ok
Body: It’s lightweight I’ll give it that. But it’s not as good quality as I would like. The wheel was squeaking the first time I used it. Definitely not easy to fold in and out with one hand.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kasch
Title: Not built to last
Body: I get it. It’s an inexpensive stroller but I did expect that it would be built to last a while. There are nice features - it’s lightweight and maneuverable with a decent sunshade for baby. But the wheels! Think Big Wheel bikes - hollow hard plastic that wears away with use. It’s not a real smooth ride but the worst part is knowing the limited lifetime of those “tires”. Grant it, we plan to drive more carefully than a toddler on a Big Wheel. Just hope we can find replacement tires.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Madelin López
Title: Me encanto para mi bebé
Body:
The media could not be loaded.
  
  
  
  
  
  
  
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  
   Nos encanta
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Emily Gosdin
Title: Best stroller easy to use
Body: Pop open with one hand while holding my 9 month old on my hip!!!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jeycel R.
Title: Súper fácil de usar
Body: Muy fácil de armar , y fácil para guardar, no pesa nada y al parecer a mi bebe le a encantado va muy cómoda en ella la recomiendo 💯
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Shelby
Title: Perfect Compact Stroller
Body: This stroller is easy to fold one handed and steer. We got this for traveling and it’s been perfect for our son. The tray is an added bonus! I was also impressed with how much the storage basket holds!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Small package
Body: It was smaller than I had expected. Wasn’t hard to put together. Worked well, only thing that would have made it better is if it had adjustable seat levels.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Miguel
Title: Great!!!
Body: This stroller is amazing! I needed an easy food and light weight compared to the other one and this it the best stroller! I definitely recommend it!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Mila F.
Title: Perfect for Theme Parks!
Body: Bought this to use at the theme parks this summer. Can confirm it is awesome! Lightweight, so you can easily lift it into things like trunks, taxi boats at Universal, the train, etc. Folds up really easily. As other reviewers mentioned, you do have to make sure the wheels are facing forward to get it to fold properly, but we knew that going in, so it wasn't a problem. Has a little wheel-brake to keep it from moving around, just be sure to follow the directions when putting the wheels and wheelbreaks on. It was nice being to out maneuver those who had giant, bulky strollers --- esp when it started to rain! haha! For the price, I would definitely recommend!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Naomi Lorraine
Title: So glad I purchased
Body: I love the easiness and lightweight that this is. Makes for easy walks, or trips to the store
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kim H.
Title: Careful they label it’s plus but it’s really sport.
Body: The plus has red open and locking mechanisms and when folded rolls. The sport does not. The fabric and box clearly say plus, but the frame being black vs silver and the other details are sport. I am returning this. I a surprised Kolcraft would put the plus fabric on the sport frame.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Melanie Ramos
Title: It’s a must!!!!
Body: My daughter loves this new stroller! I love that the cup holder part is easy to take off and put back on
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sugarbear
Title: Love it
Body: Transitioning my son (20 months) to this was exceptional! Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Doesn’t protect from the sun like you would think

The sun shade does extend pretty far, but when fully extended there is a mesh cut out right over the baby’s head. The sun shines right through and directly on my baby. The only way to block the sun from coming in is to put a blanket or towel over the opening or not extend the sun shade fully. Very poor design.I like everything else about the stroller. I’m just pretty disappointed since the main reason I bought the stroller was for what seemed like better sun protection.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: CES Penname
Title: Looks Good, HOWEVER, Despite Being Renewed by Amazon"...NO Instructions?!?"
Body: Updated:- Purchased as a lightweight stroller with respectable suspension for taking my grandchild out on walks along the rough graveled paths at local parks.- First impression: It definitely seems to fulfill those requirements.- It arrived on time. I did purchase it as an Open Box product, but the online assessment stated it was in Very Good condition. All the parts _seem_ to have been included and there was no obvious damage to any of them. However, there were no basic assembly instructions or even a parts list, so how could any customer know for sure?- This stroller was supposed to be Renewed by Amazon. I don't think it's too much to presume that care would be taken to assure the safety of a _baby_ stroller by making certain it could be assembled correctly with all safety features properly engaged. Even if it was returned without the instructions; it seems like it should not have been that difficult for the renewal team to notice those instructions were missing, and print them out from the manufacturer to include as part of the promised (right there on the box!) Renewed by Amazon. Just sayin'.- Ultimately, I was able to assemble it in fairly short order and everything seems to be functioning the way it should. Still, I do think it's a good thing there weren't that many parts to puzzle over. The one-handed fold is a little trickier to master, but folding it is not at all difficult with two hands. And it does indeed stand up on its own when folded on a level surface - and easily stores in my coat closet. Both the Amazon page and the box state it has ..all-terrain wheels with front suspension - and after my 8-month-old grandchild took a ride in it over a fairly uneven forest path and fell asleep along the way, I'd say that's definitely the best testament to that feature and the overall comfort of the stroller.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Title: Used and pretty irritated over it!!

It held up to carrying heavy bags when our baby wasn’t in it, hauled a load of groceries across the street to our AirBnB and was a great place for our little girl to nap and eat snacks. For something so inexpensive and lightweight it really held up on vacation. One of the wheels is squeaking but after some oil, I think it’ll be fine. 100% recommend.

Title: Coming from a Graco, I am disappointed
Body: I had to replace my Graco stroller because it only worked with the infant car seat and my daughter was outgrowing it.Pros: the seat recline, while tedious to adjust, it's nice to have the option. The one-hand-fold is accurate, unlike my old Graco, even though mine does not look like the one in the picture. The color, I got red. The canopy is nice.Cons: it is very particular with the way the wheels need to face when folding, otherwise it doesn't fold flat. I can not get mine to stand upright when folded consistently. The maneuverability is TERRIBLE, turning is a nightmare, again I blame the wheels. Tiny parent tray and cupholders, none will fit any of her sippy cups. Feels almost flimsy, but hey, lightweight. I think I remember having problems with the assembly instruction, maybe that's why I have so many issues.Overall if I could get a better stroller, I would, but I barely use it so I'll just tough it out..

Author: Consumer4254243
Title: Refused to fold up, stay folded or easily unfold once I got it folded
Body: Returned this stroller for two reasons. First, the brakes on it were very difficult to unlock and very uncomfortable using thinner running shoes (no problems with hiking boots but a lot more protection in those) and second, no matter how many times I tried to figure out the trick to easily collapsing or unfolding the stroller the front wheels were always spinning and getting in the way so that I either couldn't close it enough to use the plastic latch to keep it closed or the front wheels jammed into the back wheels and became stuck and it was a headache to get back open, usually had to use both hands to pry it open and scraped my knuckles a couple times... My wife couldn't figure it out either... when it was collapsed it was lightweight and when open with our daughter seated in it there was no problem with turning it or using it as a stroller, seems like poor design where the front and back wheels got in each others way too much.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

The only downside is the cup holders are smaller and don’t hold many different sizes of cups (like large drinks from Disney and certain tumbler cups). To recline to seat, you have to use the old school pull/release but it’s easy to use and not a huge deal. The storage underneath is smaller but can hold a diaper bag and a backpack. It’s hard to get to if baby is asleep in the reclined position, but not a huge deal breaker. Overall, it’s a nice little stroller.

Author: Sure, Not
Title: Indestructible
Body: We bought this stroller when my son was about 6 months old. We live in Florida and wanted something with good airflow. We are also theme park junkies and are in a theme park just about every weekend. This beast has spent just about every weekend at SeaWorld, Busch Gardens, Universal, Aquatica or Volcano Bay with the occasional trip to the Tampa Zoo. My son has slept in it, eaten in it, laughed in it and zoomed from ride to ride, show to show. Just the other day, while getting it out in Universal's parking lot, it dawned on me, we paid roughly $65 for this thing and it has been a trooper. We did the (admittedly rough) math and based on our typical phone reading and a solid guess on how many days this thing has been in a theme park, it's got about 2,000 miles of wear on it with no signs of slowing down. Sure it's a bit faded from the sun, and it has every stain known to childhood all over it, but man if you told me that a sub $100 stroller would last 5 years getting straight beat up at theme parks and just keep on ticking, I wouldn't believe you. Anyway, we don't even call it the stroller anymore. This beauty is known as ole reliable and that's exactly what she is.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Lisa
Title: I love this for trips
Body: This stroller was recommended on a website for traveling. I took a chance since I got rid of my old big one. My son is just 2 months away from being 3 and is 38lbs and 39 in tall. Only issue is when it folds up the tires sometimes get in the way of each other and you have to move them.

I watched a video on YouTube about closing it with one hand and the guy said to push red the handle and red lever while rolling it backwards so that helped. Gets easier with practice, I can do it with one hand while holding my kid. My kid slouches in the seat, I can’t seem to get the back to go up any further. And the lock doesn’t work so I bought some Velcro to keep it closed when traveling.

We have other more expensive strollers that claim to be easy to collapse etc but nothing beats this one!

Author: Elizabeth
Title: Good for travel!
Body: I bought this stroller to use on vacation with my 14 month old. Our other stroller is kind of big/bulky, and a pain in the butt to collapse. This stroller was wonderful.It was easy to put together. I was able to assemble all the pieces while my kiddo ate breakfast.It's easy to adjust the straps.The basket underneath can hold a bunch of stuff (I kept kiddo's shoes, a jacket, a blanket, and a hoodie for myself under there).It collapses pretty easily after you give it a couple practice runs. It also doesn't take up much space. ANNNDDD it will stand up once collapsed.It maneuvers so well. We took this stroller to zoos, aquariums, museums, and walked around a city. It's small enough to not be annoying, but big enough that my kiddo doesn't feel cramped.The only cons I have regarding this stroller is the canopy is kind of flimsy and a decent weighted diaper bag can't hang off the stroller handles without flipping the stroller. Neither one of those was a deal breaker for me.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Title: Easy, for climbers
Body:
The media could not be loaded.

So the stroller was my salvation. I just transfer from place to place. She loves riding in it. She eats her meals in it. We go outside and she just lays back and enjoys. Author: teresa silverthorne
Title: Great stroller!
Body: We got 2 of these (one in each color) for our upcoming Disney trip since our regular stroller doesnt fit the size requirements and these are perfect. The trays are small but big enough for bottles/sippys and a snack. The basket underneath is spacious. The reclining feature will come in handy for sure. Steering was pretty good, only got stuck once or twice. My husband says the lock for when its folded was a little weird as it cant be folded completely if you want to lock it, but it still folds down really nicely. All in all a great product.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: docs enigma
Title: Not lightweight for all
Body: I'm sure this item is lightweight in comparison to some of the monstrosities my daughter uses for her kids. And I'm glad they are excellent. This item is lightweight for most but not all. I am old and with arthritis in my hands. It was not light for me. Also, you have to put the wheels on yourself. Forget that for me. But for most, I say it's probably a good choice.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Chantell Washington
Title: Nice
Body: I love it. Kind of hard to get over bumps and my baby will grow out of it soon lol she like too big for it but we’re gonna just put use out of this stroller! Easy to assemble also!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Katie
Title: A great light weight stroller
Body: We desperately needed a new stroller for my 3.5 year old, our heavily used Chicco Bravo stroller didn't have much life left. Since she is almost 4 I really didn't want to spend a lot of money on a stroller, but also wanted something more than an umbrella stroller. After looking at many many options I decided to go with this one, mostly because the seat looked deeper than the other options I looked at and my daughter is very tall. We got it today and it was very easy to put together. The wheels are very durable feeling, like a rubbery plastic. The seat recline is adjustable from a strap in the back. The snack tray is nice, cupholder fits nuk sippy cups but Zak water bottles are too big. My daughter is 3'5 tall and she has plenty of leg room still with the foot rest. When we took it around our neighborhood, the wheels worked great making it smoothly over large cracks and bumps in the sidewalk, and over curbs. It's a good deal for what you get, not sure how long lasting it will be though. The only downside is the hip straps are pretty difficult to adjust, also the basket storage has no closure toward the footrest so it is possible things could fall out of the front. Overall I would reccomend it to others.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Mandee H
Title: Worked good at Disney.
Body: Bought this for a Disney trip. Worked great and was very glad to have it! Our cheap poncho for over the top of it when it rained. And the awning worked wonderful for the sun. Most don’t come down far enough. The basket below is huge and fit all our stuff the down side is folding it to get on the bus, we had to empty almost the whole bottom or things fell out. Couldn’t have much in the basket then. This thing went over 40 miles in 5 days and although the back tires are fairly bare it held up and has a few more miles on it. Was worth the price!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Emily Sutton
Title: Light weight!!!!
Body: I don’t do product reviews but we LOVE this stroller! It fits perfectly in my trunk, super light weight, easy to fold and my son actually likes riding in it

Only thing I wish is that the cup holders on the snack tray were bigger. I have a hard time trying to find a cup that fits

Absolute junk and will spend the extra money next time to get a better quality stroller.

Author: Candice Harris
Title: Cheap Quality

Author: Linesh Mehta
Title: It's a BAD BUY! REVIEWS are Misleading!!!
Body: My title is understandably an oxymoron but many users like me buy products based on reviews and this was clearly a mistake. The issues with this stroller are:- low quality wheels which get worn out super fast more so if you use in areas where there is snow and salt. They can not go through even based snow layers.- foot rest is very poorly designed so the baby can never get to keep feet on them and hence will remain hanging and it's not because of the height of the baby.- the back support is poor and baby can't be kept for more than an hour - they still start getting pain- the straps are the worst - they can't be adjusted for lengthy without a long battle of playing with the stupid loop. Do they even test their design before production???All in all it was the worst 75+$ that i spent and it's surprising that how people actually have good reviews to this total disaster of engineering
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kelsey K.
Title: Great for travel with tall kids!
Body: Product easy to assemble.Great for price.Folding up is easy once you get the hang of the motion it closes.GREAT for tall kids. The straps don't dig into my son's neck and he has plenty of space.Kid and mom cup holders!Does feel low when pushing but for the price it's a great stroller!

Author: Romi
Title: This is an awesome travel stroller!!!
Body: I was hesitant to purchase this as I was concerned it might be too big or bulkier than what I wanted…but if you want something pretty sturdy, built well, but still light enough and compact enough to keep in the trunk (I have a small Toyota Corolla) this is an awesome stroller!! I used it for the first time to accompany my daughter’s class on a field trip and it was great! Indoors and outdoors it was light but handled well, fit stuff at bottom and was easy to open and close. My daughter is a big 1-year old and this stroller was comfy and felt sturdy. It’s got good handling and feels nice while rolling. I love it! Folded up easily and fits in trunk with lots of room to spare. I know I’ll be able to use it for a while still and confident I can take it on long day trips or short errands to target or walks around the park. Wheels are good and handled several different textures of ground. Get it, it’s worth the little extra $ over the summer brand or cheaper umbrella strollers that are lighter. I wish I got it sooner. Quality product. You don’t need to spend hundreds on a compact stroller..this one is a solid choice all around. Speaking from experience with several different strollers and 2 kids.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Nos encantó, solo un detalle hasta el momento... Suelo salir a correr para ejercitame y puedo ver que las gomas delanteras pueden ser toscas para girar en el eje... Pero es algo que ya le vi el truco.

The umbrella shade is sufficient as well.Cons: After minimal use, the wheels started squeaking and it is a very rough ride; Not enough to bother my toddler (that I could tell), but enough to rattle my coffee out of the lid. Cup holder and caddy could be a little deeper. The one-hand-fold feature is doable, but not always easy.Not much room to complain considering the low price of this stroller.

Author: Cynthia M. Haynes
Title: Not as easy to fold as advertised

I have to push it up against something to get it to fold. I watched a you tube video that gave me a tip on how to make the folding easier.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Chris and Amanda Miller
Title: Does not work for bigger kid
Body: I am writing this review because I could not find any with this information when I was looking. I got this for my almost 4 year old to take to Disney. We already have a stroller that she is almost grown out of and I wanted a new one that moves easier and she had more room in. When I looked this had great reviews, the weight limit was enough and she would be able to fit. Now, she did fit in it. She is about 40lbs and 42inches tall. It does move very well with her in it. It folds easily and compactly. But I had some problems with it.While she does fit, her head touches the cover, her feet have nowhere to comfortably go since her legs are longer and when she dangles them they hit the wheels and make it hard to move. It sits lower to the ground which makes the handles lower and can be annoying for taller people having to hunch over. The cup holders would have been great except that none of her cups fit in her tray and the tray didnt swivel so it would have to be completely removed for her to comfortably get in and out. The parent tray also did not fit any of my cups and is really only useful for plastic water bottles but I usually carry refillable bottles.In comparison I already own a Urbini Reversi Stroller that we got when she had just turned 1. She is pushing the weight limit on this one which makes pushing it a bit harder but the benefits of it over the new one are that its higher off the ground with a longer seat giving her feet somewhere to go other than in front of the wheels. The much larger canopy is very nice, she does fit in it length wise even though shes getting too heavy for it. The storage on the bottom is also bigger and 'easier' to access which says alot because its storage has been annoying since I got it.I just wanted to add this review for the parents looking for something for a bigger kid. I would recommend something different because this just wasnt it.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Judy Carpenter
Title: Functional and Cost-Effective
Body: After several park and zoo outings with a strong 2-year old, I’m very happy with this stroller. Easy to put together, transport, maneuver, and it is holding up well! I especially like the under-seat layer for carrying my back-pack and our extra coats. Perfect for this Grandma!

Author: Kima W

Body: I mean the title says it all... I tried using a more expensive brand of stroller and that stroller broke within six months and it was too bulky it just didn't lay down flat enough ....this stroller is perfect!!! it's a light weight, it's easy to store away, easy to maneuver and it won't break on you in 6 months trust me my daughter had hers for maybe three years and I just bought one for my son... worth every penny every time

Satisfied for the most part! Would recommend it

Title: Small cup holders

Author: Holly Staley
Title: SQUEAKS SO LOUD
Body: I bought this stroller specifically for our Disney vacation. It practically ruined the happiest place on Earth. After one day, it started squeaking so loud the whole park could hear it. I thought maybe we just got a defective one, but then we passed another family with the same stroller and I could also hear theirs squeaking a mile away. In the end, we decided to save our sanity and spent $34528 dollars buying a brand new stroller at Disney and leaving this squeaky monster behind. Don't waste your money.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: DLN
Title: Good but small!
Body: I was not expecting this to be so small from the reviews. It talks about how big the basket it and I can barely fit the diaper bag down there! But we bought this to travel to Disney World, and I know they have size requirements. It is light and folds pretty easily and quickly! My toddler is 2 but 38 inches tall and I have to keep reminding him to put his feet on the little step or his feet drag on the wheels so that will probably get annoying at Disney World. The wheels maneuver good and it’s easy to push, if you are really tall it may be too short to comfortably push.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Kolcraft
Body: Awesome stroller for walking in the park on paved surfaces. This stroller also stands up which is a great space saver in my Rogue.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Body: This was supposed to be a like new, in original not damaged box stroller. Instead I got a dirty, broken stroller complete with beer bottle caps in the box. So disappointed.

Author: Alyssa
Title: Just okay

Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Awful purchase
Body: I bought this based off the high reviews, and storage space underneath. I was honestly expecting much better quality for this price of an umbrella stroller. To me, this stroller is very poorly made, the storage underneath is a joke. It has no stability and whatever you put in it, it almost touches the ground. It also has no front netting on the storage by the kids foot rest and anything can easily slide out. The kids tray has no clasp/clip to easily take off for them to quickly go in and out as they please. The whole tray must be taken off. As far as stability of the stroller, it feels and looks very cheap. The “springs” on the front wheels are strictly only for looks, it’s a cheap piece of plastic that covers the metal underneath. I feel like I have no control when pushing the stroller and it is just all over the place. Would absolutely NOT recommend, especially for this price.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Brooks
Title: Stroller
Body: I love this stroller.very light weight folds up with one hand has a large basket for carrying things. the only drawback is it’s not the greatest for infants that can’t set up by themselves.

Author: Sandra Gomez
Title: Es muy debil
Body: Compramos este stroller para usarlo en los viajes de Thanksgiving and navidad pero vemos es muy debil que pensamos que no va a pasar la prueba de aqui a que nos vallamos de viaje, es muy debil cuando lo usamos por la acera hace mucho ruido y tenemos que levantarlo cuando cruzamos una linea de la acera, es facil de usar sobre la calle., el arnes de seguridad es muy apretado y muy duro para regular, y cuando lo doblamos la parte de atras queda por fuera y esto hace que el cochesito quede de forma parada y cuando queremos ponerlo en la parte de atras del nustro carro el solo se vuelve a armar por que no es muy fuerte

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: SQUEEKY
Body: After only 2-3 uses the loudest noises have started coming from the wheels. It’s so loud and I was so embarrassed using it around Disney and the airport because of the noise coming from it. When it’s folded, the latch to lock it doesn’t stay. The back piece doesn’t come up right enough in my opinion and doesn’t lay back enough. For the price of this stroller I was very disappointed in this product. I wish I would have spent more to get a better quality product. It is easy to fold and light weight, but it’s made very cheaply.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Cici Crespo
Title: Wish I waited to purchase
Body: I bought this stroller knowing my newborn wasn’t going to fit in it so I waited until she could. I bought this stroller in July and wish I didn’t because now that my daughter is 3 months and can fit into the stroller but I can’t return it. My problem with the stroller is that I used it only 4 times and on that 4th time it started making squeaky noises. I feel like Debo coming down the street. If you ever watched the movie Friday then you will know what I’m talking about. Other then that it’s a good stroller.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Mitch
Title: Kolcraft Cloud sport cheaper and better
Body: Kolcraft has almost the exact same stroller (Kolcraft Cloud Sport) at Walmart for $50. The ones at Walmart have different designs but the difference is this stroller does not have a cover to the canopy window, does not have strap covers, does not have little pockets on the inside. The Kolcraft Cloud Sport has all of that and it’s $30 cheaper! Both are extremely lightweight, have a fairly compact fold, same size basket, recline, snack tray, cup holders, etc!! I actually ended up liking the designs on the cheaper one more, not to mention the all black frame and wheels!! I would definitely check out the other model before spending the extra $30 on this one. I bought both and compared after realizing the display at Walmart had more than what this one showed up with.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Melinda Cortez
Title: Love it
Body: I love it and is amazing! The only problem I have is Amazon had charged me twice and still haven’t gotten a refund.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Lololu
Title: It’s okay
Body: My daughter purchased the stroller for me to use with my granddaughter. I walk the dog multiple times a day, and take my granddaughter with me.Pros: the stroller is extremely light. It’s easy to put in the car. This stroller also has an extended shade screen, which is very nice on those bright sunny days. There is a removable snack tray which is very secure. It’s a great place for my granddaughter to hold the “treasures” we collect as we walk. Another tray with cup holder forParents. There is also a large basket underneath.Cons: the removable tray, hard to take off.When tilting the stroller back, to maneuver over a curb, the front wheels don’t always align straight and we have almost tipped over.Finally, when folding, front wheels have to be positioned so it will completely collapse.Overall, I think it’s a good buy.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

They aren’t a full circle and can’t hold a cup without squishing the cup and spilling the contents inside. I does not fit my sons water bottle. The little tray for adults does not fit anything like a wallet or phone. I am currently debating keeping it due to the hassle of returning or just returning and getting a new one.

Author: ES
Title: very light stroller
Body: The stroller arrived on time and I was very excited to receive it.When I first opened the package, I was so disappointed because it required assembly. I almost sent it back because the assembly looked very complicated. I had to watch the videos several times but was finally able to put it together. I am a grandmother and not good with assembly and instructions. It took over an hour to put it together, but I am happy that I did not give up.The stroller is very lightweight and easy to maneuver. I especially like that there is a mesh window so you can see the child. My Grandbaby just realized that he can see me too and now looks back at me when we are walking. I have owned other strollers before and this is the easiest to put in my car and it takes up less room in my trunk. The folded measaurements are also smaller than most strollers, that is one of the reasons I bought it.Sometimes it is difficult to open it and I am not sure why it does this.I am 5'8 tall and the handle is tall enough for me, but I am not sure how it would work for someone who is taller. I wish the handle was adjustable.Overall this is a great product and I am happy with the purchase
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ann
Title: Not made for everyday
Body: I purchased this stroller as a Grandmother so that I would have a stroller at my house. This is pretty lightweight and that may be the problem. This is not a sturdy stroller and is a bit difficult to manage on uneven pavement. I should have spent more to get a better product.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Lynden Garland
Title: Not what I thought it was going to be
Body: I give this 3 stars because I'm sure this stroller probably works just fine for others (since I've seen folks around town with it) so I didn't want to be overly harsh. My son is a small child relative to other children and he didn't fit well in the seat. He actually seemed too big for it. Also the adjustability of the seat back is a bit awkward since its done with straps. A big inconvenience are cup holders. None of them seem to be made for adult sized cups/ water bottles, and only seem to be sized for baby bottles. Sippy cups we had didn't even fit. The materials of the stroller were of good construction, it was lightweight, and easy to push and maneuver. The reason I marked the folding so low was mainly due to it staying folded. There is a latch that is used to keep the stroller folded. However, it does not stay. So, as you pick up the stroller to put it away, the stroller starts to unfold making it very difficult to manage. I'm not sure this is a product I would purchase again.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ym
Title: Ford pinto of strollers
Body: While the stroller does “fold”, it is then an unwieldy lawn chair one can hardly carry. Maneuverability is akin to a cow, and the front wheels wear away at the storage compartment if it is filled with anything heavier than a kleenex. Four weeks out the compartment has a hole, the rear wheel squeaks like a stuck pig and my wrists are sore from being scrapped by the metal elements while I try to carry the “folded” stroller in one hand and a child in the other. I’d advice paying more for a superior stroller, or less for a cheaper stroller that doesn’t make false promises.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Rodney and Maggie Louis

Body: Doesn’t stay closed The clip barely holds on and it is constantly opening on its own

I don’t need a full size but didn’t want an umbrella stroller either. I took her on a walk today and she loved it. I padded around her with a baby blanket since she is only 3 months old and it was great! Very happy!!!

Author: Morgan
Title: Decent travel stroller
Body: Purchased this to keep in my car and use as an every day/errand stroller. Fits fine in my trunk and I can still fit groceries and anything else with it. Opens easily. Like the storage basket on the bottom. The shade is great, big enough to keep the sun out really well. It’s lightweight and easy to get in and out of the car. Folding it up can be difficult- as other reviews stated, I have to roll it backwards to get the wheels facing the correct direction for it to fold up completely, and if I’m holding my son when I do this it’s pretty hard because as soon as you try to push the stroller into a fold it wants to obviously move forward which turns the wheels again. Definitely not a one hand fold up for me. The tray for the top I have had pop off several times, not a huge deal for me. Honestly my biggest beef with this stroller is that the part of the buckle that goes between my sons legs is so long and not adjustable. I have to keep the sides very tight to try to keep the bottom buckle part completely extended otherwise he slides down super far even in an upright position. He still slides down a little bit but he’s usually not in this stroller for really long periods so it’s okay. I hadn’t seen that mentioned in the reviews I read and if I had known this before I would have gone with a different stroller for this reason. But it’s a decent stroller for the price and works fine for what we need it for.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Carolyn
Title: You get what you pay for
Body: For my granddaughter so I wanted lightweight and easy for the days that I have her, but I have no idea how the stroller got all of the good reviews. The bad reviews were spot on! The stroller does not recline enough for a tired baby or toddler to be able to sleep (halfway comfortably), wheels are a cheap plastic of sorts, very little to no shading and uncomfortable as little to no padding. It IS very lightweight though! That’s the only thing going for it. Already started the return process but what a hassle to have to take it all apart and get it back in the box. Thankfully free returns and dropping at UPS is easy. Have decided to use my son’s old stroller (her daddy) that’s a 34 yo Graco, and worked well for me with 2 boys. Now it will be used by my son’s daughter when she’s here. Bulkier and heavier but does everything I need.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kayla
Title: Beats my old graco stroller
Body: This is sooo easy to assemble and fold!! I ended up getting rid of our graco because it was terrible to try to fold and fit in my car! This one is so lightweight and doesn’t take up much room!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tilaye Z
Title: Nothing special that makes it travel..just a regular “umbrella stroller”
Body: We had to downsize from our regular car seat and stroller duo. We wanted something cheap because it was last minute and I like the big bulky strollers for long term use. This served the purpose. It certainly doesn’t glide it’s way into a fold but it’s easy enough, it’s not one hand and the fold out isn’t very smooth either. It’s just a cheap but decent umbrella stroller. If you want something good quality, feels durable or supreme comfort for your LO..this isn’t it. If you want something efficient, decently priced and simple..this will serve your purpose!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: rebecca belcher
Title: Only lasted for a little while
Body: It was a nice stroller while it lasted! One day it was just impossible to fold down, I tried, my husband tried, and a random man in the Lowes parking lot tried! We ended up leaving the store and shoved it into the back of my car unfolded. Later my husband took apart the part that you squeeze to fold it and found that the cable inside of it had snapped, so now we're without a stroller and on the search for a new one!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

I called customer service and they confirmed that you either had to contact them to get the instructions emailed to you or go to their website. I let them it is know that this was horrably inconvienient as an extra step for the consumer and that good luck finding ther exact stroller as they likely make dozens of styles, they also confirmed that. Even after going to the web site ther are no instructions as ther are too many products and this stroller did not match any one of them.

Author: Juan C Nina
Title: Light and Comfy

Author: Dina Stremel
Title: Airport approved
Body: Bought this for our long air travel with several connections. This stroller was a life saver as we literally had to run at some points. Our 3yo is the average size of 5.5yo, so she’s very big and still fit pretty good in it. It folds very good and slim enough in order to go through the security belts. Heads up if your stroller is too big for the security belt scanner, they will need to manually inspect it and that takes longer time, so the fact that this goes through made a huge difference. We haven’t perfected folding and unfolding it and the manual had absolutely no information on how to do it (go figure). Another thing I noticed is that the seat is somewhat stiff surface so when my kid sat in she didn’t sink in. This was better for keeping her long legs still at a manageable height off the ground. This stroller’s overall clearance off the ground is higher than other lightweight and umbrella strollers. We had a connection in Vienna and I noticed that they had strollers that you can borrow, and they were this exact same kind, but just different color and without logos. Made me feel good about buying this.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jerry Roberts
Title: Great for a grandma.
Body: Love that it is light weight. Great for a grandma.

Author: ETD
Title: Perfect inexpensive stroller!
Body: I don’t understand some of the negative reviews. This stroller is great for the money, perfect actually. If you want a fancy all terrain stroller this isn’t it. This is a travel stroller, umbrella style. If you want fancy you gotta pay for it. This stroller does it’s job. I bought this for my grandchild when she comes to visit for simple convenience and storage. I would not chose this stroller as my only stroller. Nice price point, attractive and comfortable for walks not off roading.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Joy
Title: Disappointing
Body: The stroller is easy to put together, compact, and pretty smooth when walking. The tray is fixed so if you want to swing the tray open to put the child in and out you have to actually unsnap both sides and remove it. The cup holder for a child is extremely small and does not hold any size sippy cup. The tray for adults has two cup holders that do not even hold the average size water bottle. The tray between the holders is a great idea for cell phones but you would have to have an old flip phone for it to fit. Disappointing all the way around.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Title: A Great Deal at this Price

However, after 6 months, it was so heavy that I found I wasn't taking her for walks on my babysitting days. I was skeptical about a stroller that only costs $60-but I love it. It's simple to get it in and out of my car and I can open it with one arm while I carry the baby in the other. Our sidewalks are very uneven, but this stroller is so light it goes over them easily. For casual use, you can't beat this stroller.

It's lightweight, comfy for the little one, but to be honest, the best feature is that it stands up on its own when folded.

Author: Louis McGrath
Title: Terrible wheels.
Body: The stroller itself was just what we were looking for. A light weight stroller , reasonably priced that could be easily folded and used for travel. The problem , however, is the wheels. They are thin,hollow plastic wheels that you might see on a doll stroller. I figured more than a lap or two around the block and they'd be in shreds and useless.For the price I wasn't expecting a stroller that would last decades but doubt this would last more than a week.A shame, because other than the wheels, I think we would have been satisfied. Would have gladly paid additional for better quality wheels.Note: this unit had previously been returned as evidenced by a previous shipping label that was removed. I wonder whether that return was also due to this issue.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Momonthego
Title: Great quality and great price!
Body: Bought for my heavy set 6mo. Old baby just for shopping/running errands. It's Perfect! Had a csection so anything too heavy or with extra bells and whistles was a big no. Compact and light enough for me but also has nice little features that I couldn't get with an umbrella stroller. Basket is perfect size, parent tray and child tray are convenient. Also saw some reviews about it being a bit tricky to fold....not true...I could carry my 20 lb. 6mo baby and fold it with one hand. So lightweight and folds easy! Just follow instructions people. Lol. Yes it doesn't lie flat for sleeping but it reclines enough for them to be comfortable. Lastly, easy to assemble (again...just follow instructions) and was delivered right on time! Excellent!

It does lack in a couple of things such as the material of the seat is a cheaper quality then my other brands of strollers (I have had 7 strollers with my 3 kids), the parent tray doesn’t fit many beverage cup sizes, the child snack tray doesn’t fit many of the different sizes of sippy cups either (it does fit the Walmart cup for $1). In my opinion it does tip easily when your child is standing in the seat facing the parent. And the stroller tipped over when my 10 month old baby was using the basket to support himself to stand up.

Author: Kidd
Title: Good Enough
Body: We bought this stroller for our two and a half year old because we needed something light weight while traveling that would accommodate her size. About 30 lbs and a almost 3 feet I suppose. (I haven’t measured her in a while). Anyway, she fit it well but was too long for the stroller (she’s a tall kid somehow - I’m short. Her dad is a head above me) so we had to keep reminding her to put her feet on the foot rest while in motion. Everything worked out but it was well-worn with just an 8 day trip. The cloth was fine and the structural integrity showed use. The wheels were somewhat compromised by the time we got back but they still roll. We gate checked it at the airport to take the load off the little one until boarding. It fit well in our rental. It was easy to fold and stow away in a large travel bag. The storage compartment on the bottom is small. It didn’t really lock in place without effort. And the cup holder did not hold her toddler water bottles although they did accommodate regular size plastic water bottles you get from most any store.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: TeacherTonya
Title: You get what you pay for
Body: I've had this stroller a few months now. It is just OK. It does fold up relatively easily, as compared to my last stroller. It is also lightweight. It folds up much bigger than I expected. It feels very cheaply made. I bought it because I liked that it had a place for me to put my phone and the undercarriage was easily accessible, all of which are true. The undercarriage is also accessible from the front, which I don't really like. You could place something there and it could roll out the front. To lift or lower the back of the seat, you just tighten or loosen a strap. It doesn't provide much support for my little one, who looks very uncomfortable in it. The thing I dislike most is that there is nothing between the legs from the tray to the seat. Unless you hook your child in using the seat belt, they can easily fall through. I wouldn't suggest this as a long-term stroller. Already shopping for my next one.Update 12/2021My disdain for this stroller has slowly increased with time. The biggest thing that I'm not liking now is the angle of the back. My little one looks so uncomfortable! There is a little strap to raise and lower the back, but it doesn't go down enough for her to take a nap comfortably, and all the way up isn't comfortable to sit. I'm currently looking at a higher quality/price stroller to replace this one. I really hate it that much!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: DeAnn S
Title: Difficult to fold
Body: This stroller is a royal pain to fold and unfold. The hype that it it has “convenient one-hand fold” is patently false. Folding absolutely does require two hands and is difficult even then. First, you have to slide a button sideways and, while holding it, use your other hand to depress a lever. As you do that, the sunshade support will snap back and smack your fingers if you’re not careful. Next, as you reach down and forward to bring the seat up and back while keeping the lever depressed, you won’t find anything to easily grab. There should be a metal bar below and parallel to the seat front; instead, you have to fumble with the seat’s diagonal side supports. After all that, the thing won’t fold more than 2/3 of the way unless you lean down and use your hand to physically rotate the front wheels such that they nest into the rear wheels. It’s gross to have to touch the wheel treads that have been rolling through who knows what. I’m sending this stroller back. I’ll be avoiding the Kolcraft brand from now on because of this product’s poor design and the company’s misleading advertising.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

There are 2 big downfalls with this stroller (at least when I compare to my current stroller)1. It has the convenient handle trigger for folding, but it takes both hands and a foot to get it folded2. The front and rear wheels have no sort of alignment when you do fold it up (shown in photos), so the wheels can easily get distorted if you keep it stored in folded position for long periods of time, and because of that it takes me longer to fold and it makes it difficult to fold it

Author: Crystal Adkins
Title: Cup holders don’t hold any of our cups
Body: Pros:1. Easy to assemble2. Love the extended canopy3. It looks nice4. The harness restraint is easily detachable, but it is sewn in, so I guess your child has no choice but to have the clips dig into their back. (Would’ve been nice if you could completely remove them for toddlers)5. Basket underneath will be able to store quite a bit of stuff6. Buttons on the handle are easily pushed to collapse (I’ve had a couple strollers over the years where the buttons either didn’t work or were difficult to squeeze)Cons:***#1: why I may send this back, because the cup holders aren’t big enough to hold anything!! (For parents) Not a coffee tumbler, not a Yeti, none of my water bottles. Also, none of my daughters cups (she has 6 different kinds designed for toddlers) fit in the child’s cup holders.2. It’s not terribly difficult to fold, but if the front wheels aren’t facing the right way, then it won’t collapse all the way. This is still much easier to collapse than our other stroller and not a big deal, but I can already see if I’m in a hurry, I may get frustrated.

Title: Great for the price.
Body: I use this stroller because we live on the third floor and my jogger was to heavy to haul around and get in and out of buildings with ease. This stroller is great. It’s compact and super light weight. Baby seems simi comfortable in it. The only downside is IT IS NOT ONE HAND UNFOLD. You still need two hands to unfold which makes it tricky when you’re holding a baby but it’s still easier than putting together a giant jogger. If you have something to push it up against when closing it then it only requires one hand. The under basket is very small bit can hold a small diaper bag. All in all great stroller for stores, airports and light walks.

Body: The best part of this stroller is the easy use (folding and unfolding) and low price. It is also light weight which makes it easy to move around for the wife and I. We bought the stroller for our granddaughter and she loves it. Now with another granddaughter on the way it will really pay for itself.

Body: I love how lightweight this stroller is and easy to fold and manage.

Author: Samreen
Title: Good Quality
Body: I bought this stroller as the other one I had was too heavy to carry around for an evening walk. Its lite in weight but still sturdy and easy to move around. I wish this would have folded more. This is not as compact as I through but still not that difficult to move around. The material is good quality and love the options of glass cup holders and trays.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Dilbar

Body: This stroller is perfect size , durable, lightweight ,and has plenty of storage underneath. Cup holders are very sturdy. Very pleased with the quality. I would recommend this stroller to anyone.

Author: Carleigh Keller
Title: get what you pay for
Body: Love the size and how easy it is to push! A little tricky closing it though! Still worth the money!

Author: Storme Lyn Bruce Cates
Title: Great light weight stroller!
Body: I wanted something small and not bulky because I have very little truck space to haul a stroller. I am very satisfied with this stroller and it definitely exceeded my expectations!

Author: Jane Lavigne
Title: Great stroller
Body: The stroller folds very easy with one hand, very light and my 3 year old grandson is very comfortable in it, I recommend this stroller over the umbrella strollers, the basket underneath is large enough to fit an oversized purse and a few other items. The tray for the child is great for a child’s cup and snacks, the 2 cup holders on top are very nice. Occasionally the front wheels get turned around but when this happens it’s easy enough to turn them, I give this stroller a high rating!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Bobbi Bennett
Title: Must have
Body: This stroller is amazing! You can not only push it with one hand but lift it into the car trunk with one hand as well! Not to mention how well it turns and fit down those tight shopping aisles.

Body: The first time I folded it up it was a bit stiff but worked much easier the second time and after that.

Author: Tene Jackson

Title: Perfect
Body: This stroller is perfect. Small and compact. Perfect my my son who is under a year old. Also my son loves it. He likes the sun not in his eyes because the extended visor shade
