Author: EV
Title: Love it
Body: Great travel stroller. We also use it for walks around the neighborhood, mall, etc. I like the features available like the extended awning and tray. Wish it had a better storage lever because it doesn't lock closed very conveniently. Otherwise, very happy with this and would highly recommend.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Dwight
Title: Good budget / light weight option
Body: This stroller is light. That is why we bought it, for travel. Seems fairly sturdy. It turns with ease. It also stands on its own when folded and fairly stable at that too.Now the bad. Our little one always seems slumped in the seat. I think it is because the angle the seat and back meet. It does not fold easy, the wheels have to be in just the right spot. The little lever to keep it closed always comes undeone.We bought this in lieu of a normal umbrella stroller. If space was our biggest issue probably would have just gone umbrella, but the little under storage is nice for a small bag and umbrellas don't have that. I would recommend this to anyone who can overlook some of the drawbacks.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Crosby W. Hall
Title: Great stroller!
Body: This stroller is perfect! We bought it for a vacation. It has storage, cup holders (for kid and parents), and a snack tray! You really can fold and unfold with one hand. I like that it stands upright when collapsed. My friend was with me and had the 3D Lite stroller, smaller storage, no cup holders or snack tray, and was not as easy to open (and more $$). This stroller is a total win!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Good but needs new hook and bigger cup holders.
Body: Easy to fold but whoever invented didn’t think about when the stroller is tightly folded that the hook on the side doesn’t stay. The hook on the side needs to be shorter because it won’t stay hooked and comes unfolded super easy. Also, yeti cups won’t fit in parent cup holder so I was kinda disappointed in that.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Lynda Gongora
Title: Very disappointed with the packaging
Body: Received this to give for a gift and the box came as if it had been open with holes. Couldn’t even give this as a gift at the baby shower. Very disappointed in this product and the packaging.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kelsey
Title: Served its purpose well
Body: We bought this stroller to use in the airport as well as out and about on vacation. It has an ample sun shade, the tray is great for restaurants, the wheels held up well, and it was surprisingly maneuverable. The underneath storage basket was spacious, and the material wipes clean easily. While the back does not recline a ton, it does have some recline which is useful. This stroller was perfect for the airport, and it held up through 4 flights being gatechecked (in a bag) and a week of heavy use on vacation. The only downsides are the cupholders are too small for big bottles but do fit smaller kids cups, and the folding feature requires one hand on the handle as well as upward force on the tray to fully fold, requiring another hand or foot to do that, and the locking mechanism prevents it from folding in the most condensed form (does not fold up small like an umbrella stroller). Overall we are very pleased with this purchase and intend to use it during our next travels.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Filoola
Title: Difficult to turn and maneuver
Body: Front wheels get stuck. The stroller is very difficult to turn especially when coming out of a door. The waist harness belts are very hard to adjust. It is not easy to fold/unfold - you definitely need 2 hands. Stroller performance keeps getting worse the more I use it.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: JOCILE IRWIN
Title: MISSING PARTS
Body: WHILE PUTTING THE REAR WHEELS ON, DISCOVERED MISSING 3 VITAL PARTS:(WASHER, COTTON PINS, HUB CAPS) I CHECKED EVERY THING THAT CAME IN THE BOX, NOT THERE.CAN YOU SEE HOW FRUSTRATING! NOW I HAVE TO GO THROUGH THE INCONVENIENCE OF PACKAGING BACK IN THE BOX TO RETURN. I SHOULD KNOW BETTER THAN PURCHASE A STROLLER MADE IN CHINA.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Robyn
Title: Lightweight, BUT..
Body: This stroller was excellent for travel. We have a jogger as well. We got this one for our family Disney trip. It was nice because the folding was East, it was lightweight as described, and it had a small storage at bottom. My only con was that it did not fit most sippy cups. The cup holders were too small. I do wish the storage compartment at bottom was larger. Also, my 2yo is on the taller side. She was uncomfortable in this because there was not enough leg room. The footrest was at the lowest position and she still was too tall.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Mcz
Title: Great compact stroller
Body: Love this stroller perfect for car rides and vacations lots of storage comfortable
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Joan B.
Title: Not always easy to fold.

Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Dawn
Title: Doesn't close after a while
Body: I received this stroller as a gift for my baby shower. I was slightly disappointed that the seat didn't recline lower, but it wasn't a deal breaker. Other than that, I loved this stroller until recently when it stopped closing. We were leaving Great Adventure and had to practically break it in half to get it to close. We used it one more time after that and couldn't get it to close at all! Luckily I had my truck and could throw it in the back fully opened. Unfortunately, I will be shopping around for another light weight stroller.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Title: Great compact stroller

The seat doesn't lay flat like most popular strollers but it does lay semi so come naptime, they will lay comfortably.The straps are sturdy and help keep child in stroller. It's easy to maneuver and drive on concrete and asphlat. Not so good in grass or beachy sand. The wheels won't rotate and it gets stuck. But drives nice on flat surfaces.

Author: Lover of turtles❤️
Title: Love this stroller!
Body: I was looking for a cheap stroller I could use for our season passes to Universal Studios for my 5 year old. She meets the weight limits for this stroller but the seat is pretty short. It does it's job though. I actually love pushing her in this stroller because it moves and turns so good, even with a 40 something pound kid sitting in it. And it is super light. Folding it is easy but sometimes it seems to get stuck and won't fold all the way in. Not a huge issue for me because the ease of pushing her in it makes any less favorable issue seem like nothing.

Author: zotbot

Mom is retired so something lightweight!It is lightweight, easy to assemble but not super sturdy and I kept slamming my finger into the top bar when closing.. and there's no way around it. Not sure if anyone else has had this issue?

Author: S. L.

Body: I bought this stroller to use as a lightweight stroller for my 1 year old. After trying it a few times, the back doesn't sit up 90 degrees like I originally thought and she is constantly sliding down in it. The seat is awkward and isn't very comfortable for her. Also, my husband who is just under 6ft tall has to slightly bend to push it...so not good for taller people. I wish I could return this but after putting it together, it would be too much work to take apart and repack. Its disappointing for sure.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: TT
Title: Great stroller

Author: KMS
Title: great quality
Body: Very lightweight and easy to operate. Great price!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Looks Great, Operates Poorly
Body: I bought this as an alternative to an Umbrella Stroller for additional storage.... BIG mistake.And while this stroller looks GREAT in pictures and descriptions, HOWEVER--- it is very cheaply made.The wheels are squeaky and not durable--we bump a corner and it completely dented--they were wobbly and looked like they were going to fall off.The part that supports the back of child, only goes up so far--so the angle at which your child is sitting (more like laying) is extremely awkward---which normally would be okay if the harness part would keep them up, but ieven that is a thin strap and an annoying buckle that doesn't secure the child very well---poor boy's man bits we coming out of his diaper and shorts......The part where the child would be able to put their feet for added support, is sloped at an angle that makes it impossible for the feet to lay on, and it's not secure.....Basically, my child looked like a big blob of ooze who couldn't hold himself up and was falling out of the side.Folding this thing---was a NIGHTMARE---the concept is great--the practice, not so much....and the thing that locks it, doesn't even line up with the bar to lock it. And unfolding it is annoying, especially when you have a toddler in your other arm--- you have to use both hands and a leg to get this thing to lock into place...Just don't buy it.... it's a complete waste of money because you're just going to have to buy a different one...
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: M. Wong
Title: Great product! Very happy with my purchase
Body: We took this on a road trip with us to Disney World and it worked great! So easy to collapse and space saving too. It is sturdy and maneuverable, yet light and easy to lift. Highly recommend!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Rahulp
Title: Windows without flap cover
Body: This stroller has 2 windows one on the top and other at the back. Both the nets are without flap so no protection from wind and sun. Secondly my child is 3 yrs old and she is not at all comfortable in this stroller. I wish it could recline more.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jhersson Godoy
Title: Easy to use
Body: Easy to use
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Great stroller
Body: Lightweight , comfortable, & easy to use! Good sun protection.Good price!Love It!!!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Morenaza Alvarez
Title: Muy bueno
Body: Bonito color igual ala foto ligero y facil de llevar me gusto lo recomiendo
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Rajesh Kannan
Title: Very good product !!
Body: Light weight , Easy to handle and easy to carry ..11 months old son is enjoying his ride 🙂
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kylie Fyfe
Title: AMAZING in every way!!
Body: This stroller is AMAZING for everything, but especially travel!! It’s really lightweight which is great since you cannot take strollers that are over 11 lbs through security. I traveled with a toddler and this stroller was a LIFESAVER! It was so easy to fold up that I didn’t take my son out until I was at the airplane door. Also, we took the stroller to the beach and it rolled so smoothly and sand did not stick to the wheels! I have tried many strollers, but this is by far the BEST!!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Smurphs1
Title: Squeaky wheel after 5 uses
Body: First off very easy assembly. I purchased this to replace an older stroller we loved but outgrew it. This is perfect if you are looking for a light weight stroller that doesn't take up much trunk space for our Hyundai Elantra as well as something with decent storage. I was able to take this on a couple different surfaces such as gravel, sidewalk, dirt, and pavement it rode wonderfully I have no doubt it'll do fine in the snow. Plenty of storage in the bottom for diaper bag and shopping bags.Update I've had this for about a month and the left wheel is now squeaky after about 5th use. So that's disappointing and annoying
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: ChYnaD0l1
Title: Perfect and Lightweight
Body: I love this stroller for our days out shopping. It’s was super easy to assemble as well.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jessica
Title: Sensitive stroller. .
Body: I did a lot of shopping around before buying. This stroller is the best bang for your buck. My son is on the taller side for his age and it's a great fit for him. His last stroller didn't last long and he could touch the wheels with his feet. This sits far back enough that he is sits more comfortably and high enough. I am very happy with my purchase...... Update: I lowered my stars because the stroller is very sensitive over cracks or uneven surfaces. It's like a skateboard over cracks. It will jolt your kid forward over deep cracks and bumps. I have to stop a lean the stroller back to go over and uneven surface.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Vika Cupnaia
Title: Quality is not that great
Body: The back of the stroller not adjustable much ... so it’s not that comfortable for my daughter to sit there
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Stone
Title: Worth the buy.
Body: This stroller served its purpose, which was to be a travel stroller. It is light weight and quite easy to manoeuvre. The major issues for me are:1. It not really being able to fold with one hand easily. On some days I was able to and on most days I had to ask someone to push the tray towards me if I was holding my daughter in my other hand.2. The bottom of the seat not being able to turn up so that my baby could extend her legs.3. The seat not being able to recline more. I used a neck pillow to head in place.I would purchase again.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Cheryl
Title: Folds up and fits in a trunk
Body: Fits in a trunk! The standing feature is okay, easy to lift up. The lock functionally useless.The cup holders are too small for every bottle/cup we have, even the adult tray.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kevin L Buchin
Title: Not good quality
Body: It is definitely light weight, but the furthest our baby can sit up in it is still at about a 45° angle and that's with the strap I'm the back to bring it up as tight as it can be. Also when trying to fold it back together it won't clasp with the hook because if you fold it all the way shut the hook reaches way past the post its supposed to sit on. It has to be particularly unfolded to clasp and even then it doesn't hold if you are moving it around because its completely flimsy. Its a stroller that works in the context of getting baby from point a to point b, but really not good quality at all.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: hannah
Title: A little hard to fold. But a good size
Body: I have had trouble folding it. But it’s the perfect size for what we need
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sara
Title: I like it
Body: Really worth it and affordable price.!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Alice D.
Title: Perfect
Body: Perfect size, and weight for when our grandson comes over.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Brandi A. Burgio

Body: Terrible product.The back wheel looked like it was about to fall off.Stroller stopped folding after 3 months.Seat started slanting after 5 months.Didn’t feel safe enough to put my child in.

Author: Ludmila Bostan
Title: Easy to use
Body: Great product!!!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Beyond happy with this stroller!
Body: It’s so hard to fight the “right” stroller but it has everything I wanted in a lightweight stroller. Great basket size, cup holders for me & a tray for the baby. Most lightweight stroller don’t have the tray. Definitely recommend it, easily folded, very light & just practical. Can’t beat the price!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: brittany hoagland
Title: Great product for short children
Body: This is a great product for short children. My child is two and her feet drag the ground. So great product if you child is two feet tall or smaller.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: ill nona
Title: Meh- It’s ok. Good backup.
Body: Good not great- excellent for me to manuever at 5’2. Low for everyone taller than me. My daughter is 36 inches and it’s almost too small. Cup holder has no purpose.?
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: khepner3
Title: Perfect traveling stroller
Body: Folding and unfolding can be frustrating if trying to do it quickly, due to the front wheels but it is perfect for traveling. Very lightweight and maneuvers great
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Mld
Title: Looks and works great
Body: Perfect for my almost 3 year old
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kristi Makinde
Title: Replaced other stroller for every day trips
Body: I have a small trunk and am currently pregnant, so getting my bigger stroller in and out of the car was a hassle. This one is perfect, light and my daughter doesn’t care about the difference at all. She likes her cup holder and tray :)
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Samantha T.
Title: best stroller ever
Body: We have twins who are nearly two. we have tried multiple styles and price ranges of stroller. we were going on a trip and anticipating a lot of walking- double strollers are a hassle to load/unload and get through doors, etc. wanted something more than just a typical umbrella stroller. these have been our go to strollers ever since. i kept saying out loud how much i loved them the first dozen or so times. at first i thought the cup holders were too small but no, u can jam a drink down im there and its not going anywhere until you really want it to. i love how much shade they provide. snack tray is a necessity- snacks can be provided or its a platform for toys. incredibly light weight and easy to fold/unfold. they stand upright when folded. im heavily pregnant now and these are so easy to use compared to our larger stroller. between the underneath storage and me hanging a bag across the back- more than enough storage. and i like the way they look. we have the red and the gray ones and both are very nice, hood quality for the price
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: L. Bowles
Title: Great for quick trips with older baby
Body: I purchased this to use while keeping new grand baby. It takes some assembly but nothing too difficult. It’s not hard to close but I certainly can’t close it with one hand as advertised. I’m most disappointed that it doesn’t recline anywhere near flat. I’m not sure I will be able to comfortably use it until baby is able to sit up 😕 It is very light, easy to lift and load into the car. I think eventually it will be perfect for quick trips around town. For the money it will work fine!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jewell Batson
Title: Smooth!!
Body: Easy to use. Grandson loves it!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Dani E.
Title: Hey Mom - you need this
Body: This is a basic in my household. Ever since my son was 3 months old we've been able to use this product. It's lightweight and easy to throw in the car. It sometimes takes a little extra oomph to fold it up, but overall I really can't complain. The price, the use, it's a basic necessity. For all parents out there on the run with other kids, this is a must have.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: bree
Title: Great Lightweight Stroller
Body: I love this stroller. With so many on the market, it is a little overwhelming to decide. This was easy to assemble and is very sturdy for being so lightweight. The sun visor actually blocks the sun and I love the tray. AND it folds with both trays on it. Yay!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: S.Lofton
Title: One hand folding system flawed
Body: Would have liked to rate this product 4+ stars but the one hand fold mechanism recently stopped working and now we have a stroller that won’t fold down. We’ve only had this product since April and have only used it a handful of times for our 9month old.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: kate horman
Title: Great stroller for the price
Body: The wheels can sometimes get in the way of folding. But nothing too bad. Other than that this stroller is great. I got it to take to Europe. It handled all the cobblestone roads and was light enough to lift over stairs. The basket was great to throw extra jackets and souvenirs in.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tracy L. Stewart
Title: Easy to use
Body: Perfect size
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Autumn
Title: Comfortable easy to carry stroller
Body: Loved it at Disney she fell asleep so easily
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Viet N.
Title: Pretty nice!
Body: Bought this for my 19 month old son. It’s light-weight, easy to control, and the sun visor on top has good coverage. Also, it has a good storage bin at the bottom. It seems nicely made and durable. My son loves going in and out of it. The latch is easy to press with one hand to fold, but the way the wheels align sometimes it is hard to fold completely down. Im hoping after using it a few more times I’ll figure it out. I also wish we were able to change the height of the handle. I’m short and my husband is tall, so being able to adjust it would have been great. Also it’s nice that the back can go up or down, so if the baby is sleeping it can be in reclining position. The problem is that you have to use two hands to adjust the strap. Overall, its pretty good for the price. I would recommend this for someone who is looking for a smaller stroller.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: FENESE CARTER
Title: Summer Stroller
Body: It's easy to fold once I learned how. It's very light
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Cindy
Title: Very small, and light. Worth the money!
Body: I love how compact the stroller is. It is very lightweight, and very maneuverable. There is a weird plastic smell, but I’m hoping it goes away once I take it outside.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Christine Lemoine
Title: So lightweight and easy to use
Body: I wish the wheels weren’t plastic
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Danielle
Title: Lightweight
Body: It’s so easy to fold and lightweight to carry. Small enough to take into stores but sturdy enough for everyday walks.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Angel
Title: really light
Body: The item is really light and worths the price.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Deanna
Title: Horribly flawed
Body: This is the absolute worst.1) the “shocks” On the front wheels do absolutely nothing.2) The “all-terrain “tires are plastic and make for a very bumpy ride. Because they are advertised all-terrain I was expecting something more rubberized.3) the sun shade SUCKS. It is not movable so I can’t cover the front of baby if we’re facing the sun. If we’re not facing the sun, baby It’s completely unprotected from the back, due to the fact that the back is made of netting. No matter which direction he’s facing, baby is completely in the sunlight
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: allwaysambie
Title: Highly recommend
Body: I cannot say enough great things about this stroller. It is super light weight, easy to fold and pushes very easily and smoothly. The only thing that I don't like is the cup holders are small. They're too thin to hold his sippy cups, so I've had to lay it down on the tray until recently when I bought an additional stroller bag. I'm so happy with this purchase. We've taken it to all day trips to the zoo and other outings and it's been amazing! My guy is pretty big too (35+ lbs and over 3ft), but he fired just fine.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Faheema
Title: Seat belts are not strong enough, kids can undo them easily!
Body: I like the light weight and easy to push with one hand. Put the seat belts are not secure and strong enough. The belts are cheap and not as I expected.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tayesha
Title: Lightweight and easy to drive
Body: Easy to steer, super light, and love that it has trays for the toddler and parents. I will say that the cup hold should be a little bigger. Also would’ve been nice if the toddler tray would flip up so they can hop in instead of being carried in just some minor feedback but overall I really do like it.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Brittany Easley
Title: Pretty good
Body: Wheels aren’t the sturdiest, basket could be bigger/deeper, and seat could be more comfortable, but it is a good value for the money.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Becky
Title: Some good points...
Body: Easy to fold and it’s lightweight BUT, it is always in a slightly reclining position and if you’re walking a curious 8-month-old in a mall or populated place (zoo, park, etc.), I find that he gets frustrated trying to sit up and look around. Another feature is that the seat is short ( from back to front) and tilts down a little. The positives are that it is really easy to take in and out of the car and has good maneuverability. I am going to see if I can make him a thin wedge that I can put behind his back so he can sit up a little more.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Lo ligero que es
Body: Muy cómodo
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: The Reed
Title: Great choice for the price!
Body: Overall, we like this stroller :) It worked well for the international travel and it is very light!However, I find it difficult (or not working at all) for one hand folding - I typically use my both hands to close it. Also, compare to our previous one, this stroller doesn't fold as compact - the height remain the same when u fold, which takes up our mini SUV's trunk in length. Altho I appreciate both kids' and adults' cup holders, they are too small for most of the bottles we have.However, we are happy with the purchase for the price!!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: April & Tim
Title: Get it !!!!
Body: With three kids I wanted a LIGHT stroller for thr baby and it's perfect. I can fold this up no issue and pick it up without struggling. No issues on wheels giving out or anything and I've used this SO much since having. Defiently recommend
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: GigiWoman
Title: Good product
Body: Works well. Some difficulty for me to figure out the folding ability.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tee
Title: Compact
Body: Great on grass, and stones. Easy to get around small places. Smooth ride. Light weight. Easy to fold.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jean B.
Title: Lightweight and lays back for sleep
Body: Way better than my heavy car seat stroller combo! Light enough that I can hold my baby in one arm and fold up & put in the trunk of the car with the other! Not as light as a small umbrella stroller but much more sturdy. I like having a tray with cup holder and shade to block the sun. I also like having the option to lay it down when she falls asleep when we are out.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Melissa
Title: Good
Body: Great stroller
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Miriam Peniche
Title: Good value and very lightweight
Body: This stroller is very light weight and easy to fold most of the time. Sometimes it gets stuck. Also after a while the wheels started to squeak. But over all it’s a good stroller and it’s reasonably priced
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Light weight stroller
Body: This is awesome except the strap in the seat crouch area is way too thin. We put a shoulder strap on it to help keep the strap in place (from sliding to the side).
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Christian Keele
Title: Good little stroller at a good price
Body: Easy to assemble and rides smooth! Perfect travel size.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Deborah F.
Title: Reasonable price
Body: Adequate for price
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sina
Title: Cheaply Made
Body: The stroller was not what I expected. It is cheaply made. The wheels are a thin plastic. The back portion feels like cardboard. I would not purchase this product again.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jennifer A Hanson
Title: Easy and light!
Body: Great little stroller! Size-wise, it's kind of in between an umbrella stroller and regular size, but much nicer than an umbrella stroller. The basket at the bottom holds more than you would think--we used it for a changing set with diapers, wipes, pad as well as a bag of rain ponchos for five. We got it for a Disney trip, but will be using it much more. Very lightweight, easy to open and close (for getting on monorail and trams!), comfortable for baby, and easy to push. The features that set this one apart from some of the others for me were the tray for eating (not sure why you wouldn't want one--it's removable if you don't need it), cup holders for baby and parents, extended sun shade (practically a necessity in Florida), and the ability to recline seat or sit up straight.The two very minor issues I could mention are that the cup holders are small (larger cups and sippies won't fit) and there are two tabs to set the break instead of one like our large stroller. As I said, very minor and did not interfere with our enjoyment of the stroller. Very happy with this purchase!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Angie
Title: Great Value
Body: We were looking for a quality, yet not expensive stroller. We are very satisfied. It seems sturdy, yet light weight, easy to handle.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Yosmel
Title: Excelente
Body: Súper práctico
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kanchan
Title: It is light and can easily be folded with just one click.
Body: I am in love with this stroller. It is so light and easy to handle and carry. I definitely recommend this product.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Francine
Title: Love this stroller.
Body: Bought this for when my grandson comes over and we can go for walks. It is just the right height for me and easy to manuever. I like it really well!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: KHamel
Title: Fair deal
Body: Perfect for what I needed it for but not very comfy for longer strolls- back is flat and hard
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Richard R Mister
Title: Great stroller
Body: Bought this stroller for a trip to Georgia with my son. We wanted something that was easy to travel with, but wasn't as flimsy as an umbrella stroller, and something that had a tray and reclined for snacks and naps on the go. This was the perfect solution. Easy to fold, smooth riding wheels, and the handle was tall enough (I'm 6'3). The only complaint is that its a bit bulky and takes up a lot of room in the trunk. But the benefits far outweigh this minor issue.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Melissa Howard
Title: Cheap
Body: Small stroller and very flimsy. Would not recommend.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: mike
Title: good stroller lite,convenient,easy to handle.
Body: the cover is to short.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: PAMELA MODAFFARI
Title: Lightweight
Body: For the price it’s a great stroller. If your road is bumpy, don’t expect a smooth ride. The hook on the side to keep it closed is a poor design and not useful. The canopy window is a nice feature but the morning sun still hits the child’s eyes. I just needed something at my house, so I wasn’t looking for a deluxe model.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: zela4Eva
Title: Light
Body: Very light has space inside but it started giving problems to close up early on so we sent it back.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Danielle McGrath
Title: Stroller
Body: To small and the box was damaged with no instructions
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jenna K.
Title: Easy to fold, lightweight, bumpy ride
Body: I purchased this at Walmart and they didn't have a demo on the shelf. It was easy to put together and easy to fold. It's so lightweight. But that's about the best things I can say. I found it to be very bumpy, it doesn't sit up enough for when my daughter prefers to sit up more, and I wasnt to fond of the height. I'm 5'5 and found it in uncomfortable to push, I couldn't imagine someone taller than me having an easier time.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: connie
Title: light weight
Body: I absolutely love this stroller! I have been looking everywhere for a light weight and easy rolling stroller for a long time but didn't want just a regular umbrella one because I wanted a tray in front and a basket under it for storage. The canopy covers really good and it also has a see through net so you can see your child or they can see you and I can actually maneuver with one hand. I have read that some think the tray cup holder isn't big enough but I find it holds a sippy cup and a snack cup just fine. The only con is I have a hard time folding it but I think it's just me because my Grandson has no problem getting it to fold. It's also narrower than a regular stroller so it fits through aisles at the store better then the big bulky ones. If you want a light weight great stroller this is the one to get, glad I did and I looked at several other ones first.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Skyler Steed
Title: Super awesome product. Feels cheap because of we
Body: Loved it. The only reason it was returned is because UPS damaged the packaging which resulted in damage to the product. Reordered product and it is perfect.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: S
Title: Good stroller
Body: Great Reviews. Very light, easy to maneuver. Folding can be one hand but doesn’t always work easily.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: diana
Title: Easiest stroller I’ve ever handled
Body: Best stroller!!!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: James R K
Title: Easy
Body: Very nice.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: A. H.
Title: Back wheel bar is in the way!
Body: It’s fine, but not worth the money.Pros: This stroller folds down fairly small and is light. There is a mesh window at the top.Cons: I have difficulty aligning the wheels while trying to fold it up. The wheel bar for the back wheels is in the way and I constantly kick it. I can’t wear open shoes while using this stroller. The window on top is just mesh, so sun always shines through.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Taliamecca
Title: Not heavy duty but perfect for lightweight travel.
Body: My 2 year old is 33 lbs and very active. This stroller is perfect for me to pop in and out of my vehicle, secure her and wheel her around. The front and back trays come in handy and there is plenty of storage underneath. I recommend this stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Cathy Krieger
Title: All works well except for the limited shade umbrella which is too small.
Body: The shade umbrella is not adequate.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not totally as described.
Body: I purchased this stroller based on the positive reviews. Sadly, I am disappointed. While it serves its purpose as a fairly light stroller, which makes it great for travel. there are several downsides. It is definitely not as easy to fold as described. It requires two hands and at times manipulation of the front wheels in order for it to close completely. When it does, the lock does not attach properly and the basket frame touches the floor. The cup holders are very small and will not hold my daughters sippy cups. The basket storage is ok. Don’t plan on fitting a diaper bag. The material is extremely difficult to keep clean. It reclines back a decent amount. I wish it functioned exactly as the manufacturer described but it does not.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not worth it.
Body: I really wanted to love this. After over a month of use - I hate it. It squeaks non stop with the back wheels. I have to apologize to people around me. It has to annoy them as much as it does me. The turning radius also, not great. I would not buy it again. I could not reccomend it to anyone that plans on using it for long stretches of time.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

The easily accessible storage was just a pleasant extra! On the con side: the recline isn’t very deep, the kid tray doesn’t swing open and closed (so placing a larger child in the stroller may be tricky), and again, it’s a cheap plastic (lightweight!) stroller, that is just fine for pushing around town, malls, amusement parks, etc. and folds up pretty flat for public transit or the back of your car.

Title: Loved the ease, hate the cupholders
Body: We bought this stroller for our trip to Disneyland. We wanted something not quite so heavy duty as our big stroller but more functional than our umbrella stroller. This was perfect in between. It is VERY lightweight, which is a huge plus. Our very tall 4-year-old fit in it nicely. The storage basket is big and easy to get to. The tray and cupholders leave something to be desired. Only a plastic water bottle will fit in them, not the standard drink you would get from a restaurant or a kid's sippy cup. Also, I didn't realize that the child's tray is snapped into place and not easy to remove. So we had to lift our daughter in and out of the stroller.Overall, I'd recommend this, but it has room to improve.

Author: A. Clark
Title: best lightweight stroller for the money
Body: I bought this stroller to keep at my house for my granddaughter. It is very easy to store, maneuver, and handle in almost any situation. Fits easily in my car trunk. My granddaughter just turned a year old and loves riding in this stroller, with her own little tray in front of her for drinks and snacks. She has taken naps as well as walks in it and is very comfortable. The sun visor is long enough to keep her shady and cool. There's roomy storage underneath in the basket. The adult tray is OK, but the cup holders are a bit small. I found it necessary to use an extra snap on bag for stuff, and I usually fit a small coffee thermos in it, so it's not a big deal. I usually remove the snap on bag before folding up stroller to put in the car, which someone else may not prefer, but again, a very small inconvenience to me. Would highly recommend this durable, lightweight, and easy to use stroller.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Title: It's OK at best.
Body: The stroller seems great at first but after a few months use it's not as versatile or as easy to close. The front wheels get jammed frequently making it hard to go straight. The worst part is closing it now. At first it seemed fine but now it is almost a pain to get closed I don't know if the squeeze in handle has worn or what but I almost have to jam it into the ground to get it to close/fold in. Opening is still easy but closing has made this a stroller I would not recommend or buy again. There is no way my wife could close this and I literally had to squeeze the handle my hardest while pushing the front wheels into the ground to get it to finally close and this is a re occurrence not just once in a while.

Author: Alicia M. Austin
Title: It's great, but the cupholders are weird
Body: To preface this, I am accustomed to a behemoth of a jogging stroller with regular/big cupholders. We bought this stroller to take to Disneyworld.Pros: This stroller is SO LIGHT and it folds SO EASILY. It has a one-hand folding system which is really helpful when you're short on hands. The seatback reclines. It has a five point seatbelt for those kids that won't stay in the seat AND the shoulder straps hook into the bottom clips, so you don't have to completely unbuckle your kid to release the shoulder straps. The sun shade actually extends further down than I was expecting, which is a nice bonus.Cons: Because it's super light, it can be difficult to lock the brakes without a child or something heavy in the seat - the whole stroller tips if you aren't paying attention. Because it's a compact stroller, the storage basket beneath it is smaller and can hold a small backpack. In my opinion, those negatives are minor because the trade-off is a lightweight stroller.The only major issue I have with this stroller is the cupholders - I have no idea why they were designed the way that they were, but they don't fit most cups. My Yeti is 2 3/4 inches at the bottom and it doesn't fit into the cupholder because the cupholder is not a true circle. It was designed with an indent in the cupholder which makes it more of a waxing moon shape instead of a circle. This is annoying because, while water bottles and smaller cups/bottles (like 20oz pop bottles, paper/flexible plastic takeout cups, etc) will fit in the cupholders, the regular-sized ones (like Yeti, Tervis, Nalgene, S'well, etc) will not fit. (I haven't tested out the Disney meal plan cups yet, but I'll be surprised if they fit in the cupholder.) This is compounded by the fact that the storage area between the cup holders cannot be used as a cupholder either because the one-hand folding mechanism is right over it. So - if you are accustomed to using anything bigger than a 20oz pop bottle and want to use this stroller for a trip, it basically does not have cupholders that you can use. This may not be a big deal to you, but I was disappointed to realize this after I had purchased the stroller.If you are not worried about the cupholders, this stroller is great (especially for the price). Even with the cupholders, I'm pleased with it.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Lauren S
Title: Lightweight and so much storage!
Body: We bought this as a lightweight stroller for travel and love it!! I researched a lot of strollers to find one that was both lightweight and had a nice sized canopy and found this one.Pros:-it’s super light-the canopy blocks a lot of sunlight-it fits through X-ray machines at the airport-the storage basket is so big my boppy even fits!-the handles are comfortable and far enough out that I’m not kicking the bottom of the stroller, unlike other ones we tried.Cons-the cup holders are a little small. We could fit a plastic water bottle (like Dasani) but not our reusable water bottle.-the stroller is a little hard to close and open without the kids tray, but it’s a little hard to get them into the stroller when the tray is there. Minor complaint, but seemed worth mentioning.-this stroller doesn’t fit in the standard umbrella stroller gate check bags, the wheels make it too fat :(Overall the pros far outweigh the cons and we’re super happy with our purchase!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Cynthia P.
Title: Kid always looks uncomfortable
Body: I wish I had bought a different stroller. My 21lb 10 month old grandson never looks comfortable in this one. I keep playing with straps and angles but he still slides too far forward so that the front strap is very tight and there is no support for his legs. Instead of drifting off to sleep he’s doing happy baby yoga poses. The seat isn’t angled properly. It’s light, but it doesn’t fold up tight. The directions to put it together were terrible. I will say I like the red color, and for a short stroll it works fine. But I am not pleased with my purchase.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: RHONDA L FAIRRES
Title: Not so great
Body: The stroller is okay but for like twenty bucks more I was able to get something way better. I was so excited to finally get this stroller but when I assembled it I was noticing things that I really didn’t like. In order to even put the seat up and down you have to move it with a clasp which was not easy to do. I couldn’t get mine to stay up at all. With that being said the actual seat itself is literally almost all cardboard. There’s no cushion to it once so ever which I wouldn’t want my child to have to sit in or nap it. I don’t recommend this stroller. Like I said a few more dollars can get you something better.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Rob
Title: Saved $$ buying this instead!!
Body: My 4-year-old son (40 lbs) likes to wander, so on walks he needs to be in a stroller or on a leash. He is getting older and I know he will do better with age, so I didn't want to spend the big bucks on a jogging stroller, etc., to get a stroller that fits over 50 lbs. This stroller perfectly fits our needs. He sits upright strapped in comfortably and securely (that he can't unbuckle!!), the added safety (for him and me!!) of a tray in front of him that fits a 16.9 oz water bottle perfectly without falling over on bumps and holds a snack if needed, has little side pockets next to him in his seat to put a couple little toys if he wants, and a large canopy that gives him great shade. I have a comfy handlebar I can push with one hand, two cup holders that hold 16.9 oz water bottles perfectly without falling over on bumps, a small tray that holds my phone and keys, a large basket for storage, and easy to operate brakes. The stroller is easy to fold (you do have to take off the tray to fold up, but no big deal) and stands upright. I'm 5'2 and don't feel as if the handlebar is too high, which I have with other strollers. Quality stroller at a great price!!!!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

It has good storage space in the bottom bin and a place for my water, phone, ect. in the top tray. My only complaints are that when you try to fold it up or if my daughter folds back the canopy while she is in it, it will slam on your fingers. You have to be careful to avoid that when folding it up to store it. I'm also not crazy about how the tray clips into the front. There's no easy release where my daughter can quickly get in and out. You pretty much have to pop off the entire tray to let her out. Other than that, the price point and light weight are worth it for me.

Author: MW
Title: Poor quality - Lightweight, but likely won't survive travel
Body: The stroller's packaging was damaged and the frame of the stroller was noticeably bent when we attempted to follow step 1 of the instructions for assembly. I wouldn't trust the durability of this lightweight product and will consider other options.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: LeoKman
Title: Very handy to use!
Body: we lost our big baby stroller due to a transit nightmare at airport, so we bought this one to replace it. I must say that we are happy with this purchase!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: just J
Title: Great
Body: Love it but wish it rolled when collapsed
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: kristi m kling
Title: It was missing pieces
Body: Not happy it came broken
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Vero:)
Title: So far so good!
Body: First week and it's worth the money for now. Will return to write more in a couple of months.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tracy
Title: Lightweight
Body: We bought this to replace our large/heavy infant stroller for traveling. This item was extremely light and compact for its size, only good things about it.It was not a one handed fold stroller and not good for use on anything other than very smooth surfaces. After 10 days of vacation use our wheels are squeaking and have holes in them. However it did what we wanted it for. After a few days of actual use we wished we had more storage space, the basket on bottom is good for loose items only, not bags or a small backpack even. The parent cup holders are useless, very small and in the way of the handle for pushing. Hard to get child in and out of the seat unless they are small because the tray is stationary so you have to pull the child up and out of the seat.Our son is 4 years old, 32 pounds and 41 tall, and he looked like a very large kid in it! The actual seat depth is only 9 and the back doesn't lay completely flat. It has a strap on the back that you loosen or tighten to recline the seat, kind of weird.Not good for napping at all. Had to put the seat belt on him, even though he said it hurt him, to prevent him from slipping out.I would say this is good for smaller children and the weight rating should be less than stated, it was a bit hard to maneuver with our son sitting in it.Glad it wasn't too expensive or we would be very unhappy with purchase because we can't return it now that it has been used.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ashley Beckwith
Title: perfect for in the car, easy to go stroller
Body: This is the perfect size to keep in your car, travel with or anything you need. I have a 2 year old and we both love this thing!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Mary
Title: Great product
Body: Easy assembly. Kids love it. I have a 5 yr old who fits perfectly.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Lightweight and mobile

Author: JordanF
Title: Great stroller for the price.
Body: The stroller is great for the price. It was so easy to assemble. My 3 1/2-year-old daughter really likes it. Would recommend.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ruby S. Rivas
Title: Not good for taller babies/toddlers
Body: Stroller was easy to assemble.Nice color (red) unfortunately the material is on the cheap side. I guess this stroller is just for emergency’s or short trips. Not ideal for tall babies. My daughter is tall and her feet almost touch the ground. I decided to only use this stroller on short trips. I guess you get what you pay for with this stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Fold and operates easily
Body: Simplified functions. Folds compact and not too heavy.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Holling
Title: Great little stroller !
Body: There are nicer strollers but this is a great price and value!The only thing that is slightly annoying is the cup holder.....too small for MAM bottles and newer sized drink cups.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Aaron L. Wall
Title: Great for traveling!
Body: We bought this stroller after discovering our Graco stroller wouldn’t fit on the conveyor belt going through TSA (it caused a bit of trouble). So for our next flight, we bought this stroller and it’s so lightweight and comfortable for our little man. Great buy!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Keith J.
Title: Exactly what i needed!
Body: Stroller is lightweight but not flimsy by any means. Easy to put together. You only have to attach the wheels and the trays of the stroller , which takes about 10 mins tops. It's lightweight, it reclines well, easy to clean(mostly cloth), and folds effortlessly. For about $65 bucks, it's worth it.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: seat back not so great
Body: purchased this stroller to use for my great grandchild when I take him on walks. the stroller assembled well and seems to be quite sturdy. the back of the seat however is a disappointment. it is quite soft with no support in it. the description says multi positions but basically there are no positions...you have to adjust the straps at the level you want....nothing clicks into place,etc. I plan on keeping it and using it as soon as our weather breaks. hopefully the seat back will not be too much of a problem. I do think a better description of the seat back is needed or at least let possible customers know there is no real support and positioning there.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: SherP
Title: Easy to push
Body: Love this stroller for travel. Very light weight and great wheels making the stroller easy to push on uneven pavement. Storage underneath is decent but the cup holders are narrow. It holds a bottle of water not a wider sippy cup and the bottle falls out because it is not deep enough. But the ease of strolling makes up for it. I put my water bottle in the bottom storage bind.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Easy to use and hassle free
Body: Just the right size for my car trunk without taking up all the space,no hassle to use
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kathy Srock
Title: Back Wheels Broke Off
Body: I gave this product as a gift. Within two uses the back wheels snapped off. A replacement is on its way.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Alicia Marie Cordero
Title: wheels are weird but everything else perfect.
Body: love love love this stroller. i love the features and how light it is, i also love how it can fold even with the tray still attached AND how there is a lock as well. i cant wait to actually use it for my trip, im going to mexico and visit family for 5 weeks so this has the perfect amount of features, room, cup holders and the tray is a lot better than the other stroller i have. the only complaint is that it might be easy to tip over if you put something on handles (but with how light it actually is that is whats to be expected) also the wheels are a little weird. i dont know how to explain it but they are just weird lol.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jeepers!
Title: GOOD QUALITY STROLLER @ AN AFFORDABLE PRICE!
Body: We babysit our great-granddaughter (who just turned 1 year old) frequently and this stroller is perfect for taking her on walks in the neighborhood, the zoo, and wherever! The stroller is very lightweight and folds up so it easy to carry. We are VERY pleased with our purchase of the Kolcraft stroller!!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Saranne
Title: To get the right color
Body: I ordered the red and got the grey one instead. Very upset with this..

Author: Lisa Penna
Title: Great “Throw Away” stroller
Body: After reading a ton of reviews I am disappointed in myself for this purchase. Yes it’s lightweight. Yes it’s really easy to fold. But man is it Rickety! Not stable over rough concrete. And forget about rocks or pebbles in the road. The first time we used it the kids stained it otherwise it would be sent back to purchase a more expensive but higher quality lightweight stroller.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Michelle
Title: Great affordable stroller!
Body: Love this stroller! For the price is awesome to throw in the car and pop up when I need it. Love the storage it has.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Mrs. Le
Title: It squeaks!
Body: After about a month in from buying this stroller, the wheels starting to squeaks!!! So embarrassing as I'm pushing my baby to the school or at the mall. People are looking and all I could do is smile. Don't have the box to return it. What can I do?
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sara
Title: Great stroller!
Body: Love this lightweight stroller. It was easy to assemble, it’s easy to push, and love the storage underneath the stroller. Would definitely recommend!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Florance
Title: NO FOOTREST.
Body: The only thing I was disappointed in is the footrest. There isn’t one. So, if your baby is lying back (not very far but I knew that) the baby’s feet just hang down. There really isn’t very much depth to it. Our grandson is only 4 months old, and I wanted something lightweight that could stay in my car in order to pull out quickly to take him for a quick errand.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ashley Potter
Title: A nice stroller for travel.
Body: Great little travel stroller, I use this a lot, it definitely holds up with travel and has a lot of amenities, but I will say it is hard to fold until you learn how to line up the wheels just right, after that it’s easier. The cup holders are so small I don’t own anything that fits in it, mostly I use it to hold my keys. The storage is nice, although my diaper bag BARELY fits and once it’s in there nothing else can fit. So don’t buy it expecting an umbrella stroller with full stroller amenities, it’s still just an umbrella stroller.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: EASY TO HANDLE
Body: I bought this for my son & daughter in law. They LOVE it!!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: K long
Title: Great for Disneyland trip!
Body: We are bought this for our Disneyland trip and I have to say this is perfect!!! It’s compact lightweight and our sun could easily nap in this! Definitely recommend!!!

Author: chris snow
Title: Easy to open/close! very easy to assemble!
Body: We own a car seat travel system, but it was cumbersome for quick trips. So we bought this stroller. Its AWESOME! It has underneath storage, a retractable cover for sun. Its a breeze to open and close, not to mention assemble. Anyone can put this together in 20 mins.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tabby
Title: Cupholders are useless
Body: Great product, however I bought BC of the cup holders, but they are practically useless. They are super small and won't even hold a standard soda bottle. It may can fit a bottle of water but that's about it. Not even a child's sippy cup can fit in there. Very disappointing. Other than that I like it.Update: still don't like it. It rides smooth, but the sun shade is useless also. Sun still gets in my son's eyes. He is 1. Wish I hadn't wasted money in this.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sookie
Title: Pretty good for the price
Body: I bought this specifically for my toddlers Disney trip. It worked great. It did take me some practice to open/close it, but once you get the hang, it’s super easy! I have a more expensive umbrella stroller and I like this one better for the trays. They are very practical and worked great during our trip. I like the handle a lot as well. The only downside for me is that it doesn’t recline much. After the Disney trip. We took an international trip and it survived being tossed around. I am really happy with this and if it ever breaks I will get another one.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jade Swagerty

It's bad for his back to sit like this. Food rest is not adjustable, so I don't see how we can solve this problem. Will have to return.

Easy to manage and I wouldn’t recommend folding up the stroller with things in the basket since I lost a sippy cup that way and almost lost my sons jacket, other than that I Love it and would highly recommend it!!

Author: KTD
Title: I regret buying this stroller
Body: I regret buying this stroller. There is almost no under carriage storage. I can barely squeeze my diaper bag under the stroller, and once it’s stuffed in, I cannot easily get it out. Also, the cup holders are a joke. They are too small to hold a water bottle, a baby bottle or a child’s snack cup. Honestly, I’ve not found anything that will fit in the cup holders. Overall, I wish I had researched this stroll more before buying because it does not meet my needs of taking my 1-year old out places and having storage for all of the stuff that hours along with a baby.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: It nice
Body: It nice
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: nataliee
Title: Pretty good for the price point
Body: Back is hard, feels almost like it’s made out of cardboard, the straps aren’t super comfortable but do seem stitched well. The canopy is nice and big which is good to block the sun. I like that it’s lightweight but it’s not super easy to collapse or extend (not as easy as I’d like while traveling). It’s ok but not super amazing.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kathleen A Keeley
Title: Easy to push
Body: Easy to push
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ulises

Author: Lina Peterson
Title: Perfect size
Body: This is a medium size stroller. I needed one that was bigger than the $20 one but smaller than my jogging stroller. It’s perfect. The only complaint it the drink holder is so small. I needed a one hand folder with storage for my phone on the top and a bit extra storage underneath for his stuff.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kayla
Title: Perfect.
Body: This is exactly what I was looking for! Our original one-seater was a Baby Trend jogger. It was great but bulky and heavy. When we had baby #2, we got a Joovy double stroller. It also has its good points, but of course it’s even heavier and harder to muscle around than the Baby Trend was (being a double). Enter this guy. Now that baby #1 is old enough to mostly walk everywhere, this thing is my new best friend. It’s incredibly light (I carry it with one arm), folds down compact for my trunk, stands up by itself when it’s folded, and still has all the features you just get attached to with your bigger strollers (5-point harness, window canopy, parent tray, removable kiddo tray, front shocks, reclining seat, storage basket...). I don’t know how they did it, but I’m a huge fan.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: JMF
Title: Great lightweight stroller
Body: My grandson has a pretty large and durable stroller. But, it is very cumbersome to put in and out of the car trunk and to open up and close. I wanted a smaller, more lightweight and portable stroller to use with him. I read the reviews and decided on this stroller. I am so glad that I did. It is perfect. It is definitely lightweight. It is simple to set up and close. Yet, it is durable and sturdy. I did see many strollers that were smaller and they were very flimsy. I also wanted a stroller with the foot ledge, tray across his front, safety belt and sun cover on it. This stroller has all of these and also a holder on the bottom to keep items in. My husband also pushes it at times and it he does not hit his feet on it and uses it fine. It was very reasonably priced and is very well made. We have been using it for months and definitely recommend it.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: zhibinlin
Title: good
Body: good
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Anne
Title: nice for what i paid thru amazon not hard to put together
Body: decent stroller and space
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: harshad mane
Title: Wheels don't move rotate when closed so you cant drag it when closed, you need tp lift it
Body: Overall quality: okProblems:The wheels of this stroller will not move and front wheels get jammed with rear wheels when you close the stroller, so you need to always lift it and carry it (13lb is not a very light-weight, needs your both hands considering the size).I have an umbrella stroller worth half of the price and its wheels do rotate even in closed position, so I do not need to lift it, I can drag it effortlessly.The tray in front of the seating kid is not movable, so you always need to lift your kid to put inside, un-necessary to lift for a kid who can walk on own.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Cookie
Title: One hand opens and closes this stroller..
Body: The size of this stroller makes it easy to get through airport security.. Has cup holders two for parent and one for your child.. Even though this stroller is inexpensive stroller is of high quality and the convenience is every mothers dream.. I would buy this stroller again.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Title: Great buy
Body: My grandson is tree and still uses this

Body: The product didn't attend my needs. It's so uncomfortable to my son, it's impossible to use the basket and it seems to be manufactured with low quality materials. I changed first to the Summer Infant 3D Lite and it is worst than the first. Finally I spend a little bit more and bought the Summer Infant 3D PAC, that is amazing.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jill
Title: A waste of money
Body: I honestly bought this for the reviews and I was very disappointed. It is cheaply made and not well made. The seat back doesn’t recline much and the sunshade should be longer. The clips to strap in are cheap and very hard to use if you have any hand or joint issues. Unfortunately I waited too long to return this and now I am stuck with it.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: ScampW
Title: Carriage
Body: Easy to breakdown and carry into car for a grandmother
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Emersome Angeltoes
Title: Great for what we needed it for
Body: We needed one to stroll our grandbaby in so the expensive one didn't get sandy. It did the beach well and dried quickly. It has cheap material so I wouldn't trust it with a lot of weight. But for what we needed it for, it was good.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: vladybug3
Title: Very light
Body: So far so good!! Enjoying it
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Zanim
Title: Had slightly higher expectations
Body: Received this yesterday. Assembly was easy. It’s somewhat sturdier than a regular parachute stroller. What I didn’t like is 1) the buckle strap has no shoulder pads which is quite uncomfortable 2) there is no cushion or padding or support in between the legs beside the belt so my little one keeps sliding except the buckle prevents it but I can’t imagine the discomfort having the buckle press against the area and 3) there isn’t an upright position. It’s always in slight recline which means my little one has to push himself forward to get his munchies from the snack tray.I’m assuming the stroller will do for short trips here and there but I can’t imahine my LO being in it for longer periods of time.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Parker
Title: Great buy for the price
Body: Wow! I am impressed with everything about this stroller! My son even loves it and he can tell it’s big boy stroller! It is really lightweight just folds a lot different from our old stroller which will take some getting used to. The only thing is that I didn’t like much was the recliner part. But the bottle has tons of space and I love all the cup holders!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Nikki Keever
Title: Affordable, well designed
Body: Purchased for family we adopted for the holidays with several children, youngest 7 weeks old. They were thrilled!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: China White
Title: No bueno
Body: It’s too small smaller than u think it feels cheap
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: LAJ
Title: Nice for the price.
Body: I liked the price and it looks like it will work fine. A bit complicated to assemble.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: J. Watkins
Title: Travel Stroller
Body: We got this as a backup travel stroller to take out of town because it was lightweight and folds up fairly easy. No, it's not the best quality stroller ever made, but it's done pretty well. If you're looking for something that you wouldn't be too upset about getting broken by baggage handlers if you're taking it on a flight, but something better than an umbrella stroller, this is ideal.My biggest qualm about this is that the visor part that folds down to help shield the sun is just not substantial enough. We live in Florida so we need sun protection, and when we've used it out of town the sun has been beaming down as well so that's my biggest annoyance.With that said, we still use it quite frequently and my daughter seems to like it. She asks for the red stroller a lot. It's always been handy when relatives with children come into town and we need a backup. Overall, worth the money spent for sure.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Gilbert Sao
Title: Foot holder
Body: Foot holder is too low
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not good quality and not practical.
Body: The stroller has very cheap quality, it doesn't close properly and the worst is when you get to close it, all the stuff you have underneath in the storage come out. I had a version of this, the Beep stroller and it was amazing but this is supposed to be a better version and is def not. I do not recommend this stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: SimplyTee
Title: Durable Stroller
Body: I like it because its small and folds easily and lightweight , its perfect!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: abraham noya
Title: You get what you pay for
Body: Great for a convenience stroller because it’s light weight and easy to maneuver but you get what you pay for. The seat adjustment isn’t that great nor does it look comfortable like other strollers. Feels like a cardboard.. But it’s good for the price and looks nice. Had it for almost 2 months and it has worked fine.

Author: Jerome
Title: Great Umbrella Stroller!
Body: We bought this for our first trip via plane. The stroller held up for 4 flights and the 10 days of our trip! Highly recommend. Our 10 month old was comfortable and there was plenty of storage for us to keep things in the basket. It is slightly larger than a regular umbrella stroller, but we were able to squeeze it into a protective stroller bag to gate check it.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: steven krammes
Title: Looks great

Author: katie
Title: Great for travel but not good for every day stroller
Body: This stroller is great for occasional travel but definitely not for every day use. All three cup holders are too small to fit an adult or child’s cup that I own. I tried to fit a bottle, sippy cup, and an adult tumbler cupAnd none will fit. I’m not sure the type of cup that would fit in the cup holders? Stroller pushes great, better than I thought for an inexpensive stroller. Very lightweight and inexpensive compared to other strollers. I have three kids and this is the 7th stroller I’ve owned. I’m returning it because it didn’t meet my needs. The cup holders not fitting any kind of cup or bottle was a problem. It is not a one hand close stroller as stated. This close requires two hands and is very awkward. I have small hands and found this close to be difficult. Also I could not push it with one hand, because the location of the large closing mechanism is right in the middle of the handle bar which causes you to have to select a side to push from, and doesn’t push straight very well. Once closed the stroller is not locked closed, and comes open as you try to put it in and out of the car. There may have been a manual clasp to keep it closed, but that’s too much work for something I thought was a one handed close. Most strollers automatically lock when in a closed position. I always have a kid or bag in my other hand and one handed criteria is a must for me. The biggest problem was the positioning of the seat. There is no definite seat back, rather my 1yr old was almost in a C shape like laying in a hammock, but more inverted. This caused him to not be able to sit up well and he was almost suspended by the crotch strap. It looked very uncomfortable in the crotch . Other reviews note the lack of back support as well. Of all the strollers we have used, I’ve never seen seat positioning like this.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Stephanie Campbell
Title: Its very good
Body: Like Every thing abt it

Author: Sundhari

Would have returned it but my husband threw the packaging away. The harness is very dinky and the seat, sides, and back have no padding. My baby looks horribly uncomfortable and slouchy in it. I keep hoping as he grows it will work better for him, but at 9 months, his positioning is only slightly improved. Haven't used it once. Very dissatisfied.*Update: Actually works pretty well for a toddler. Still not very comfortable, but light, easy to fold, and has held up well to a lot of use. Increasing from 1 to 3 stars.

Author: Mary Beth Connors
Title: NOT FOR BABIES UNDER 6 MONTHS OLD!!!
Body: This stroller is advertised as infant through toddler but there is NO WAY you can put an infant in it w/o also buying a head support ($20+). I’m a new grandmother and bought it for when my granddaughter comes over, which will be often as she only lives 5 minutes away. The real problem is that the back does not recline enough for a newborn to lay comfortably. And b/c of that, w/o a head support, any newborn will not be able to “sit” in the stroller w/o her head rolling to one side. The stroller is also cheaply made. The foot rest is not fixed...it moves up & down. The harness/straps are not padded and seem scratchy. The only good thing I can say about this stroller is that it is lightweight. But that doesn’t make up for all the other problems. So, overall, it’s an overpriced, poorly made stroller that is not suitable for babies under the age of six months. So disappointed...
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Mom of the Snow State
Title: Very lightweight

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Great Quality and Usability for the Price
Body: First purchased this stroller in early 2017 (?? Can't locate the original order) because the one my daughter had was pretty heavy. Just ordered a new one: The first trip the airline baggage handlers bent one side of the front wheels. :-( Managed to get them fairly straight so continued using it. Then I accidentally backed over it with my car when it was unfolded. Still usable for just over a year. Now, the damaged wheels (see above) have worn out so I'm replacing it.Pros: Light weight, easy to move around. Large basket underneath for storage (hang the diaper bag over the handle). Canopy is large to keep the elements off and baby comfortable (sun, rain snow). Granddaughter loves it, fits her well both awake and asleep. Comfortable and she can't get out of the harness on her own.Cons: No way is it - or was it ever - one handed folding. Takes 2 hands and sometimes it sticks when open and you're trying to close.I think it's great for the price. I would rather buy it again than spend $250+ (other, original stroller) for one that has multiple drawbacks/dislikes.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Black Catt
Title: Horrible- I will have to get another stroller!!!
Body: TERRIBLE. I noticed that at home it wasn't ninble like you have to push necessarily woth the tow hands and FORCE it if you want it to go a certain direction. The front wheel is double and back wheel is single - might have something to do with it. TODAY was the first day I took it out to go shopping with my kid and I had to literally lift it up from the ground in order to turn directions even if just a little. PLUS it swerves to its own mind too!!!! YOU ONLY HAVE ONE HAND TO DO IT ALL AND IT IS NOT ENOUGH WITH THIS PIECE OF CRAP. Also to fold and unfold - it says - one hand- BALONEY - it takes a full two hands and it is STIFF as a corpse. I will have this only for home. I will HAVE to buy another stroller to go out- what a waste of $63 dollars. Please do me a favor. Don't. Even . Think. I don't know how it has all that good reviews bc I feel that this is truly a piece of crap. Thanks for reading.....Add, several months after my mother added some machine oil to the front wheels and it became a lot better. I still would have preferred to have gotten a Chicco BRAVO. Sometimes the low end look gets me too. Especially here bc all the asian tourist stroll around in these high strollers all the time...

Title: A decent stroller for travel
Body: We bought this as a secondary stroller to use for travel. It allowed us to cruise through airports and provided a place for the toddler to nap on the go. It didn't cost much and we got what we paid for. The sun shade and the basket are useful features and less common on a stroller at this price point and size. The biggest issue is that it doesn't recline very far and the seat is slightly angled toward the front so the kid always slides forward against the strap between her legs. It probably isn't very comfortable and looks pretty awkward, but she seems OK with it. Overall, it gets the job done. No major problems.
