Author: N. Wilson
Title: No mid-section support for the babes!
Body: The stroller serves it's purpose in being lightweight and easy to travel with but...after using a few days on our family vacation the wheels are severely warped and chewed up from debris on the sidewalks and road. The biggest issue is that my daughter has no support for her mid-section. She slides down in the seat constantly. wish it would have better support for her and the straps are basic garbage. I would keep this in mind if you decide to purchase this stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Momma3
Title: Not bulky
Body: My neice carried her babies car seat around so i bought her this stroller. It looked so good with her baby and i loved how it was small like an umbrella stroller, but got around better. I had an umbrella stroller that the wheels would get stuck if pushing it, so i purchased one for my daughter. I love it. Its not bulky and can get around in small spaces. It has a cup holder and i like that i can put her bag under the seat on the bottom. I'm very happy with this product. I recommend this stroller for anyone that has an umbrella stroller, this is so much better.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Mrs Rose
Title: Worth the price, great for travel.
Body: lightweight and perfect for traveling. i didnt want to check my UppaBaby Vista (and that stroller is AMAZING). It was worth it to buy this for airplane trips or when i cant fit the huge stroller in my car.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: ECUEmily
Title: ... Disney World for 7 days and it was a great stroller. It reclined enough for our 2
Body: We took this stroller to Disney World for 7 days and it was a great stroller. It reclined enough for our 2.5-year-old to nap for an hour or more every day. Easy to maneuver, lightweight, and the extra storage and cup holders were nice. (The cup holders are small, be sure to check your sippy cups to see if they will fit first)
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: Lightweight and small
Body: I love it. It fits in the back of my little Fiat so makes me happy!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: I love the easy of operation and the fact it is so light!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Momof2
Title: Great inexpensive stroller!
Body: Purchased this for our trip to Disney World... light weight and inexpensive (which is great in case it goes missing). Reclines, large storage basket, and easy to put together!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Donald Longo
Title: Three Stars
Body: unable to make desired seat position
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Bryan Hino
Title: A few added features would be nicer
Body: A few added features would be nicer. Add a hinge for footlift area & increase the recline. Would be willing to pay a bit more for that.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Just a costumer
Title: Five Stars
Body: This stroller is so light and easy to carry and is so compact 👌 when is folded
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: great size and price
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Carrie Robson
Title: Great every day stroller!
Body: A great every day stroller. Easy and quick in and out of the car. And yes, you can do it one handed, while holding a child. I wish the basket was a little larger and it had a front on it. You can potentially push things straight through the back to the front.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Michael G. Perkins
Title: Five Stars
Body: We had a 40 lb 4 year old who love this stroller, easy and light weight
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jenelle Van Horn
Title: Stroller snob approved
Body: I bought this stroller to have a lightweight option that I could travel with. I have a double bob but sometimes just need a single stroller. I was scepticle at first but I have to admit that I love this stroller.It has a built in snack tray and parent tray. Cup holders are really small but that’s my only complaint.Folds easily and I can pull it in and out of the car with one hand. It has a single bar for pushing vs two handles that most umbrella stroller have.I have tried the pockit stroller and city view lite and I like this one better. Smooth ride, reclines well and ample sunshade. Plus, the price! I can wear it out and get a new one if needed!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: JoanieB
Title: Easy to put together
Body: My great grandson loves his rides in his stroller, and I love the excerise!! It was so easy to put together I did it myself.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tara
Title: Great light weight stroller
Body: Great light weight stroller! I really like this stroller a lot the only reason i didnt give it 5 stars is because when you close it you always have to move the wheels so it closes tight so it's not really a '1 hand close' but still - i think it's a really good stroller and would recommend. I like using it for running errands with the little one because of how light it is and he seems very comfortable in it too!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Megha
Title: Four Stars
Body: Pretty light weight, Perfect for travel.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Good lightweight stroller for occassional use
Body: Nice lightweight stroller. It handles well one- handed and is great in tight or crowded spaces. It also opens and closes easily. I bought this to keep in my car instead of the full-size stroller that came with my travel system and use it mainly for shopping and quick outings with either my 3 y/o or 7 m/o. I wouldn't say it is durable enough for daily use and would opt for the full size stroller for walks through the neighborhood or the park to ensure baby's comfort. However, it's perfect for my needs as it offers better control and more options than an umbrella stroller and is much more compact and portable than a full size stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Love it!
Body: I love this stroller. It's super lightweight and folds up easily/very compact. The cup holders are a little small, but do hold a bottle of water/soda. I purchased an additional cup holder that I hooked to the handle and it's perfect. I replaced my large jogging stroller with this.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Addierm97
Title: Love it!!
Body: With a toddler and an infant, and a small suv, this stroller is amazing!! It’s holding up very nicely and I love how easy it is to open with just one hand! Very light weight. I recommend to everyone.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tamara Wenning
Title: Came incomplete, NOT one handed folding
Body: This came without all the parts so I returned it. Also, I ordered it because my husband has limited use of his right hand. This was *NOT* one handed folding. I had to use two hands and my knee. We will just stick with our Britax. It’s so much bigger but you can easily fold with one hand while still holding the baby.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Marsha Ann
Title: Light, but not perfect
Body: Very light and made it through a 10 day trip to Disney World. It is not very balanced so you can't hang anything on the handle bars unless there is a kid sitting in it. The wheels are also not the best for bumpy terrain. Overall it served it's purpose. It's a good stroller to fold and carry on a bus several times a day, but it's not high quality.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: LPetrie
Title: This stroller quickly became my worst enemy
Body: Pro: When open, this stroller works great, rolls smoothly, has a large basket. Essentially, it works as it should.Cons: Too many to list, primarily having to do with opening and closing the stroller. First, it is not easy at all to close, as the one hand close implies. Second, when closed, you can only latch it closed if it is still partially open. It collapses decently tightly, however, you have to open it probably an additional 3-4 to be able to latch it. We regularly use this on trams and trolleys where it needs to be closed for the ride. However, my options are either to latch it, in which case its too big to fit easily on the tram leading to some very awkward struggles, or to close the whole way, and deal with it falling open while I am trying to climb in. Third, while closed the large basket is completely open and now vertical, so anything in there falls out. Finally, it is not easy to open. There is no foot stand to help open it. I have found the only decent way to get it open and locked in place is to grab by the sides and shake until it is open enough to set it down, and then push down on the sides.If you are planning to use this stroller in any situation where it will need to be opened and closed on the go, DO NOT BUY.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: CZ
Title: very sturdy too! Compact enough too fit in any trunck
Body: Very cute and ready to use.. very sturdy too! Compact enough too fit in any trunck..
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jordan Ferguson
Title: Great umbrella stroller for price
Body: A great umbrella stroller. Cup holders are a pitiful size, so I purchased a parent console to attach to it which helped so much! Also, not to wild about the reclining feature. Otherwise, lots of storage. Really easy to push.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Harshada Adesh Hambir
Title: After lot of research & going through many reviews, ...
Body: After lot of research & going through many reviews, I selected this stroller but now within six months, front wheels are going harder. Not able to smoothly take it forward.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Janna
Title: Perfect for travelling and just going for walks
Body: I am super happy with this stroller. Today so many people seem to want giant kiddie vehicles (why?), but I like this one because it is lightweight, carry-able (folds and unfolds well), and easily manueverable. My four-month-old grandson loves his walks in this stroller, and the price was right! If I had to add a con, it would be that there is not a ton of storage space. Nevertheless, for those looking for a lightweight stroller, I recommend this one!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Hazel
Title: Safety
Body: Its smooth ride for any adventure.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Toni T
Title: Five Stars
Body: I love this stroller! Lightweight and simple. Wheels are great on concrete and grass!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Mykeila Goodson
Title: Buy this
Body: Fits perfectly for my 1 month old son. Super easy to put together with and without the instructions. A lot of Ron for storage and diaper bag. And also blocks the sun
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: WeGo1065
Title: Easy to use
Body: Easy to use, very lightweight. My daughter prefers it her regular stroller. I do wish it reclined more. It is a one position stroller
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jana
Title: Super light and easy to fold
Body: Super light and easy to fold . My only complaint is that the cup holders on top for the parents are only wide enough for small ( baby size ) cups
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: fuzzybird6
Title: Not good
Body: This stroller is not suitable for toddlers or people over 5'4 (my height - hubs is 6'2 and it's far too short) my 3 slender year old looks stuffed into this stroller and he can't put his feet on the door test without removing the tray.... Otherwise he get dragv on the ground. Also the adult yay up top will not click into place at all (the tray is warped out of the box) I'm dissatisfied and disappointed - I regret buying this stroller and am not happy that I can't return it.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tiera Gray
Title: We love it !!
Body: Being a single mom when I first took it out the box I thought it would be hard but it Was easy to put together by myself ! The instructions were simple .My 2 year old can’t stay out of it . Inexpensive..A plus for us ! Only thing I wish they had more colors to choose from . I wanted pink but we have red ..it’ll do for now
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: I was very disappointed in the quality and returned it and hour after ...
Body: Very cheap looking.. not worth it at all. I was very disappointed in the quality and returned it and hour after putting it together.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: obert
Title: Bad design
Body: This is a very poor design.The seat strap is not adjustable and the shoulder straps have a little adjustment.There is very little room from the sewn in seat strap so it binds on the child
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: B. Vanlandingham
Title: It is a decent stroller for occasional use. We ...
Body: It is a decent stroller for occasional use. We got it to take our 2 year old grandson to Disney. It would not lasta long time with everyday use.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Christopher N.
Title: Very lightweight. Great buy
Body: Used this on all our European travels with cobblestone everywhere and this lil guy has kept up! Cant believe how light it is. Love the cup holder (for us, it holds our son's treats). Wish the bottom was bigger, but thats just because we have a HUGE diaper bag.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: t stew
Title: It is good for at Grandmas house
Body: It is good for at Grandmas house....Kind of a stepped up version of an umbrella stroller. Definitely not a heavy duty stroller

Author: Penta
Title: Easy and light
Body: I read the reviews and bought this. I love it. It's easy to move around, assemble, fold up, and it's light weight. True to the review I give it a 5 star.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Hector F.
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great product for the price.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ginny T.
Title: I love this stroller !!
Body: Lightweight, easy open and smooth ride. Perfect size for my 2 year old. Luggage bottom for bag and snack tray for child. Reclining seat when napping and canopy for shade. I love this stroller !!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Nikki B
Title: Nice for taller people to push, terrible for kids to sit in!
Body: I needed an umbrella stroller that fit me walking around with my 3 year old...I am 5'6 and this is the perfect height for me. The maneuvering of this is smooth and it got over bumps easier than having to pick up the whole thing.Super easy assembly and you really dont need the instructions if you are used to putting stuff together. I think this will last a long time which is nice. The cover for the head is also nice because when its really sunny or raining you can adjust accordingly.My only complaint: The seat is too narrow. I took this to the zoo for my 3 old and had to keep buckling her in because she would almost slide out. So if you need something where their butt actually sits into it, this would not be for you. Like actual umbrella strollers have the divet in the seat that their butts sit in, this does not have it.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kayla
Title: Easy to put together
Body: Very lightweight. Easy to put together. I would recommend.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Niya
Title: ... I needed a lightweight stroller that would make travel easy. This stroller is amazing
Body: I purchased this stroller because I was travelling to Europe with my 18 month old baby and I needed a lightweight stroller that would make travel easy. This stroller is amazing. It's very sturdy, light and very easy to navigate. We visited 4 different European Countries sometimes by trains/buses. The stroller was perfect and made our travel easy and enjoyable. Will definitely recommend.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ed N Shayne
Title: Hallelujah
Body: Love this stroller, bought it for Disneyland a few months ago and I would purchase again!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Christy F.
Title: Amazing. This stroller was put together fast and I ...
Body: Amazing. This stroller was put together fast and I am VERY impressed. I can carry it myself with one hand and because I have two girls it’s very easy to manage while I’m also trying to gather them. I love the fact it folds and opens up with a one button push. My 10 month old loves it-I actually tested it out by strolling her around the house!I’m VERY PICKY when it comes to the efficiency and manageability of car seats and strollers.... this gets 2 thumbs up! 👍🏼👍🏼
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Bridgette Camarena
Title: I am SUPER pleased with this stroller
Body: I am SUPER pleased with this stroller.Besides being attractive, it's very lightweight and easy to maneuver. Setting up is a breeze. We've gone through 3 other strollers before this one and we're regretting not purchasing this one first.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: cicihearts
Title: Love love love!
Body: There are so many things I like about this stroller. It's easy to maneuver. I like all the stages of the shade, it comes all the way down but has a halfway point and can pull all the way back. The screen window to see your kid doesn't require the opening of a flap you can always see them. The seat reclines to whatever angle you want by tightening the strap. I'm tall and the stroller height is still fine for me. There are two trays both with cupholders. There's a foot rest. I like that the stroller isn't too wide so it's perfect to get through aisles or like I said easy to maneuver and runs smooth. The folding is not one handed it's a little tricky and it doesn't fold down as small as my other stroller (that I ended up returning for other reasons) but it's still not too bad. Last thing I really like the slate color I'm not sure the difference between the plus and the sport because the dimensions are the same on the website. It could just be my imagination but I saw the sport one at Walmart and it looked a little lighter/smaller but very very slightly. Anyway the sport is a little cheaper but I splurged a little mainly for the grey color :) Highly recommend this lightweight stroller.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: FERNANDO MARTINEZ
Title: Five Stars
Body: Nice
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Alexandra S.
Title: Kind of a cheap stroller but works well!
Body: It’s a bit of a pain to try and figure out how to adjust the back of the stroller but it’s a good starter stroller! Nice for a walk but don’t expect to go anywhere but sidewalk with this stroller! These wheels are not made for any other terrain!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Not sastified at all. The seat does NOT stay ...
Body: Not sastified at all. The seat does NOT stay up. The cup holder is too small for my sons sippy cup.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Roberta Fetzer
Title: Very lite weight and easy to use
Body: Very lite weight and easy to use, I had a stroke, so using a stroller is not easy for me, but this one is very easy for me to but up and down with no problems for my granddaughter. I love it. Would buy again. I am able to get it up the stairs of the apartment with not problems also.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: JeaniePro
Title: No protection from a wedgie in the crotch area!
Body: From a quality perspective, this stroller is well made. Even though is has a netted storage area below the seat, I purchased a separate stroller bag for small essentials, water bottle, etc. The negative aspect is that the strap coming up from the seat has absolutely no protective padding at all, resulting in a wedgie. For my 6 month old, I had to put a diaper in that area before connecting the straps.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: granz
Title: If your looking for a sturdy stroller this is not for you
Body: If your looking for a sturdy stroller this is not for you! It is light weight, easy to push and the handle is very comfortable. The back is cardboard!!! Once child is buckled in it becomes part of his back, moving to and fro with the child. It is a tight fit, my grandson is an average sized 2 y/o and he just fits in it. My arthritic hands have difficulty folding it, but once folded it is very easy to pick up and put in trunk. My husband thinks its okay, but I do not like it.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Shannon
Title: Not compatible with one handed closure
Body: Sturdy, functional but the claim about one handed closure is false. It's takes some effort with two hands.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Doris Avila
Title: Overall is a good stroller
Body: I love the stroller is light very useful I wasn’t sure if I should buy for my 3 years old daughter, the only thing I don’t like is that it doesn’t recline all the way when she falls sleep and 3 yrs old is definitely to big for this stroller I have to take the front piece so that I can put her in
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Greg S.
Title: wheel placement is terrible, cup holder was good
Body: folds not so well, wheel placement is terrible, cup holder was good, just not for us, returned it
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Joan1945
Title: This is just perfect. Just like it looks and very strong
Body: This is just perfect. Just like it looks and very strong. recommend this product.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: M
Title: Don't buy, stroller started squeeking within a month of ...
Body: Don't buy, stroller started squeeking within a month of purchase. Contacted Kolcraft, but they were unable to do anything about it since it was purchased through Amazon.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Christy Lee F
Title: A great buy!
Body: I love this stroller. It wasn't super expensive, it was priced nicely. Plenty of room underneath and the cup holders are great- I discovered sadly that a lot of strollers to not have this. The canopy is great- the stroller itself is fairly compact while still being roomy for my 3 year old son. Most importantly, we travel a lot and this stroller has held up with airline travel and gate check madness. All in all, a fabulous buy!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kurt P.
Title: Worked great for our trip to Disney
Body: Worked great for our trip to Disney World. Light, compact, and plenty of storage underneath.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jennifer Quintero
Title: Three Stars
Body: Not that comfortable for babies
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Scott
Title: This thing is a lightweight beast.
Body: Y’all just don’t know. This is the BEST lightweight stroller we have ever found. We bought it 2 years ago when we learned we were going to be moving to Europe from the states. We expected cobblestones and bought an American stroller that had the biggest wheels we could find. (They are still like half the size of the stroller wheels here.) This poor stroller has been on more planes and in more countries than most Americans have.It has been in the cargo hold of at least 6 flights, run over by a truck (no child was injured, I had a moment where I forgot to put it into the back after putting the kid in his car seat), in over a dozen European cities over cobblestones, through muddy dirt streets, and bounced down steps in Venice and across Denmark.It is light enough that my husband can pick it up with our 2 year old in it and carry it up and down stairways.Seriously, this thing is a beast. It wasn’t until our 14th trip that the frame started to bend a bit. I am sad to say that it has seen its last vacation. I would seriously buy another one if our youngest wasn’t getting too big for it.Buy this stroller. It is amazing.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ashwin Lall
Title: Nice height, nice handle
Body: Nice height, nice handle. We wish the front wheels locked. They go all wobbly if you try to go fast (say, to get out of the rain).
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jorge Gomez
Title: It's ok
Body: I've only been using this for about a week. So far, I'm not impressed.Pros: the basket is accessible and I can fit my small diaper bag - umbrella strollers I've tried in this price range can't fit it which is the main reason I am trying this one. It is easy to close. It folds relatively flat.Cons: to close is easy, but to fold it up is annoying - the front wheels have to be turned for it to fold up which is annoying. Also once folded, the latch is horrible - it easily comes undone and the stroller folds up smaller than the latch locks at which wouldn't be too big of a problem if the latch didn't come undone so easily. the baby cup holder is pretty small in diameter and shallow.I haven't used the recline feature with the baby yet, but I'm weary of the belt being difficult to easily adjust once the baby's weight is against the back.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: M.F.
Title: Missing parts
Body: Stroller did not come with all parts. Purchased for a vacation coming up and missing cotter pins needed in order for wheels to attach.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Great product
Body: Works great. Easy to operate.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Alex C.
Title: Great for traveling
Body: This was so much easier than our click connect stroller. Super light. Easy to use around the airport. I really dreaded taking the stroller we had. Definitely glad we bought it. I use it everyday now. Takes up half the space the other one for in my car.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kristen
Title: Very lightweight and reliable
Body: Perfect for traveling and extremely light. Took it to AZ where I had to carry it a bit down a small rocky trail without a problem or getting tired. Although I wouldn’t recommend the wheels for that type of terrain. You will feel every bump. The only downside is that it doesn’t really fold up too flat and the wheels get tangled together when you do. But overall glad I made this purchase.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Randy
Title: Small
Body: Too small. Returned
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: jess
Title: Five Stars
Body: This is super light weight and moves soo smooth! I love it.

Author: Ms Jo
Title: GOOD PURCHASE
Body: Great stroller
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: David Arellano
Title: Five Stars
Body: Very compact i love this stroller
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: RVT
Title: Five Stars
Body: Easy to use. Used it at Disnsy and had no problems.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ma
Title: I love this stroller
Body: I love this stroller! Easy to close.lightweight. folds slim for easy storage or travel.. breaks are easy to press. cup holders are a plus! Easy to push and direct.The only reason I gave 4 stars was because the material that my toddler sits on stains very easily with liquids or snacks (almost like a tent material..)that is the only minus.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Aaron Hunt
Title: Four Stars
Body: The cup holders are too small for a standard size plastic water bottle.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Brittany Roberts
Title: This Is such an awesome little stroller
Body: This Is such an awesome little stroller. It’s perfect small and light but it really moves smoothly. Way better than my 200 dollar jogging stroller! Highly recommend this product!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: britt
Title: Good stroller
Body: So far I like it! My daughter is 1 and it's perfect for her! I like how it reclines so she can sleep still since she is still so little! Only complaint is the umbrella part isn't big enough! Other than that it's extremely affordable and I'm satisfied with my purchase.It's came fast too!!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Chelsea Neason
Title: I love that my active 18-month-old can't slide down and scoot ...
Body: I love that my active 18-month-old can't slide down and scoot himself around the room like he did in his umbrella stroller!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Pikachu
Title: Five Stars
Body: It works.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: KAT
Title: Small enough for a trunk, large enough for kid and accutrements
Body: Had to put it together, not a problem. Great stroller! Huge step above umbrella stroller, wish I had invested in this 2 years ago and skipped the umbrella stroller altogether. Sturdy, lots of perks. Cup holders for adults as well as child, can be positioned to lay back with an easy maneuverable strap.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Stefanie
Title: DANGEROUS for little fingers, Uncomfortable, difficult to fold
Body: Terribly uncomfortable for my 15 month old son, whom is 28 pounds...the seat back at its highest position provides no back support and the seat is very shallow, so after 15 minutes he was so tired from trying to sit upright that he was crying to get off. The snack tray is VERY DANGEROUS when installing and uninstalling (which you’d probably have to do every time your child gets in or out) and little fingers can be BROKEN easily because it snaps so tightly right near where your child has her hand!! And you must completely install or install it, unlike the uppababy bsback tray that releases with a push of a button and hangs to one side until you need it again...It is also impossible to fold with one hand. RETURNING !!!!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Body: I was gifted an Uppa Baby umbrella stroller but purchased this one while away on a trip. I have not gone back to using the Uppa Baby since we got this Kolcraft stroller. It really is the easiest and lightest option for the price. The storage basket underneath is large. I love how theres a drink/snack tray for my son as well as a tray and cup holder for the parent pushing it. We are going to Italy this summer and I think we will be purchasing a new one of these (ours is a bit beat up) instead of a more expensive option-- It's hard to stray away from this one!!!

Title: AMAZING LITTLE STROLLER
Body: AMAZING LITTLE STROLLER! My daughter was 6 months old when we went to visit family in Australia. We needed a lightweight stroller that was easy to maneuver on our travels and comfy enough for the airport. We were not about to bring our huge travel system stroller. Saw this stroller had great reviews and decided to give it a go. Super lightweight, easy to push, easy to fold and unfold (I could do it with one arm!), really held up great on all our adventures. Under basket looked small, but actually fit ALOT of our stuff!! Super great buy, exceeded my expectations.

Author: Sie
Title: The only pro, Its lightweight
Body: Edit: *Been using this for two years now. My toddler is too tall (a little over 3ft) for it and his feet touch the wheels when he falls asleep. Because it doesnt recline, when he sleeps, his head is leaning on one of the hard joints and I have to make him a pillow out of a blanket. I still fight with it to close, one hand mechanism is still jammed. When it does close, the wheels have to be aligned by hand or it will warp the wheels. Needless to say I dont like having to use my hands on wheels that have rolled all over NYC streets, so my wheels are warped. I think I say I hate this stroller every time I have to use it. Currently searching for a new one.*I love that it’s lightweight, has a decent sized basket and runs smoothly. I do wish that the cup holders by the handle could fit something bigger than a small Poland spring bottle. I also wish it could lie back a little more. But it will not close with just one hand, I have to pull it up using the tray. Guessing it’s because it’s new and stiff. Hopefully it will be one handed in the near future, like I need it to be.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ryan Villano
Title: I like this stroller
Body: The stroller is described as weighing 11.8 pounds, but both the box and my scale say it weighs 13 pounds. Not a big deal, obviously, but they should correct that because every pound counts when the selling point is how lightweight it is. I bought this for my daughter who just turned 3 to replace our last stroller that was too heavy. I like this stroller, but the seat isn't very deep, so my daughter can't really relax and let her legs dangle. She looks big in it at 32 pounds- I can't imagine how she'll fit at 50 pounds. All in all, it was a good deal at $52.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer

Body: This stroller was perfect for our trip out of the country and even domestically, its lightweight, the handle bars are soft, and the height its great. I am 5'7 and I didn't have to hunch at all like I normally do to push umbrella strollers. The stroller is super easy to put together and super easy to unfold and refold. I would recommend to friends and would buy again.

Its lightweight, easy to fold, easy to open, has a tray for snacks, spacious storage basket and a nice size canopy for sunny days. I use this so much I sold my full size stroller. Author: S.
Title: Folding is NOT one handed! Cupholders are tiny!
Body: PROS: Very lightweight stroller - it helps a lot for walking uphill etc. with it being so nice and lightweight. It has good shocks for rugged terrain and a big basket underneath. I like the window to see the child when the sunshade is up, and the should straps on the seatbelt.CONS: There is absolutely no way I have been able to fold or unfold this thing 1 handed. I've fought and struggled with this stroller a ton. It even made cry. I have gotten more used to it now, but just something to be aware of. Also, the cupholders are tiny! It won't hold standard sized Tervis Tumblers and it's hard to fit a regular soda can in them (though possible if you shove it in)

Author: Matthew Gent
Title: Lightweight and easy to maneuver.
Body: Received the product today and what can I say? It's a great stroller, it's well made but yet it's light enough for my petite wife to pick up. I was skeptical going from a three wheeled jogger to this stroller as I felt that it would not maneuver so easily. But this stroller maneuver is very easily and is very easy to assemble. It's got great storage. My son is 2 and is very tall for his age and this stroller fits him very well. The only downfall is the front cup holder does not swing to one side allowing the child to get into stroller by himself. But at this price I can't complain.

Title: Really convenient and light weight stroller!

This is just the stroller we needed to get through the airport and especially helpful going through security. I was able to fold this stroller down while holding my 15 month old in one arm. This does fold down to fit through the X-ray system. The only things that I wish were bigger in this are the cup holders and the storage basket below but these can work since it IS a smaller lightweight stroller. Overall this was a great find and continue using this on regular outings.

Author: Amazon Customer

I live in NYC and It has eliminated the dread I used to feel at taking the baby on the subway. It is so light I can easily tote it up and down steps. I also like to walk and have pushed this up to two miles at a time quite comfortably. My toddler falls asleep in it. Great price. Would definitely buy again.

Another reason I purchased this was because it also came with a parent console, then came to realize my water bottle doesn’t even fit in it. Not a big deal but I’m hoping a small water bottle or a coffee will fit in there. Folds up really easily, folds out really easily and putting it together was very simple. Hoping it does well on our travels next week.

While loaded down it was still able to maneuver through rough terrain and grass with two hands. If you are like me and don't want to travel with a big bulky BOB, BUY THIS STROLLER!!

It has a large storage compartment underneath and I love the cup holders for baby and mom. My babies Graco cadseat fits in nicely. Love it so much!!

Title: Five Stars

Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tom Carter
Title: Here’s why 3 stars, the directions are bad for the installing front wheels
Body: Hi I’m Tom’s wife, we got this stroller for our youngest. After reading multiple reviews on other strollers, I decided on this one becof the 5 point harness system. Today we received the stroller, I thought I can put this stroller together quick, I was wrong, the front wheels were that much of a pain. I called Kolcraft, the lady was nice. Here’s where the problem with them lies, they wanted a video emailed to them of me putting the wheels on, the soonest they could get back to me is tomorrow.Did I mention I have a toddler, I don’t always have time when others do, so tomorrow just wasn’t going to work for me.God is so good to me because the thought try utube came to mind, so that’s what I did. That’s where I learned real fast I was putting the wheels on upside down.Mainly because I had no idea there where arrows on the wheels, and no idea the arrows need to be pointing up which puts the tab that’s to be facing you, at the bottom.Then and only then will you get the wheels on correctly with out hurting your fingers.In truth kolcraft should just put a link in the directions and send you to a utube video.After we use this stroller for awhile I will see about giving more stars.Bottom line so far I would recommend this stroller. Just remember about the arrows and the tab and you should be fine. Merry Christmas!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: graviton_waves
Title: Very nice but requires extra measures for comfort.
Body: It is very light weight and easy to maneuver. The back adjustment is a strap system that is simple and easy. The actual seat angles down slightly awkwardly and combined with the bare seatbelt system causes it to be uncomfortable without cushioning the seatbelt and/or front of the seat itself. It folds up nicely but still barely fits in my trunk and despite the one hand system it takes some dexterity or the use of both hands to unfold it. Still, it is really nice and definitely no umbrella stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Loriel
Title: the only thing I don't like or can't understand is the recyling of the seat ...
Body: Yeah it's actually exactly what's stated... the only thing I don't like or can't understand is the recyling of the seat the belt has more space but not going back any further.

Author: manino
Title: Good for a tall boy to use in an amusement park
Body: We bought it to go to LEGOLAND (florida). I must say my boy is 5 years old and 47 inches tall and 46 lbs in weight. He was at the top of this stroller but it served its purpose very well. No wobbling or anything. We had to take the tray though, in order for he to fit comfortably. Very light and easy to pack. We were very pleased with the purchase

Body: Very light, very easy to assemble, and does justice. Only issue I have with it is the closing part. Wheels have to be aligned a certain way, for it to close properly. Other than that, it's perfect for what I need it for.

I purchased this stroller when he turned 2 and now he is still riding comfortably at 3 years old and 40 inches tall. We go on long walks frequently, charity walks for miles with the stroller. It is very light weight and not bulky at all best of all:)August 5, 2018My son is almost 4 and we go for long walks every day. He is approximately 40 lbs and nearly 44 inches tall.

Author: Dani
Title: Top 10 it is NOT
Body: I am disappointed my less expensive stroll has front wheel locks, the tray opens to take the baby out easy if asleep. I don't see how this made the top 10 strollers list.

Author: Alexandra
Title: Light and tight.
Body: We like this and it fulfills our needs but it is a big slimmer than other similar models and sadly the seat does not decline all the way. A little but not even to 45degrees.

Author: Rynnelli
Title: Five Stars

Author: Arona
Title: I would not recommend this stroller
Body: The stroller so far is pretty easy to steer and push around. And it is light weight. It has one solid handle bar so you can add clips to hook bags on and other things. However, the product description is just not true. It is not at all one-handed anything. I have never successfully opened or closed it all the way with one hand. Forget about holding my baby while doing it. I had to put my baby down on the floor in my lobby in order to use both hands to open the stroller. (She was not happy.) I haven't figured out how to get the seat back to stay in any position, altho that could just be me. I also haven't figured out how to loosen the straps to fit around my baby. That one is not just me. My husband and my friend were also both unsuccessful. The large basket does not hold my diaper back pack. It looks pretty small. The thing that locks the wheels is not one uniform lock. There's a separate lock for each wheel. As opposed to my other stroller that has one lock for both back wheels, which is a lot easier. I don't know that we're going to return this, b/c we threw out the box and it's annoying to return, but I would not recommend it.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Isma
Title: Three Stars
Body: opening up too hard
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Barbara Morris

Author: Joe

Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Shaikh
Title: Good
Body: Better
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: joe thomas
Title: easy to assemble
Body: It’s an okay stroller.Pros: very light, easy to assemble, looks great.Cons: 1) The product states that the reclining is adjustable, but it’s really not. There is a strap in the back to adjust the recline, but it takes the seating from super reclined to very reclined at best. Even after having the strap adjusted to have the least recline, my daughter is sitting awkward as if she’s about to slide off. Reclining was my #1 requirement when shopping for a stroller, so a little disappointed with the result. 2) when folding the stroller down, the front wheels get in the way and prevent you from fully collapsing it. You have to manually move the front wheels around to collapse properly. It’s not a big deal, and doesn’t happen all the time, but can be annoying when you’re in a rush or child is screaming. I’ve used the stroller about 4 times and this collapse/wheel issue has happened twice.It’s a very light stroller and easy to travel with, but I wouldn’t recommend it to a friend or buy it again.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Satisfied customer
Title: Good basic stroller.
Body: Great light weight stroller. Took this with us to NYC so we didn't have to take our big bulky one. It did the job and was perfect weight that we could carry it up and down the subway stairs. Only complaint is steering isn't great. Storage below is really nice. Don't really care for the kid tray. The cup holder is pretty small and didn't fit the water bottle we had.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: michael pinheiro
Title: This stroller put up with constant use over rough cobblestone and surprisingly the shocks are still in good shape. The small basket held more than we ...
Body: We bought this stroller for a month long trip to Europe. This stroller put up with constant use over rough cobblestone and surprisingly the shocks are still in good shape. The small basket held more than we thought it would, although if you stuff it, it is hard to pull things out. We utilized the reclining seat when my daughter would nap while we were out and she seemed really comfortable. The only downside is that the cup holders were small, so it wouldn't hold my reusable bottle. Although I'm happy that it has a cup holder at all. All in all this stroller was a lifesaver and is still being put to good use back at home.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kyla Wh
Title: Ok stroller for good price. Wouldn’t buy again.
Body: While this stroller has a lot of great details other umbrella strollers don’t have, it lacks in a bit more quality. I purchased mine for a trip so I needed it to be very useful for lots of walking.The seat seems slip down making it hard to sit.The storage space is a good size but the front is open, things easily can fall out the front.One hand folding could better
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Damian D
Title: Overall good, with a couple of cons.
Body: Before purchasing this prior to a flight, I did a lot of research and read many reviews. This is a decent travel stroller for the price. And it is very possible to open and close with one hand. It also can stand on its own in the folded position. My kid does seem to be sliding down towards the front of the stroller most of the time, however. And when folded, the little swing latch to hold it folded is too long for how well it can compact, so it won’t lock into place. Otherwise it has been a good purchase and a great value.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: P.G. Zilla
Title: Great for a really compact lightweight stroller
Body: Great for a really compact lightweight stroller. My son is 2 and almost 40 pounds so he's a bit big for it, but still does well!

Title: I was very disappointed when opening stroller only to discover that I had ...
Body: I was very disappointed when opening stroller only to discover that I had to put wheels and trays on. This came with no instructions no diagram. It was no easy task. I’m also thinking that the weight capacity is wrong, but alas that’s a problem for later. I would gladly return this if I didn’t have put it back in the box. I wish I had gotten the Jeep stroller much simpler.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

It’s easy to maneuver as well. Couldn’t be happier.

I love it so much and I can't believe how compact and light it is. I think I'm most excited to take my huge stroller out of my car and replace it with this tiny one! I almost bought another for my stroller loving 4 year old....he's easier though so I will just use another stroller I have with no frills for the long walking airports part. :) I am one very happy customer!

When we take walks around the neighnorhood we take this and sometime our little dog rides at the bottom.

Author: Naeemah Campbell
Title: Great buy!
Body: I was skeptical at first because of the mixed reviews but I was very pleased. Easy to set up as well. My daughter is almost 1 years old and she fits in the stroller. Slouches a bit but that's because she is small and will grow into it. Great, lightweight, easy to maneuver stroller. I gave away my Britax-B stroller because it was so bulky and heavy and I no longer have a car so this is definitely a great purchase especially if you do not have a car. I hope this will last me some time because it looks like it will grow with the child.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jennifer Branche
Title: My daughter did really bad in this stroller
Body: My daughter did really bad in this stroller. The wheel broke and she kept tipping it even though she was within the weight limits!!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: T. Scott
Title: You get what you pay for and this stroller is poor quality. Every time we used it our infant ...
Body: I bought this umbrella stroller for a vacation we were planning with our 8 month old, which included having to fly with layovers. You get what you pay for and this stroller is poor quality. Every time we used it our infant would scream because the seat was so uncomfortable. There is hardly any area in the seat for our child to sit, so the baby looks like she was sliding forward and out the seat the entire time. We also found the stroller brake uneasy to use and the under seat storage was lacking space to carry a diaper bag. Now that we are home I am planning to sell the stroller on Craiglist.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Verified Purchase
Title: Four Stars
Body: Excellent storage, lightweight, not super stylish though
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: A. Steelefalcon
Title: Perfect for Travel!
Body: HURRAY! Small and compact for our travel needs. Stands on its own when folded up. Smooth handling with easy to turn wheels and front shocks. Storage area is rather large, which is very helpful when traveling. Cups holders for us and our toddler. The window to look down and check when our son is asleep or too quiet meaning he is up to something. Three point harness for added safety. Lightweight frame for easily lifting and plane travel!!! I know it sounds like an infomercial but this is a great product. I spewed a lot of the things the company wrote down before I purchased. After extensive looking this stroller looked like a great fit and I was right. Our family travels a lot and this stroller is perfect for the job!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Busy Mom's worst nightmare!!
Body: At first my issue was that it was difficult to fold and unfold.. It gets stuck and when you finally get it unstuck, parts start flying off everywhere and you basically have to put half of the stroller back together while your kid is screaming in their car seat waiting to get out.. The straps are a nightmare!! They are flimsy and difficult to adjust.. My 1 year old unbuckles himself every time.. I have to keep one eye on him at every moment when he is in it.. Kinda defeats the purpose of restraining him for safety purposes.. That brings me to our ER visit yesterday!! Yup!! It finally happened!! He got himself out of the flimsy straps as I was at the UPS store.. He stood up and the stroller tipped over.. He hit his head and chin He now has 5 stitches on his chin and a goose egg the size of Detroit!!Just spend a few extra bucks and get a better stroller...
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Melani
Title: ... the stroller 3 times and the front wheel wobbles pretty bad.
Body: I have used the stroller 3 times and the front wheel wobbles pretty bad.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Paul Jaussi
Title: This is a fantastic lightweight stroller
Body: This is a fantastic lightweight stroller. I gave it four stars simply because the cup holders are too small for most sippy cups and that is a pain. However, everything else about this is WONDERFUL. It reclines enough for sleepers and the hood covers my entire child, the basket at the bottom has held everything from my diaper bag to lunch to all of our towels for swimming (with 5 kids thats quite good).
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: S. Niemeyer
Title: Good for tall parents
Body: My husband is 6'4 so I wish the handle bars were another inch or two for him but I am 5'10 and it's perfect for me and I do 90% of the pushing anyway. I've had the cheaper umbrella strollers and they are awful and you have to bend over and it's not good. This stroller pushes easily and our 15 month old (who is 27lbs and 33 inches tall - she wears 3T clothes) fits in it nicely and it will last her a long time. The straps fit her well and she enjoys riding in the stroller. I would recommend to others; particularly those of us who are tall.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: DeeL42
Title: Can't fold with one hand
Body: I bought this to replace a lightweight Zobo stroller that was ruined. It was between this stroller and the Summer Infant 3D Lite Stroller. I chose this based on the weight, the front tray and the extended sun shade. All in all, the stroller handles nicely and is easy to maneuver. It's lighter than my Zobo stroller, but folding it is not nearly as simple. The Zobo could easily be folded with one hand, perfect while holding a baby or bags. For this stroller, you can work the folding mechanism with one hand, but I find you need your other hand to push it closed. It can also be tricky to get all the way folded and the latching mechanism doesn't seem to match the size to when it's completely folded. This stroller is also longer once folded, so it doesn't fit as nicely in the trunk of my full-size Avalon as the Zobo did. The tray was a deal-breaker for me as I put snacks in it when we go for walks and I like the larger storage compartment for putting my purse and diaper bag, but the folding mechanism needs some work, which is why I only gave it four stars.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Angela
Title: Best $60 I have spent on baby products!
Body: I have spent hundreds on strollers in the past year....this is my fourth purchase and I am so satisfied. I live in the city and needed something compact and lightweight for walking around and taking public transportation. Very easy to maneuver and the basket on bottom is a decent size. I would like it if the two cup holders were larger...it is too small to hold my drinks. Best $60 I have spent on baby products!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: maumannion
Title: Love this stroller!
Body: Now that I have used this stroller for about a month I can truthfully say that it is fantastic! I am 70 yrs old and care for my youngest, now 16 mo old, grandson during the week while his mother works. I walk 45 minutes every day for exercise and he comes with me,. I had a full system type stroller that was very heavy and difficult for me to open-and lift when closed. this stroller is exactly as advertised! It is light but has all the features of the larger stroller. My grandson has a tray for his snacks and I have a tray for my keys, phone and water bottle. A 16,9oz plastic bottle of water from the grocery store fits perfectly. I am 5ft 8in tall and the handle is at a perfect height. There is lots of room for a small diaper bag or purchases in the bottom basket. It maneuvers wonderfully around obstacles (a problem with the larger stroller) The stroller folds up easily, not quite with one hand, but easily nonetheless, Finally the sunshade covers him really well and I like the peekaboo window in the back. This stroller is an outstanding value for its price. Way to go Kolcraft! I am a fan.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Evette
Title: Lock the wheels when folding the stroller.
Body: I really like this stroller. Easy to assemble and go. When folding the stoller which is super easy, you need to lock the wheels so they don't come off. Other than that I love it.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Bells
Title: Easy to maneuver
Body: Easy to maneuver, truly lightweight while still offering storage underneath!! You do need two hands to close it (at least I do) however it folds pretty flat and does not take up too much space.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Almadealma
Title: I love it.
Body: This is an amaizing stroller ;) I should have bought this long time ago. I love it.
