Author: Lophotrochozoa
Title: You could by ten of these for the price of a high-end stroller
Body: Beautifully and functionally designed, satisfies almost every need. I have no complaints and the stroller is a joy to use. This stroller has been completely reliable on multiple plane trips. I would say the low price is a reflection of the build quality rather than the functionality. But that's probably part of the design too--you're not out of few hundred bucks if it gets lost in transit or trashed in the cargo hold. Regardless, it has held up well and provided impressive value for the price.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Doug
Title: Just what we wanted
Body: LOVE THIS STROLLER! We found much cheaper umbrella strollers but we wanted one with a 5 point harness since out child was still a supported sitter. This is a nice stroller and it is easy to fold and throw in the trunk.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Lilia
Title: Three Stars
Body: Very light and easy to push. A little hard to close.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tennessee Mom
Title: Good for price
Body: Some issues getting it folded back down from open. The front wheels don't fit well when it's folded. It tends to pop open when I'm pulling it out of the back of my car without me pressing the release button on the handle. Love that it's the perfect cross between the larger strollers and an umbrella stroller. The compartment underneath is a great size. It's light weight and generally well made. The tray is a bit cumbersome - doesn't swing open to allow for easy removal of my kiddo; has to be completely removed to take him out. It just pops off though, so not a huge deal.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: We have flown with our son twice so far and this stroller is great. It's lightweight
Body: If you are looking for a stroller to travel with this is it. We have flown with our son twice so far and this stroller is great. It's lightweight, folds quickly even with one hand, and fits in the standard gate check bag. I recommend this stroller if you travel a lot with your child.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: jenny
Title: but the quality of the stroller is not great. The tires are wobbly and the backrest is ...
Body: It's definitely light, but the quality of the stroller is not great. The tires are wobbly and the backrest is not sturdy.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Skip this terrible stroller
Body: If you are 5 feet tall or less then this may work for you. I am 5'7 and get a sore back hunching over to push this stroller. I called Kolcraft and asked if I could buy a handle extender and they said no and were not helpful at all. Skip this stroller and wish I would of known it is only for short people before I bought.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Webdiva
Title: Comfortable easy ride for mom and baby!
Body: I love the stroller. The umbrella makes it more comfortable for our son and it really glides effortlessly along. I don't use the basket since I bought this for commuting. Stopping to empty a basket so that I can fold up the stroller wastes time when you're catching a train. I use the top cup holders. Love that there's two. One for my drink and one for hubby's. My child would probably drop his drink so I haven't used his cup holder yet but I can see it being useful as he gets older. I also like that when he falls asleep I can recline him. It's well made and very pretty. I like the red color. It's bright and eye catching in a crowded city so I feel safer.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: PCB
Title: ... just used on a Disney Vacation and it was great except for the front wheels which had to be ...
Body: The stroller was just used on a Disney Vacation and it was great except for the front wheels which had to be adjusted in order to completely fold it for transporting on the bus. The stroller is sturdy and the under storage is spacious. It was a much better option than smaller umbrella strollers and it meet all our needs. A good value!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Spice
Title: Love it!
Body: Love this stroller this is my 3rd stroller this year but it's the best one yet.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: amatex
Title: Great Light weight stroller
Body: Great for a light weight, easy to use stroller. Seems to e well made.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: stroller
Body: i like this stroller but wish it would go all the way down so that child could nap comfortable
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: gael poltrack
Title: Great stroller!
Body: The stroller is so easy to use and my grandson is very happy to be comfortable and not so strapped in as he is in the car seat one.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: KIM PORTER
Title: Four Stars
Body: This was a great purchase; lightweight and easy to travel with.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Light and pretty
Body: Cute and well constructed. Worth every penny! However, it is a little hard to fold.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Miss Skates
Title: Brilliant
Body: Brilliant. It's small but sturdy, the basket is the biggest I've ever had but on the smallest buggy. My son thinks the tray is amazing.It could be taller (I'm 5'5 and wish the handle were higher) and it could fold down smaller but I am so pleased with this.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jen_Jackson
Title: Needs a couple of justments before it's perfect!
Body: We like this stroller! However, the wheels don't have much tread on them and I feel like they've worn down already in the six months or so since we've owned it. But they are sturdy and keep going! My only other change would be to put some type of compartment that closes by the cup holder. The compartment is open and doesn't fight quite fit the larger cell phones and cannot secure keys or money. But most importantly it is very easy to maneuver and the baby is comfortable! The front tray is removable. The stroller is easy to push and maneuver, and it is easy to close and open. However when you try to close the stroller you can close it and it folds up with one hand unless the front wheels aren't lined up in a certain way. Then you're shaking the stroller with one hand trying to get those Wheels to lay flat so the stroller closes completely a slight design flaw, I suppose.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Cam’s Gram
Title: Nice Stroller
Body: Great lightweight stroller for the money. Great to use occasionally when taking my grandson for walks.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: angierumom
Title: Easy to pull out of the trunk and set up ...
Body: Easy to pull out of the trunk and set up for this grandmother. Perfect for short shopping trips. The big Uppa Baby is wonderful for some uses, but too complicated for me to open/close. Just give me simple, which is nice enough for short errands. Heck, a lot nicer than what was available when my children grew up!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: bebe
Title: Do not purchase. Not safe for a child.
Body: The wheel popped off immediately after installation. The stroller never should be purchased.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: curtis w baker
Title: This is a nice stroller but the way that you adjust the back ...
Body: This is a nice stroller but the way that you adjust the back is to time consuming. Also a note to grandparents, it is much harder to lift a chubby baby or toddler out when you have the cup holder in front. I think I would have preferred a stroller that I could life my granddaughter straight out of. the quality if great and the fold up super
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: J P Millsap
Title: The rubber gripping on the handle wasn't in place on one side and ripped easily when I tried to adjust it
Body: The drink tray for the adult and the tray for the child do not fit any normal-sized cup/sippy cup. They're extremely small, so virtually, they're a waster of plastic. The rubber gripping on the handle wasn't in place on one side and ripped easily when I tried to adjust it. The front wheels hit the back wheels when folding in half therefore making it almost impossible to secure it shut with the latch. It requires much fumbling around and adjusting to secure it closed. Poor quality all around.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Emily Rae
Title: Great stroller at excellent price
Body: Great stroller, super lightweight, fits my 4 years old that weighs 48 lbs just fine. It's very easy to push and fold up.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Vee Ess
Title: Not worth $65. Disappointing.
Body: Disappointing. Package arrived damaged, but that's not the problem (that's just an indication of cheap cardboard). The strap system is difficult to use and the cupholders are much too small for any normal kiddy cup (the old Tupperware sippy cups *might* work). For the cost, it's not worth the money. We are returning it.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: cathy m.
Title: Just above umbrella stroller
Body: Just a step above an umbrella stroller. If I had it to do over, I would spend a lil more and get a better quality. Don't like that it doesn't lay down for baby to sleep. Hoping it works out better as baby grows. I do like the canopy and colors.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kathryn OConnor
Title: All good but one thing
Body: Love this stroller but the adult drinkmholder is too,big. Doesn't snap on correctly no matter what I do. Trying to to get resolution, other than that it is great.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Raju Marella
Title: Four Stars
Body: 4 star because of the build quality. No usage issues. This is a budget product and with decent quality
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sheila Y. Jones
Title: Broken with minimal use
Body: It seemed like the perfect stroller but I've only had it for a few weeks and it's already broken. The stroller will not close. I'm so disappointed! I will be contacting the seller for a replacement. The lightweight was a plus!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: M. Hagel
Title: Five Stars
Body: In use daily. No complaints.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Susan Mccutchen
Title: I love
Body: I bought this stroller to replace the traditional umbrella stroller. I love it
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: ColeKidd
Title: BUYERS BEWARE!!!
Body: I ordered this stroller which is pretty pricey for a VERY basic stroller and the very first use the black foam handles cracked and split completely open. I returned it to Amazon and received a replacement of which I have used a total of 10 times and it is doing it again. I'm pretty gentle with my belongings and there is no way this should be happening. It is definitely just cheap material. Don't buy this stroller unless you don't care about the foam coming off. And the cup holder does not stay on. It has popped off with each use and my drinks have gone crashing to the ground. Terrible stroller. And the 5 star reviews have to be fake or paid for.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Great as a second stroller
Body: It's very lightweight and easy to maneuver but the seat back can't be put in a full upright position. My first stroller was replaced because the folding mechanism in the handle malfunctioned and would not allow the stroller for fold. It is great as a second stroller in grandma's car.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: James
Title: I absolutely love how light weight this stroller is and it is ...
Body: I absolutely love how light weight this stroller is and it is easy to maneuver. The only downfall that I have found with this stroller is that I wanted to be able to leave it in the back of my vehicle for whenever I needed a stroller for my baby. Well with the summer heat that I have where I live it warped/melted the wheels. So if it gets hot where you live do not keep it in the vehicle all of the time. Contacted the company for the stroller and they had amazing customer service and were very friendly! For the price of this stroller and all of the features that it has it is a great purchase just wish the wheels wouldn't get messed up from the heat!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: SandyM
Title: Very light weight
Body: Very light weight! Just wish it had a little more cushion.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Swparker
Title: Perfect stroller
Body: I love this stroller! It is the perfect cross between light weight umbrella stroller and full size stroller. It is tall enough to keep from stooping and has a decent sized basket. The shade is actually pretty good at covering the baby, unlike many umbrella strollers. All of that is important, but add in the fact that it doesn't weigh a ton, and it's a winner. We got it for a Disney trip when we left our other decent umbrella at home. I was upset at first with spending the money, but I use this on all them time now. Opening and closing is really easy with it, too.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: ANI
Title: Five Stars
Body: Light weight and folds nicely , fits everywhere and every car
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: tharun
Title: Too small for the purpose.
Body: I bouht this for my 3 yr kid(average size) and it is too small to hold her. Her legs touches ground. Also the seat doesnt have enough space to hold a 3 yr kid. She slips off very easly. She is just fit on the cart. No room to keep her comfy. It doesnt folds completly. Most of the time the front wheels get jammed, prevents it from folding properly. Not a good purchase. Planing to return.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Four Stars
Body: Good
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Carole M. Strauss
Title: ... to use when I am taking care of my great granddaughter. She loves being rolled around in it ...
Body: Just what I needed to use when I am taking care of my great granddaughter. She loves being rolled around in it inside and outside the house. I have only part time care of her so no need for a bigger, stronger stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ashli crioft cheaters©
Title: Five Stars
Body: Excellent looking piece of muse. Would recommend anyone to purchase
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Susan Rogers
Title: Fairly disappointed
Body: I am fairly disappointed in this strolled. I don't find it very easy to collapse or open one handed or even with two. The wheels have to be lined up just so in order for it to collapse all the way. The wheels do not seem durable for use on poorly maintained sidewalks. It also has a fairly large profile when collapsed, which was surprising.That being said, my daughter seems comfortable in it, it is lighter than our last stroller and the little tray in front is great. The storage area beneath the stroller is also very roomy. Depending on what you need it for, it could be perfect for you or something to pass on.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: heer
Title: Its light and have everything but
Body: Yes, it's very light and compact. Almost have everything you are looking in a stroller - kids tray .. parents tray, underneath storage, quick fold, lightweight.But one thing I faced with this stroller is wobbling of tites even if I just walk fast not running obviously I know that its not a jogger, the tires starts wobbling very badly almost looking like it will fall apart in pieces.I don't know whether it's just a case with me or is it common with this model. I do purchased like new open box from Amazon instead of new. So maybe it was not good at the first place if it was returned to Amazon.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Mattis’ Mom
Title: Five Stars
Body: Light weight easy to use and store.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Zulma
Title: This stroller is perfect for someone who is always on the go
Body: This stroller is perfect for someone who is always on the go. the shade this thing has is awesome just wish it reclined more so my son can sleep comfortable in it but he's never in there long. It fold easy but you have to use both hand not just one. Also doesn't sit all the way up only half way. Last thing is that cup holder r small so no big bottles can go there for storage. Other than small setbacks I still really like it small compact love the color.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: NorCal man
Title: Great set of wheels
Body: Great stroller. Folds up quite small for easy packing. The 'extra' part of the hood worked perfect to help shade my granddaughter. I have suggested this stroller to many.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sumanth Krishna
Title: Brilliant product
Body: Brilliant product. Thoroughly enjoy it.Pros:1. This stroller is SURPRISINGLY sturdy for the price.2. Incredibly lightweight.3. Very easy assembly4. The wheels work very well. The stroller moves very smooth.5. Nice little cup-holder for the baby.6. The storage space in the bottom is amazing. When we go for walks, we throw our keys and phones in there and it is very comfortable.7. The visor has a nice see-through sheet. My baby loves looking through that at me when I am pushing her and laugh. It makes her so much happier that she can see me when in the stroller.Cons:1. It advertises its One Hand Fold, which is not completely true. I always need to push the front against a wall while turning the knob on the handle to be able to fold it. And even when it does fold, we need to MASH the folded part in for it to lock in place. If not, it just keeps popping back out.2. The cup holder by the handle is a weird placement. If the visor is not out, the visor gets in the way of the cup holder. So if you have a cup in the cup holder and you pull the visor back, it knocks your drink off. Not that big a deal, but it is just weird.3. The breaks are a bit hard to apply. It does not lock easily. If you are wearing flipflops, you may break your toenail trying to take the break off.4. The shoulder strap is placed weird. My 1 year old can just pull her hand out of it. We never put the shoulder straps on anyway, but when we do, she can pull herself out of it in a second.Overall:If you are looking for a stroller that can handle a bit of walking off roads and is easy to carry around, definitely go for it. This is a sturdy product and the cons are just more comfort-related than functionality-related.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Megan
Title: He sits in it comfortably even with the tray
Body: Get it! I have a 5 year old that God has blessed with 2 functioning legs, but I needed something where he could rest and get in if the hubs and I need to truck it through Disney or Legoland (Native Floridians). Our last stroller was more for infant/toddler and was way too bulky making it uncontrollable and umbrella strollers are back breaking. My worries were height of the handle bar, length of seat, height inside. This was a dream to put together and my son sat and watched TV in it when we got it. We haven't taken it for a spin outside, but rolls through the house with ease. My sons specs: 43 tall/60lbs. He sits in it comfortably even with the tray. We probably will get a year out of it given the growing spirts of kids, but we have a new baby (nephew) joining our family so we will keep it for him. Ill update if there is any issues, but out of the box, over joyed!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Marcia Lowe
Title: Five Stars
Body: Excellent quality and maneuvers easily.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: DRC
Title: Great bang for your buck!
Body: Lightweight and super easy to put together. Not a great everyday stroller but to have at the shore house for the weekend and to take on vacation, this was a great purchase. Didn't want to spend crazy money on a more expensive stroller. This one was an amazing addition.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Good light weight stroller but the cup holder for the ...
Body: Good light weight stroller but the cup holder for the child is too small & too shallow for most sippy cups! My daughter isn't thrilled about her sippy cup full of cold water or milk sitting next to her in the stroller but the cup doesn't fit in her cup holder nor mine. The holder for the caregiver is too small for a reusable water bottle or thermos or sippy cup!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: marieta
Title: Very easy to assemble
Body: Very easy to assemble. Light weight, easy to fold and store. I have the baby jogger and I have to say this is a great stroller. I would recommend this!! Pulse my kid loves it!!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: whitney b
Title: Not the greatest
Body: Just ok for the price. It's cheaply made. If you want a stroller to last, i wouldn't recommend. If you are just looking for a stroller for maybe a toddler this would be fine.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: kmcg518
Title: Decent little stroller.
Body: Like the stroller for the most part. Easy to assemble, rides good, storage is good, but it is on the shorter side. The canopy is also not very big/long.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Patrick Hill
Title: Easy to push and folds up nice
Body: Light weigh. Easy to push and folds up nice. The clip that holds it in the folded position doesn't latch but it's not a big deal. I needed extra Sun protection for my baby and the visor is oversized and perfect. Love it!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Msnickig
Title: Three Stars
Body: Lightweight, but doesn't seem to be built very well. Work well for traveling though
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: eRocker
Title: Awesome
Body: Awesome
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: K. Galindo
Title: Very very pleased with stroller and a great price!
Body: My stroller needs recently changed and I was in search of a lightweight stroller ideal for traveling. I purchased 3 different strollers (part of which because I had to buy some online) to compare side by side and I decided on this one. The other two strollers were the Summer Infant 3D lite and the Summer Infant 3D one. The Kolcraft and 3D lite are in the same class and price point (though Kolcraft is slightly cheaper). In the end, the extra 5 lbs of weight in the Summer Infant 3D one is why I took it back, but it was a really nice stroller and had more bells and whistles. I returned the 3D lite because the Kolcraft was essentially a miniature version of my current Chicco Bravo stroller. The canopy is excellent with a peek-a-boo window and it has 3 total cup holders (a feature that is hard to find in this class of strollers). The reclining mechanism is not quite as good as I'd like, but I hardly use that feature as it is. I've taken it on test runs with baby and I am very happy with it. It's super light weight, which was important for me because I'm short and have wrist problems now. Baby seems to like it plenty and it is very nice having the snack tray with cup holder in the front. The storage space below is big enough to hold my baby bag, but it also hangs on the handles well too!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: sarcastchick
Title: Got one for Grandma and Grandpa - now we're getting one for us!
Body: I purchased this stroller as a compact, yet full-size option for my parents, since our daughter stays with them during the week. My husband and I decided to take it out of the box and take it for a spin before handing it over and immediately decided we will purchase another to replace our huge stroller that came as part of a travel system.PROS: It is very lightweight, folds up easily (although I don't really think a one-handed fold is possible), stands on its own in the folded position, and takes up much less trunk space. This stroller doesn't have all the bells and whistles of our full-size stroller, but it's definitely a step above an umbrella stroller. My daughter actually looks more comfortable sitting in this stroller than our expensive travel system. The bottom basket is big enough to hold a purse or small diaper bag. I love the extension hood on the canopy that helps block out more sun when necessary and easily slides out of the way when not needed. The handles arc up to a comfortable height. I am 5'8 and my husband is 5'10 and we both felt hunched over our umbrella stroller. This is a much more comfortable height.CONS: The cup holders are ridiculously small. This may not be an issue for most, but if you haul around 32-ounce water bottles like me, they won't fit. The window in the canopy for keeping an eye on the little one doesn't have a cover. This isn't really a con for me because those little flap things on most strollers never seem to stay open when you want them to and I figure I can always place a light blanket or sweater over the window to block sun if needed, but others may find this to be a problem. I don't love the 5-point harness: the lap belt buckles, but the shoulder straps don't buckle into the center harness. They attach with a hook clasp, which makes it a little tougher to get my daughter in and out. It doesn't recline much and you have to manually adjust the harness on the back to get it to recline, but I found this gave my daughter a better posture and, as I said, she looks more comfortable in it. The plastic wheels don't look terribly sturdy, but the ride appears to be pretty smooth.Overall, I think this is an excellent value for the price. I love having the convenience of a full size stroller in something so compact. Someone said it was the perfect stroller for grandparents, but I would say it's also great for parents who want more comfort for their kid with the ease of an umbrella stroller. While we plan to hang onto our monster jogging stroller for longer walks, this is perfect for running errands or short walks.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: liz
Title: Way too short to be pushed comfortably. Requires hunching and major lower back pain
Body: Way too short to be pushed comfortably. Requires hunching and major lower back pain. Also very cheaply made. The basket is too small to fit a diaper bag. This stroller is worth &15-$20 max.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kimberly Meza
Title: Pretty good!
Body: I took off a couple stars because it's a pain in the rear to open with one hand, meaning you can't do it. You need to use two hands or a foot. You CAN close it with one hand. The basket is a great size. I use a backpack so I wish it was bigger but it's still a decent size basket. The clip always unclips from the belt to strap daughter in so I took another star off for that. But even with those annoyances i like it a lot because it's very light and I really like the canopy which is a big size and I enjoy the hole to see my girl looking up at me. Oh and the mesh in back is great for these hot days lately
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Three Stars
Body: Nice lightweight stroller just what I was looking for. Disappointed with the back support to the seat.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: LadyAnna
Title: Waste of money
Body: I absolutely HATE this stroller. Although it says it reclines back, it does not recline far so baby can rest comfortably. The upright feature still does not have your child sit up all the way. The mesh material makes your baby slide. We had to put a towel under her to help her not slide. The basket underneath isn't evem big enough for your average size diaper bag. It is super light, which is a plus, the extended canopy does help on sunny days. but that's about it. Of course I trashed the box, or else it would have gone right back. Very didappointing.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: MAIN
Title: A++
Body: A+++ simply a great product. Don't overthink this item all it does is work.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Baskota
Title: Highly recommend it
Body: Very light weight easy opening and folding
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: ThisTrain
Title: When travelling...
Body: We bought the same model about two years ago for our older child and this is slightly different in not-so-much-better ways. 1) when folded, the lock does not lock tightly, and when you try to tighten/flatten it more, the lock comes undone. The old one wouldn't flatten all the way, either, but it would at least stay locked when flattened further (e.g., it's natural that it become more flattened when in a full trunk), 2) when folded and locked, the older one folded in such a way that you could roll the folded stroller on its wheels-super convenient. With this latest one, the basket drags on the floor so you can't roll it, it can only be carried. Bummer. The good news is that it is fairly light, but we were counting on this feature, as we are going to the airport with lots of other bags to carry... Also, like the older model, this has terrible back support, the tray is cumbersome to remove (watch your manicures!), and the cupholder is too small and shallow. Why did we buy this-again? We needed a lightweight stroller for air travel and the umbrella ones don't accomodate older/larger toddlers. The price point is great, but it is not a five star stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Da bees knees baby
Body: My lil gangsta is happy as can be throwin up the set out the side of her stroller hollerin out thug life
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: brigitte
Title: Under neath storage is good, and easy to access
Body: My 14 month looks UNCOMFORTABLE. The back can not be adjusted for the occupant to sit up straight so what happens... my tot slouches as we stroll forward causing the center strap that holds her in to ride right on her privates. Lightweight- Yes. Under neath storage is good, and easy to access. The hand folding doesn't work for me or my hubby.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: NanaNou
Title: Perfect!
Body: Bought for our granddaughter on her trips to visit. Popped right up and works wonderful! Saves a lot of packing a baby and equipment.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: JB
Title: it's a nice stroller, lightweight but my son is too tall
Body: it's a nice stroller, lightweight but my son is too tall, guess it good for kids that not so tall..

Author: Rick
Title: Excellent alternative to the baby carrier.
Body: The best for storing in the car and for trips to the store etc.

Author: ACH
Title: the hook that's there to keep it folded is useless (poor engineering)
Body: My biggest complaints are that it's difficult fold up unless the wheels are aligned just right (requires multiple tries), the hook that's there to keep it folded is useless (poor engineering), and right out of the box it was wobbly. However, with that said it does the trick in that it's small, lightweight, has a decent sunshade, and has a great turning radius. I'd describe this stroller as a step up from an umbrella stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: PR
Title: It depends on my mood
Body: Some times this stroller leaves a lot to be desired. The storage area is open in the front so items can slip out. The wheels sometimes don't align well to close very easily. While you (typically) only need one hand to close it you almost always need two hands to open it because the wheels are so snug together when closed. The handle is sorta low but that is probably par for the course if you're tall. I want to like it more than I do since it was almost $70 but I can't. I do love the clear window to see the kid. And the shade it provides. Very pleased with the shade coverage. Steers well and has held up pretty nicely.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Title: Perfect for our Disneyland vacation
Body: Perfect for our Disneyland vacation, folds up nicely for getting on the plane, putting in the trunk of the rental, and rolls well through hours and hours and hours of walking 🤣. My son was able to rest just fine in it.

Author: CW
Title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
Body: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!! We bought 2 of these and neither of them lasted. They don't fold easily at all. The nanny used extra force to try and fold this thing (because it jams so often) and she bent it, now it's unusable. The second stroller was for grandma and hers broke also. It jammed during folding and she broke the seat support using extra force trying to close it. Please buy something else!

Author: NYer523
Title: Great price.Lightweight.QUICK&EASY assembly
Body: This was by far the easiest assembly I've ever had to do for any baby product so far. No tools necessary, everything just clicks into place. It might have taken me 10 minutes at most.It's super lightweight. I love that it has a tray table for both baby and Mom or Dad.And the main feature that sold me (besides the price) was the weight capacity. Unfortunately my two year old outgrew the cheapo single stroller I had bought for her so the 50 lb capacity on this Kolcraft one should last us a while. And even though I really didn't want to have to spend anymore money on strollers, this was definitely $50 well spent.

Author: NX

Body: Lightweight, easy to fold and unfold. Comes with cup holders for adult and child. Storage basket size is impressive. Canopy has a plastic peekaboo window, but the overall size is just mediocre. Worst feature is the seat angle. It angles down and forward, so the child is constantly sliding forward and getting a frontal wedgie from the crotch strap! Would not recommend using for longer than a grocery shopping trip.

Author: ABC
Title: Traveled great!
Body: Very lightweight! We used this for my almost four year old on a recent trip several states away. She is average size, and had plenty of room. SO handy to have for the zoo and whatnot. I flew with this on a plane (I bought the red travel bag reccomended) and had no issues.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: What I like about this stroller mostly is the larger size canopy
Body: What I like about this stroller mostly is the larger size canopy. The parent tray is nice and so is the child tray. Some cups may not fit in the child tray. A little tricky to fold, but once you get the hang of it no problem. It stand nicely. Pretty easy to put together. To get child in and out you can either place inside with child tray attached or unhook child tray completely and then re-hook on. Shoulder straps are not my favorite you have to clip them to attach and would be easier if they just snapped in. Stroller does not make noise while pushing it which is a plus! Overall pretty good so far and I would recommend it.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Marmfam
Title: Seat feels like cardboard with thin pad over it
Body: Very cheaply made. Seat feels like cardboard with thin pad over it. Wheels are plastic. If you are looking for an extra stroller for occasional use, this is fine. If you want a stroller for more frequent use, this one will not hold up.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Turtle
Title: Child keeps sliding out of seat
Body: The stroller is easy to assemble and use. The only thing I dislike is the angle of the seat. It angles down a bit and my 1yr old is constantly sliding down. It creates space between her low back and the back of the seat, I don't feel it's good for her back.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Anne
Title: Kolcraft stroller
Body: We love the Kolcraft stroller. We bought it to take to Mexico and it has been great. Very easy to maneuver and has lots of space to store things. Our granddaughter has no complaints. She loves riding in it and naps a lot in it by the pool The only negatives for us are the bumpiness of the ride over the cobblestone streets and getting the stroller folded up to get on the bus. It takes a little work. Overall, it has met our needs and we will love using it when back in the states.

Author: Peyton Hayslip
Title: Five Stars

Author: Amazon Customer

Going down a hill and decided to give my son a little run down the hill...little did I know the front wheels started wobbling like as if it got caught on something. Author: Jordan
Title: Five Stars
Body: This is a great stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: lyssa9806
Title: Pretty good for the money
Body: Pretty good. Has plastic wheels is probably my biggest complaint about it. This is the first umbrella type stroller I've purchased so I'm not sure how common that is in this price range. But otherwise it's pretty decent.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sara C.
Title: This stroller is excellent at being a stroller, but the extras" are a bit lacking."
Body: This stroller is excellent at being a stroller, but the extras are a bit lacking. I love the 5 point harness, the easy to use brakes, the wheels that get over most bumps (not for off-roading though) and the easy maneuverability of this stroller. The large basket underneath is a bonus too. However, there are a few down sides to this stroller. First, they have a major flaw in the trays; those cup holders are too small for any cup I've ever seen! And it's not that they don't have room for it, they just don't make it the shape that fits cups. It's more of a bumpy oval than a circle. Second, their canopy extension doesn't stay collapsed if you don't want to use it. It falls down from it's folded position more often than stays shut. One more item I wanted to to mention is that this stroller is NOT a one handed fold, BUT it is very easy to fold.That being said, I would very much recommend this stroller for travel. We went for a overnight trip to Chicago and it did wonderfully on the buses and trains. We were able to fold it up and carry it easily with two book bags, a small duffel bag and my pumping bag, as well as carrying our son.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Karen Mullins
Title: Great stroller for the money
Body: Great stroller for the money. Sent it to Florida for when my grandchildren arrived and it is light weight, folds easily, and has drink holders and storage.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: I love this stroller
Body: I love this stroller. Good for walking in the park or traveling through the airport. It is not very compact though and takes up a good amount of space in the trunk. I love the big storage compartment and the on hand folding feature. Only downside is my parent tray did not fit onto the stroller so was unable to use that.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Linda Suchomski
Title: Five Stars
Body: Very easy to put together and it is really nice for walks around my neighborhood. highly recommend
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jaimie Meow
Title: Great travel stroller.
Body: Its a great travel stroller for the price. Its a little larger than an umbrella but still very light. The cup holders are small but will fit a bottle or tall NUK sippy cup. I put bottles of water in mine up top. The storage bin wont fit a diaper bag but will fit a small purse and loose items just fine. Extra blanket, toys, etc. I bought this solely for travel through airports and on my trip and it has held up well and we've had no issues.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sean Lipscomb
Title: It's Light, Folds Well, But I keep Kicking the Brake bar
Body: So far so good. We got this for a trip to Prague that is coming up (I'll write more after the trip). My mom will be using this a lot so we wanted it to be light (which it is) and we wanted it to fold easily (which it does). It steers well, locks easily enough and assembly was straight forward. The reason for the three stars is because I am 6'2 with longer legs and I keep kicking the brake bar. I don't mind where my hands are, the handle doesn't move up or down, but that doesn't bother me, but what does bother me is that I have to lean over a bit because when I walk normally, my stride keeps kicking the bar. Again, I'll update after the trip.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jason J. Chao
Title: I like having one solid horizontal handle because it lets me ...
Body: For the price this was a solid purchase.We use it as a supplemental travel stroller for when we go somewhere that's going to need a lot of walking for the older child. Our regular go to stroller is an uppa vista.I like having one solid horizontal handle because it lets me push it with one hand more easily.I'm 6'2 and often have to bend over to push smaller strollers, but this one I am able to push fairly comfortably.The snack tray is too small and the cup holder is really small and will basically only hold juice boxes.Also the snack tray has a very odd way of snapping on and off that is inconvenient, but it does keep the child in the stroller.Straps are good and not uncomfortably poking if they aren't being used.The foot rest covers the wheels pretty well so even my 4 year old won't hit the wheels with her feet if she's riding in it.The locking latch comes out way to easily.Basket space is pretty good. Fits a medium size backpack (jansport standard) or bag.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: jay
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: I have a larger BOB jogging stroller that is not much fun to travel with
Body: The stroller works really well for me. I have a larger BOB jogging stroller that is not much fun to travel with, so I bought this and can keep it in the back of the jeep without taking up the whole area.I gave it 4 out of 5 stars b/c-when you fold it up you have to hold it a certain way for it to stay closed (the red thing that I think is supposed to hold things together doesn't fit over anything in a holding fashion...I have two of these strollers and they both have the same issue).-the cup holders are small, only a 16oz bottle fits.Other than that I like the stroller-I am 5'9 and don't have to bend over at all while pushing it-light weight-
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kevin S.
Title: Great Stroller for the Price
Body: I think this is a great stroller for the money. We have a Bob and need something smaller, lighter, and more practical for running errands, or walking to dinner with our 5 month-old. This is so light and easy to throw in a car. Does a great job of getting us around town. I'm very happy with my purchase.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sporter
Title: Great stroller
Body: Oh what a relief it is...it is lightweight for Grandma. The parents have a heavy, clunker stroller that we would pass back and forth, but this one is so easy. It isn't industrial stregnth, but I didn't buy it for that. Walking through the neighborhood and maybe shopping. Fits the bill for me! My 7 1/2 month old loves it. And I like that the tray comes off so that it can be cleaned. She loves looking at everyone's garden from her new stroller!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: RJreader
Title: Excellent everyday stroller!!
Body: I love this stroller!!! I have 3 kids ages 0-5 and over the past 5 years I've gone through 6 different strollers. I've had an umbrella stroller, a jogging stroller, a sit/stand stroller, a car seat frame stroller...and this is the last stroller I will ever use!Pros: super lightweight, very quick/easy to fold, rolls very smoothly, can navigate with one hand, folds compactly, nice sized sun cover, generous storage space for a stroller its size, adjustable seat recline.Cons: As others have said, the cup holders are on the small side. My nalgene water bottles do not fit in them, but paper coffee cups fit.This is a really great stroller for everyday use.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Three Stars
Body: The stroller seems like a great buy. However the front wheel wobbles a lot.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: L. K. Hayes
Title: The wheels have to be in a perfect position, which I'm having to do manually
Body: I bought this stroller because I already own the regular Cloud, which my large 1 1/2 yr old has somewhat outgrown. I did a bit of research before purchasing. What swayed me in favor of the Cloud Plus were the following factors:One hand fold5 put harnessRider trayParent trayReclining seatIt has more bells and whistles than the regular Cloud, for sure. I just assembled it today but I already foresee problems with said upgrades. First, the one hand fold is awkward. Even following directions in manual, it doesn't fold every time. Maybe I'll figure out the magic formula eventually. It also doesn't fold to the standing or even storing position without serious cajoling. The wheels have to be in a perfect position, which I'm having to do manually.The rider tray doesn't flip like other strollers do. It has to be manually snapped completely on and off every time child wants to get in or out. Tedious. This is going to be a real pain. I like the parent tray, however.The reclining seat reclines to about 45 degrees. This will work for my toddler but I can see where parents might like a more flat reclining position. The big problem for us is that when upright, it's not erect enough for us. My toddler wants to sit up more than possible with this stroller. So she strains. I put a towel behind her to prop her up more but I don't feel like this is a realistic option when we use it at the zoo or other place where she's in and out a lot.I guess all in all it's a decent value for the money. I don't know if I'd buy again. Time will tell.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: luv2read
Title: no
Body: disappointed, assembly required.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Nice stroller for the price
Body: Nice stroller for the price. Easy to assemble. I like the cargo space underneath. I was concerned about the back support simply because another review had complaints. I have not found the back support to be an issue at all. Easy to collapse and fold. All in all, great bang for your buck.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: S Naipaul
Title: Good Stuff
Body: For the price its awesome
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: JennyPacificNW
Title: Five Stars
Body: Nice and compact.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: mamabear
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great light weight stroller!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Cynthia Purcell
Title: easy to put together
Body: Stroller is as stated, Lightweight. Light to lift, easy to put together, but I'm still on a learning curve when it comes to folding it up to put it in my vehicle. It is also designed for lightweight use, I'd suggest staying on paved areas as the wheels are definitely not designed for any rugged off trail use. I went into the grass at my local park carrying my 9 month old granddaughter but was forced back onto pavement out of fear of breaking the plastic wheels. If you only take walks on pavement this stroller is fine.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: C. McMillan
Title: Love it, works great, is sturdy and safe
Body: Love this stroller; it's easy, spacious, stands on its own, compact, and feels sturdy. All this while being pretty light and comfortable to my 10 month old boy.There is a nice organization area at the top and gives a nice tray at the bottom.I love the window at the top. It's clear and my son can look up and feel a little better knowing we're there.I used this stroller at a baseball game and this stroller made things a breeze.It's a little bigger than a super small umbrella style. But smaller than a full size stroller. It's perfect for real life.Love it!

I'm really frustrated with it because I bought it to be in my van for when I go places. If you're on the fence about this stroller buy a different one and pass on this one. It doesn't hold up and I'm very easy on strollers.

The foot rest is adjustable, but just kept falling to its lowest position also. I'd recommend it for the price.

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Loving It!
Body: I love this stroller, is so lightweight and it rolls very nicely. It is on the smaller side, so I wouldn't recommend to taller people. I'm 5'4 and it is just about right for me. My daughter (she's two months) loves it so much. She used to love her car seat as a Newborn, but as she got older and more curious, she acts like the car seats are too constricting. I popped her in this and she immediately stopped crying when I rolled her around(rolled her around for an hour and only took her out because she needed a diaper change). I purchased the Summer Infant Snuzzler head support and it fits great. This is going to make my upcoming trip to Texas a lot easier. And shopping. Baby is too heavy for me to carry and she screams when she's in her car seat too long. Two months and fourteen pounds 😲😨 And it helps soothe her to sleep. All in all, I love this stroller. It only gets four stars because of the horrid smell. It smells like chemicals and cat pee. Like if they were to make a chemical smell based off cat pee, this would be it. I remember thinking when I opened it, 'Did a freaking cat pee right next to me?'. It gave me a head ache
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: IH
Title: Great everyday stroller for occasional outdoor use.
Body: I gave this stroller only four stars because when you have it upright, it's still inclined at about 110° and my toddler will only use strollers with a full upright backrest. I also need more sun coverage than the canopy provides due to the intense heat in this city.These ussues aside, I would recommend this stroller for everyday use because it is easy to open and close, lift, has a moderate canopy (not enough for this Texas weather but great for mostly indoor use or moderately sunny days), and it has a generous and accessible storage basket.Although the backrest does recline further back, it does not lie flat. The foot rest is in a fixed position. The handlebar is in a fixed position and great for short to average height parents. I don't recommend this stroller for taller than average parents.The stroller also comes with EVA (sturdy, molded plastic) wheels. However, they have ridges on the wheels which makes them more suitable to occasionally riding over gravel (think of strolling around and only some parts of the road have sidewalks while other parts have gravel). We do a lot of walking and don't have fully cemented sidewalks here. Because of these wheels and the front end suspension, I'd be completely confident that my child would be comfortable in this stroller when we ride over spots that are missing the sidewalk and only have gravel. Also note that if you plan to use this stroller for more children, you can buy replacement wheels and easily install them.If your child doesn't mind a slight incline when sitting up, doesn't need to lie flat on his back, you don't need a lot of sun protection (you use a stroller outdoors only occasionally or have lots of shade as in a wooded park) and you are not tall, then I highly recommend this stroller.Unfortunately, we live in an extremely hot city where just opening the doors of you house make the water in your eyeballs start to evaporate. Yeah, the heat is intense here. Moreover, my child will only use stroller where she can sit completely upright so this stroller sadly won't work for us.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Very light and easy to use
Body: Very light and easy to use. I use it everyday and is very comfortable for the baby. Great product.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: camelca
Title: Good for the price
Body: We were looking for our second stroller to replace heavy and bulky travel system stroller for coming vacations. We just put it together and use it inside of house and here are my likes and drawbacks.Likes:- light- easy to assemble- reclines in 2 positions- cup holder & tray (cup holders are small still our son's cups and our travel mug fit just fine)- canopy covers well- big storage (kind strange front side is open tho)Drawbacks:- not one hand folding. You need to use your the other hand to push tray toward handle to fold- i do not like the brake unlocking mechanism. You need to push up the lock with your toe. If you are wearing flip-flop your big toe kind hurts...Overall these drawbacks are not deal breaker for us. For the price this stroller has a lot of features. It has a latch to keep the stroller in fold position but stroller gets flatter if you don't use it.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Anna Y.
Title: OK for kids under 20 lbs only
Body: It is super light, very fast to assemble, and a great travel stroller for younger kids. However, it did not work for my 3 year old. My child is very very small for his age (I'm talking super tiny, weighs 24 lbs, so skinny he's diagnosed with failure to thrive and close to getting a G-tube) and this stroller is too small for him. I think it is OK for kids less than 20 lbs. The max weight on this is 40lbs but I have no idea how a 40 lb kid can sit in this. I will be returning this because we took it out for the first time today, used it for 2 hours and whole time my kid was super uncomfortable, about to fall out of the seat. If I bought this when he was 1 year old, then I would have kept it. But it's no use to me now.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Maggie
Title: Easy to push
Body: Thank you Kolcraft. I vaciliitated between Maclaren Volo and this one. Volo didn't recline low enough for 4.5 infant and also back padding was just a thin sheet. Kolcraft, reclines low enough that he can be sleeping at entire time of travel and its back padding is generously insulated. Bottom tray comes real handy that I used for heavy grocery once in a while. It really is one hand fold. Especially after practicing for couple weeks. Very light. Easy to push. Nice insulation padding on the handle. Generous canopy. This umbrella stroller offered me everything I had expected from umbrella stroller. Transit is easy now.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Lori Collins
Title: Five Stars
Body: Light weight and easy to throw in the trunk. Good value!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tricia
Title: WORST STROLLER EVER
Body: I needed a stroller for a recent trip to Disneyworld. My current light weight stroller was lost in a sea of boxes and I figured grabbing a new one wouldn't be bad. I compared strollers AND reviews and took a chance on this stroller. I don't think I've ever hated something so much in my life.-the cup holders are tiny. You have to really push a regular sized bottle of water into it. And when you pull the bottle out, the whole cup holder tray comes off.-the cup holder on the kid size is even smaller, you can't even fit a water bottle in there. Maybe a juice box could fit. Maybe.-it says one handed closing. LIES. With two hands, both my husband and I had issues which lead to much cussing on the buses to the park. Once you finally get it closed, if you are lucky enough to line up the wheels JUST FREAKING SO, you have to use this little lock hook to keep it closed only any small jostle will pop it off which means your stroller opens up. Cue a lot more cussing.-the seat back is not soft at all. The part where the mesh meets the seat (where your kid will rest his or her head) is super hard. It hurt my sons head from day one so we'd have to try to keep a blanket bunched up to keep him comfortable but it was really hot so he'd get sweaty really fast. While it was nice to have a little mesh window to see my kid while I'm strolling him along, I hated it was at the price of his comfort.-trying to take the tray off and snap it back on was uber annoying.-If you are tall, this is not the stroller for you.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Moons
Title: Five Stars
Body: We bought for travel purposes, it is now our everyday stroller!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Beauty
Title: Good Buy
Body: I put this baby together myself! That is saying a lot because I hardly ever put anything together. I was able to get this done in about a half hour. Its good quality and just the right size, not too small or big. My 2 year old was really comfortable during our vacation.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amanda H Moseley
Title: Could use some improvements
Body: For a lightweight, quick and easy stroller this is just fine. It opens and closes relatively easily and is very lightweight. The brakes work well and the storage is decent. The cup holders are all pretty small however and don't fit our sippy cups which is a nuisance, and it's frustrating that the seat doesn't decline all the way or smoothly, it's not a one step process unless you gather the fabric together as you loosen it and then slowly low the seat down yourself. And lifting it can't be done all at once either so there's not much luck in keeping a baby asleep while adjusting the seat if needed. Otherwise my son has fallen asleep so it will do the trick! All in all, it works but I would have rather waited and spent a little extra for the fully reclining seat and better cup holders.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: J werner
Title: Recommended
Body: We love this stroller! It's easy to fold up and has room underneath for extra items. We bought this specifically for a trip to an amusement park where we would need to use a bus and carry extra items and it was wonderful. The cup holder for the child could not fit a bigger sippy cup, but the take and toss cups fit fine. I highly recommend this product.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Body: We bought 2 of these to take to Disney World. A full week of rolling a 3-year old and a 6-month old were made easier by these strollers. The canopy is much larger than any other similarly priced stroller. The thing folds compactly - once you learn the trick of positioning the front wheels - and unfolds with a flick of the wrist. I highly recommend this stroller.

Author: KtnBritesmommy
Title: I love, love
Body: I love, love, love it. I have owned several strollers between my daughter (9 yrs)and my son (1 yr). I drive a very small car (Ford Fiesta) and being in a small apartment I always store my stroller in the trunk of my car. This trailer has everything, cup holders on top for me, cup holders on bottom for my baby, nice big basket, the seat back leans back or sits up, has a sun protector on top, and it is small enough to fit in my trunk with tons of groceries or luggage or whatever also I got stored in there. It is also very lightweight and easy to maneuver. I've had it now for at least 2 months and use it several times a week. It is priced very good for all that it does and I find it very durable. (I dont take it off roading or jogging, but stores, county fair, paved paths are all good)

This is cheap enough to get two. The girls love it and now can decide on if they want to go in the double one or go in their own. They don't sleep in it and it doesn't look like it would be great for sleeping as it doesn't recline much. We just use it in the upright position.

Title: You won't regret purchasing this stroller.

It's perfect for smaller trunk spaces. When I take it to a restaurant it gets tucked away next to my table or booth as it has a 1-hand fold system and stands while folded in. Two nice cup holders and a middle slot for a phone or keys. Gripping cushion pads that cover the handle bar for hand grip comfort. I have even used it in rocky and sandy terrain and it is awesome!

It has held up well through cobblestone roads, although not ideal, it has worked. The sun shade actually covers my son as many stroller shades do not. This was a huge perk. Also I like having the tray for snacks. The storage basket is decent sized in comparison to most although it does not have closure in the front section under the feet area but this hasn't been a problem for me. I would highly recommend.

Since this stroller is light, I can toss it in the back of the car and in no time we're at the park or the mall. the basket underneath is large enough for a purse, jacket and mini-diaper bag and the cup holder on baby's tray is sheer genius for a sippy cup or a few Cheerios and raisins for the ride.

Author: Joanna
Title: Great compact stroller.
Body: I love how compact this stroller is without sacrificing basket, or cup holder space! I marked down one star though for its maneuverability which is lacking especially over a rougher terrain, aka dirt. Unfortunately there are no sidewalks along the major road where I live so we have to walk along a lot of dirt paths and parking lots. This stroller does not roll along it as well as my baby trend jogger stroller did. I get stuck quite a bit on the smallest bumps. If the wheels were slightly bigger and were the kind you put air in rather than plastic, it would probably roll along better. Other than that, very happy with this purchase. It also takes up less cargo space in my suv so I can actually use all 7 seats if I need to and the stroller will still fit behind the seats!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Title: Bought this for our cruise and I'm so glad I did

Author: Greg P
Title: Cup holders DO NOT hold cups- laughably small! False Advertising!
Body: This seemed great from the reviews but barely got the thing put together before deciding to send it back. It really is a cheaply made, glorified umbrella stroller. i love the fact that it folds up to a standing position, but that's where it ends. I was almost willing to overlook the cheap plastic wheels and the sagging back (no way does this support a 50lb child as the description says). But the real reason was that the cup holders shouldn't legally be able to be called cup holders. All three of them are round holes that DO NOT FIT CUPS. Unless you exclusively drink out of dixie cups, I'm serious- this doesn't even come close to holding a sippy cup. It's just straight up false advertising.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: crm17
Title: Don't waste your money... keep looking
Body: Bad stroller.... 1) feels cheap, 2) does not stay folded, 3) cup holders too small to fit most sippy cups, 4) requires more power to push around, 5) opening in canopy does not have a cover, thus when the sun is behind you, it shines straight on toddler's head, 6) tray is not easily removable, thus putting in and taking out child requires extra effort, 6) harness is way too short and tight, even on the loose setting ... only good thing is the storage basket which is large and easily accessible.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Rae
Title: Shallow seat but otherwise great for price and the options!
Body: I was looking for a small portable stroller for the van. I was very specific in wanting a stroller that had a sun shade that would cover my child's face well, a tray or bar in front so that he could hold on as well as preventing him from falling out while young, parent tray for phone. keys or water, a basket underneath for any items we may need to carry with us and one that would be comfortable. We have used this for now three months. It has been a great stroller. It collapses pretty easy. Some times I have to recollapses multiple times to get it to fold completely, but it will stand up on its own after its completely folded (and with a child on the hip, so sometimes a one hand fold). The sun shade pulls down quite far and covers from the sun glare. The bottle tray is very small and only holds small water bottles, but we place bigger ones int he basket and use the tray for toys or the phone. The only thing I didn't like, which I would have returned it had my husband not thrown the box away is the seat is very shallow. My son always looks lke hes falling out and has less comfort to fit his big bottom (hes only 10 months so not sure how long he will fit). Typically he is in this stroller for short periods of time through a store so the shallow seat doesnt seem to make a huge difference.Also to add- we have traveled with this stroller, flying, and it did the job well. The basket sticks out quite a bit in the back so I was able to hook my diaper bag to the back of the stroller and have the bag sit on the basket and still utilize the basket for other items.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: M W
Title: It's and ok stroller
Body: I got this product after a long search for a light stroller. I own two Peg Perego Easy Vela but kept having problems with the front wheels.In my opinion, this stroller is light alright. But that's about it.The quality of the fabric, and quality of plastic used on the components justifies the low price.In my opinion, it's a bit on the flimsy side. The seat is wide enough but it's definitely very short. My son is 4yrs old and weighs 38 lbs. I doubt that this will hold comfortable any child more than 40 lbs (again, in my opinion).The basket underneath is not as big and if you push items to far they will fall through the other side. If I would have more time I would keep looking and maybe increase my budget to get a better product. But for now I will keep it for as long as it will last, then look elsewhere. Assembly was easy though.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Mz
Title: Really like this stroller
Body: Really like this stroller. Easy to use, fold and store.Sometimes it doesn't fold up as tight as it could due to wheel placement, but once you learn how to do it - it is easy.I have had one of the wheel covers pop off, with light use- but it doesn't affect strolling.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: HappyTraveler
Title: Best Travel Stroller for WDW
Body: We purchased this stiller in early 2016 for use on a May trip to Walt Disney World (WDW). We paid full price on Amazon and were neither compensated, nor solicited, for our feedback in anyway. Since purchasing the stroller, it has been to WDW twice – once in May and again in July of 2016. We bought this stroller after extensive research and reading every review on just about every light-weight stroller on Amazon and at Babies-R-Us. The stroller arrived quickly (Two Days-Prime) after placing our order. Assembly was easy – attach straps to seat, snap in front wheels and attached the front child’s tray.PROS:1. Very light weight – I can easily lift with one arm.2. Easy one-handed open and close - great for when you have the infant in the other hand.3. Strong safety straps – child is held in securely with five point restraints.4. Tall enough for a 5’10” man and a 5’6” woman to use comfortably5. Sun visor is far reaching and easily cover child in the harshest of sunlight.6. Durable – survived two round trip flights, and countless open and close folds in and out of a car’s trunk with no defects7. Easy to steer and maneuver – wheels roll easily over smooth and semi-smooth surfaces.8. Storage basket under stroller is large9. Drink holders for parent’s drinks securely holds bottles and cups.10. When folded, child’s tray does not touch the ground11. When folded stroller is self-standingCONS:1. Folding lock is to long – stroller folds up smaller than locking device allows – not a big deal an only an issue when needing to lock closed when boarding passenger trams and trains, etc. We did not use it when loading into trunk or placing into gate check bag.2. Child cannot lay complete flat, not sit up completely straight – However, our son had no problem falling asleep in the stroller when fully reclined. Lays out to about 160 degree. Does not sit child up vertically at 90 degrees. Child can only sit back at about 10 degrees from vertical. Again, son did not have any issues sitting in stroller for long periods.We would purchase this stroller again without hesitation.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Phillip Wears
Title: This stroller is a champion. Still using it nearly ...
Body: This stroller is a champion. Still using it nearly a year after we purchased it. For the price and convenience of size/weight, it has been worth it many times over.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Money Honey
Title: Good Travel Stroller, but not durable enough for everyday use.
Body: Good Stroller for the price.PROS:1. Extremely light weight and great for travel.2. The umbrella offers much better cover than many of the other strollers available in this price point.3. The similar light weight Graco stroller didn't offer the full harness like this one, and with our squirmy little toddler a full restraint was a must.4. Extremely compact when folded.CONS:1. The recline of the back of the stroller is awkward and can't really be adjusted easily.2. The basket underneath is very tiny and its difficult to get things in and out of it, especially when your child is in the stroller.3. This is not a one hand fold stroller, the wheels have to be in an exact position or it won't fold correctly. Additionally it doesn't stay locked in a folded position well. Just picking it up to move it can cause it to open which can be a pain.4. It's really not meant for everyday use. We originally purchased the stroller exclusively for when we were traveling because of how light it was and it was well below the airline stroller weight restriction. However, 3 months ago we moved to the city of Chicago and now use the stroller every single day to take our son to and from daycare and to activities on the weekend, and the stroller is just not made for that type of beating.Ultimately the stroller has been great for travel and its probably the best stroller at this price point but now that we're in the city we've upgraded to the far more durable Baby Jogger City Mini. The City Mini is significantly more expensive but when it comes to durability you get what you pay for.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jimmy l Gillespie
Title: Best errand stroller!
Body: I LOVE this stroller. It traveled through 4 plane rides & 3 days at disneyworld! The lightweight was so wonderful for travel & the basket gives enough room for several bags. The one handed feature also came in extremely handy with an infant. Great stroller for the price!

The seat is not nearly deep enough and also not very upright as i expected based on other reviews. My kid is about 32 tall so not sure if that factors into it. For a smaller kid it might be ok.

Author: I bought this
Title: but found this which is pretty much the same stroller
Body: I bought Jeep version of this stroller for my 1st child a 2 years ago. When my second child got bigger, we needed a second stroller. I bought two others, but they didn't hold up well compared to Jeep Stroller that we still use today. I couldn't find the Jeep stroller on Amazon anymore, but found this which is pretty much the same stroller. I am happy with this, you can fit lots of things in the bottom and it has a smooth ride. I wish the cup holder was wider, but overall its a great stroller
