Author: Amazon Customer
Title: I am pleased with this stroller
Body: I am pleased with this stroller. This lightweight stroller is easy to steer, to fold and to get into the car. However, I am still fumbling to open it quickly with one hand.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Magsmom
Title: Great Stroller
Body: Lightweight, easy to open and close. Love the cup holders.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: frank lisser
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great deal for the money
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Shirley B
Title: I love this stroller
Body: I love this stroller! It is lightweight and easy to use and colapse with one hand. The tray is difficult to attach, but is not necessarily needed. It has everything I need, and maneuvers easily. Plenty of space for a purse, cup of coffee, extra snacks, goodies, diapers, etc.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Perfect!
Body: I love this stroller. Extremely easy as 1,2,3. I really enjoy it. Perfect for my child and me. It has cup holders, it's light, it folds up so easy, and I am able to store the diaper bag underneath. Absolutely the perfect lightweight stroller.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Megan JR
Title: i'm in love!
Body: i was looking for a small lightweight stroller that was basically an umbrella stroller but not as small. this thing is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!! my 2.5 y/o LOVES it! he doesn't fight me to sit in it like he did his umbrella stroller and he loves having a tray for his rocks :) ! if i had to pick anything at all that i don't like about this stroller it would be that the seat doesn't recline as much as i would like but that's a VERY small price to pay for the awesomeness that is this cadillac of lightweight strollers! some of the things i LOVE about it are that the seat sits very upright if you want it to, the child and parent trays are awesome for trips to the zoo or anywhere really where you may have a drink or snack and need a place to put it, the basket below the seat it quite large for a stroller of its size ( it is open in the front though so i wouldn't recommend putting anything small there or it'll likely fall out), the easy assembly was amazing as well it was so nice to pull it out of the box and almost not need to look at the instructions to put it together however i did have to go to the store and buy shear pins for the back wheels because my stroller didn't come with any (it was supposed to), but oh well they are cheap and it really wasn't that big a deal to me.i could go on and on about the things i love about this stroller but i won't. i highly recommend it!(the 3 pictures i've attached have my 40lb very tall for his age 2.5 y/o sitting in the stroller)
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Love it! Just what we were looking for.
Body: We love this stroller. It was important for us to get something lightweight and easy to use. The only hiccup with its design us that 1 out of 10 times it can be hard to fold up completely BC the wheels aren't positioned quite right so you have bend over and move them to make it fold. The only other negatives are I wish the bottom strap was adjustable but the would probably effect safety. And I would like larger cup holders for the parent.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: jessica
Title: Four Stars
Body: works great, great price. Easy assembly.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ruby Bell
Title: Excellent stroller with user friendly features.
Body: Love this stroller! I had a Jeep Cherokee stroller that got damaged when I searched for a replacement, this is the option that popped up. It's a slightly smaller version of the Jeep Cherokee stroller & is missing a few options - but I didn't use them anyway. There is a tray with cup holder for the rider & a tray with 2 cup holders for the one pushing the under basket is a generous size, the sunshade is nice & large & it golds easily & fits easily in my trunk. Excellent value.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: easy to Mount
Body: Lightweight, easy to Mount, once you get used to it, which takes one o two days.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: MotherOfTWO
Title: Waste of money
Body: Very dissatisfied. Doesn't fold well at all. Extremely difficult to fold with one hand. After a few uses the seat lost its shape/ support. My son looks so uncomfortable when sitting in it. The cup holder for the kid is too small for most sippy cups.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Diana Delgado
Title: Three Stars
Body: The back doesn't go all the way down. But for the price it is fine
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Tydyky
Title: I basically hate this stroller
Body: Where do I start.... I basically hate this stroller, but that is because I normally use a bob and bought this stroller to use in Disneyland because I didn't want to risk my bob being stolen.Pros:It is very light & compact.Excellent sized basket below.Cup holders work for some bottles.InexpensiveThe red is nice for Disneyland.Cons:Our 3 year old is 40 inches and 40lbs and barely fits in it. He weighs it down so much that it is challenging to push.I'm almost 5'10'' and it is a bit uncomfortable for me because the handle bar is so low and my stride is so long that I kick the stroller if I am not careful. (My husband hates it.)Overall I would recommend it for what we are using it for: a low use travel stroller. I would not recommend it for regular use.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Joanna
Title: easy fold etc
Body: actually our second one to buy! Lol, we ran over our first one, so here we go again. We just couldn't find a lightweight, practical, easy fold etc. for the $ anywhere else. Hold up great except for backing over it, lol
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: William Berger
Title: Good Value
Body: A very good value. It has all of the features I need in an inexpensive stroller for my visits with my 6 month old great grandson. He was comfortable and smiling as we wheeled him. It folded easily as stores well for the occasional visits. The tray in back easily held our sodas as we wandered the mall.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: C.R.
Title: Great lightweight stroller
Body: We love this umbrella stroller. It folds up nicely with one hand and stands on its own while folded. For being a light stroller it feels sturdy and rolls nicely. The only thing you have to be careful with is it will tip over if you have a heavy bag attached to the handles and a light baby or when you take your child out. Luckily it has a big storage underneath and you can put a purse or diaper bag down there.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Best lightweight stroller ever!!!
Body: This stroller traveled with us all through Europe. Uneven terrain, curbs, nothing was an issue for the miles we walked every day. This stroller came everywhere with us..on planes, boats, trains, and cars and it was easy to fold and unfold and light to carry. We have many pricier strollers but this one ranks right up there.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Smiley
Title: Highly recommend
Body: It's light, folds easy, and has a compartment for carrying supplies. And I love the color red.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Vincent Ardizzone
Title: Terrific product at a great price
Body: Terrific product at a great price. Well designed, constructed and easy to use. Getting dozens of hours of use out of it.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Lynette
Title: Five Stars
Body: Great stroller!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kindle Customer
Title: easy to push
Body: very lightweight. easy to push. doesn't fold as compact as I would like but stands alone once folded
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: shamsa sikandar
Title: Five Stars
Body: Very good.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Doug K
Title: Bought as a Gift
Body: I ordered this for a friends baby shower gift. It got here fast, and she absolutely loved it. She put it together the same day, and her baby is due any day now. So, she will be able to use this soon.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: Very good quality product in this price range.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kim
Title: Five Stars
Body: Awesome stroller, not bulky, with a smooth ride
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: ErinMc
Title: Five Stars
Body: great second or additional stroller for the car
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: It was very easy to assemble
Body: It was very easy to assemble. The stroller is easy to get the child in and out of. However, the locking system for the rear wheels needs to be improved. I have to lock it by bending down to lock it instead of being able to do it with my foot.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Disappointing.
Body: This stroller is tiny. My husband can't push it without hunching, my 15 month old was squished in it, and the large cargo area didn't even fit my baby bag.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: HotNmy68
Title: Easy open and fold, slim storage.
Body: Great light weight stroller, easy to open and fold. Stores pretty flat to fit in a closet or trunk of small car. Durable material and belt system. Under stroller storage and dual parent cup holders cup holder. Good for even and slightly uneven surfaces, don't recommend for very uneven surfaces such as long loose gravel walks.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Buy this one!
Body: If you're looking for a light easy to move around umbrella stroller that allows you to load lots of stuff underneath and have drink holders & is super sturdy this is a stroller for you. We took it all over Disneyland and on the plane tto our trip to Mexico. It took a serious beatings and is still in fantastic shape. Used it for our five-year-old even though she's just On the big side for the stroller it still was a good fit and kept her from crying because she had to keep walking. Instead she could just sit in there and be happy as we pushed.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: CK22
Title: Great Value Stroller
Body: ProsEasy fold - you just have to get the trick of it. I get it every time, my husband struggles 90 % of the time,Tray and cup holder for mom and child - rare in umbrella strollers.PriceSun shade is nice and big, covers very wellStorage area is large.One hand recline - not fully, but enough for my daughter to sleepSeems like a smoother ride then our Graco travel system one.ConsCup holders are small, they fit a water bottle well.Back support for child, the back support bends when the stroller is collapsed. so there is not a solid backrest... does not bother my daughter yet, but I don't like it.This may just be a personal thing- but it's very hard to unlock the wheels in flip flops, we want to use it on vacation and I want to wear flip flops.I think it's a great stroller overall. It does still take up a good but if the trunk but not as much as a full stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Rikki L
Title: Love this stroller!
Body: We haven't had any problems with this stroller. I love how easy it is to fold up (with one hand!) and put in my car. Same with set up. The basket is a little close to the seat for my taste (I would like it deeper), but it holds so much. I just needed a basic umbrella stroller for errands, but I knew I'd use it pretty frequently so I wanted good quality and this one has been perfect. Absolutely worth the price. My daughter loves the tray since we'll put snacks on it for her.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: Very Very Very gooooood
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jessica RW
Title: LOVE this stroller and my three year old will stay ...
Body: LOVE this stroller and my three year old will stay in it for long periods of time which is almost a miracle. Don't know why she likes it so much but I am just going to go with it. We bought it because it is very lightweight and it was easy to travel with. We took it with us to Hawaii and fit it in an umbrella stroller travel bag. We had to take the front wheels off but they just easily snap in place so it wasn't an issue at all.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Berna
Title: Five Stars
Body: It is solid and much better than I anticipated. It was easy to assemble.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jessi K
Title: Wanted to love it...
Body: I bought this Feb 26, 2016. I loved how maneuverable it was and how I could not only use it for my one year old, but also for my 40 lb 3 year old if needed. The main problem was that sometimes it would get jammed and refuse to fold up. Well after desperately trying to get it to fold to go into our car trunk a few times the metal bar on the bottom finally broke. I cannot recommend it as we only got 4.5 months of light use out of it.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Keith D. Maderer
Title: Lightweight and Portable Stroller
Body: Lightweight and portable. We bought to use with our grandchildren and not as a primary stroller. Only used when babysitting. so far we like it and would recommend it to others.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: SB
Title: Not compact, not easy, not quality.
Body: It was not a good stroller at all. The only thing it had going for it was the sunshade was nice.- The wheels wobbled badly.- It does NOT fold down or collapse with just one hand. More like two hands and a foot trying to get the wheels to align perfectly so you can get it shut. Opening is a fight as well.- The footrest is all over the place.- It doesn't stay in a folded position. It has a lock, but it doesn't stay latched when it's laying down.- It is not compact so expect it to take up half of your trunk.Returned it after using it twice.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Orafla
Title: Recommend!
Body: Live this stroller. Lightweight and easy to fold. I keep it in my car for the great grandchildren.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: A. Krauss
Title: Five Stars
Body: baby shower gift
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Carol D
Title: The stroller was great for two trips
Body: The stroller was great for two trips, but suddenly it would not fold or lock in place. I consider it a danger and I have had to buy two more. One is for lightweight and the other is for heavy duty travel. I would not recommend this stroller as I had to buy another.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Christine Lane
Title: Buy something else
Body: I have a love-hate relationship with this stroller. I love how light weight it is. I hate how small it is. I love how easy it is to push around no matter what terrain we're on. I hate that the basket is so tiny. I love how compact it is. I hate that it's a bitch to fold and unfold. The one handed fold is completely bogus. I've tighten the straps as tight as they can go but my 10 month old could still be pulled out of it if I tried. It's only a 4 point harness, there isn't a shoulder connection. I like the parent cup holder but I wish there was a cover over the middle section so I could safely put my keys in it without them falling out. The childrens tray is a joke. It's so small. The sun shade is wonderful though, since it extends. It's just a glorified umbrella stroller for 3 times the price.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Rebekah P
Title: I kept it, but wouldn't buy again
Body: I struggled with whether I should give this stroller 3 or 4 stars. I ultimately decided on 3, because, while it does, in a basic way, deliver what a lightweight stroller should (simply put, convenience), I don't use it for its intended purpose (travel) because of the cons I will list.I assembled it myself in about 10 minutes, no problems, very simple.It looks great - bright red and true black, no fading so far (I've owned it for right at a year now).I use this stroller primarily while walking in my neighborhood and while taking my older kids back and forth to the bus stop. I use my full-size stroller when in public, because it is larger, more comfortable for my baby, and has more features.This stroller's wheels, while plastic, have stood the test of time. They're still in very good shape, despite old, bumpy asphalt being our most frequently traveled terrain.The cup holders seemed like an awesome feature on a lightweight stroller, but they're awfully small. They don't even fit a water bottle. I usually just lay a water bottle across the canopy, or put it in the impressively roomy basket underneath. The child's tray doesn't begin to fit a sippy cup, so I use it for cheerios or other baby snacks (only recommended if you clean and disinfect regularly!! LOL).The ride is smooth, and maneuverability is good. The sun shade has really great coverage, and I love the peekaboo window.As many reviewers have stated, the seat back is horrible. Truly, it is pitifully designed. My 9-lb baby's weight bent it in half. It seems to be reinforced with a flimsy piece of cardboard. The recline feature is a strap that you tighten or loosen, to change the angle of the seat. It doesn't recline the seat, though; it's more like it adjusts the level of SLUMP. My baby cannot sit up straight in this stroller, unless she leans forward and sits up without support. If she falls asleep, she practically hugs herself with her shoulders when I lay the seat back as far as it goes. That said, I fear that her breathing could be blocked, so I just don't let her sleep in it, if I can help it.The one-handed fold is a little tricky, but once you get used to it, it's simple. However, UNFOLDING is far more often than not a pain in the rear. Here's why: when opening the stroller from the folded position, the flimsy, bent-in-half seat back gets stuck, and it folds itself into notches and behind bars, and prohibits you from unfolding the stroller and locking it open. It took me an hour to truly figure out what in the world was keeping it from unfolding, why it happened almost every time I used the stroller, and how to quickly fix it each time I open it, so that I wasn't struggling for 15 minutes before I could put my baby in it. That is the main reason I don't travel with this stroller. It stays parked in my garage, open (thus rendering the 1-hand-fold feature useless), so I can pop the baby in and go when it's time to catch the bus.Bonus - the size of this stroller is perfect for an inexpensive, generic whole-stroller rain/wind cover. When inclement weather threatens my big kids' extracurricular activities, the baby is snug as a bug, because the cover protects the entire stroller.I kept the stroller, but I wouldn't buy it again. I'm currently looking for an affordable lightweight stroller that I can actually use for convenient travel.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Rebekah P
Title: I kept it, but i wouldn't buy it again.
Body: I struggled with whether I should give this stroller 3 or 4 stars. I ultimately decided on 3, because, while it does, in a basic way, deliver what a lightweight stroller should (simply put, convenience), I don't use it for its intended purpose (travel) because of the cons I will list.I assembled it myself in about 10 minutes, no problems, very simple.It looks great - bright red and true black, no fading so far (I've owned it for right at a year now).I use this stroller primarily while walking in my neighborhood and while taking my older kids back and forth to the bus stop. It stays parked in my garage, open (thus rendering the 1-hand-fold feature useless), so I can pop the baby in and go when it's time to catch the bus.Bonus - the size of this stroller is perfect for an inexpensive, generic whole-stroller rain/wind cover. When inclement weather threatens my big kids' extracurricular activities, the baby is snug as a bug, because the cover protects the entire stroller.I kept the stroller, but I wouldn't buy it again. I'm currently looking for an affordable lightweight stroller that I can actually use for convenient travel.

Author: Sheila
Title: Great for the price
Body: I needed a stroller for my 4 year old, and this was perfect for the price. Easy to open and close.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sabrina S
Title: best umbrella stroller for this price, great features but needs seat support improvement
Body: like many other reviewers noted this definitely has its pros and cons....pro's;-great price for the features, no other umbrella stroller comes with parent tray and child tray with cup holders.-super lightweight and compact-canopy is much larger and better than most full size strollers-easy to maneuver-5/3 point harness-large storage basket below-child tray is removeable!CONS:-the back support is so flimsy that it really deters me from using this stroller unless i have to. i hate seeing my kids slounched in the seat. and after checking the manufacturer website it seems they get a lot of complaints about this but claim that the seat is fine! they need to fix this.-not a true one hand fold, the seat sometimes folds the wrong way and you have to adjust it to get it completely folded up but its totally manageable-the storage basket is open a the front which is good if you need to access something but bad too because things can fall out
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Steve Berard
Title: Five Stars
Body: We're very happy with this stroller. Very easy to fold and unfold and rolls well. Definitely recommend Kolkraft.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: BC
Title: Great stroller for the price! Easy to use!
Body: Light weight and easy to fold up! Great stroller for the price.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Kelly DellaPenta
Title: but really it's so light and folds up so easily, it's great
Body: This stroller changed my life. I know dramatic, but really it's so light and folds up so easily, it's great! It also, somehow, doesn't take up a lot of room in my trunk. (I have a Camry) The storage is also great! I love this stroller and would highly highly recommend this problduct! You have to assemble it but it was so easy!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: KJM
Title: Good lightweight stroll
Body: Was easy to put together. Good price for what you get but concerned how well the actual little tires/wheels will wear with heavy use...only time will tell. Easy to push. Love the fact it has a tray and can be removed if wanted. Love the fact that it is light weight. However, have not been able to get it to close or open very easily with one hand.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: This stroller was great until my son got old enough to sit more ...
Body: This stroller was great until my son got old enough to sit more upright in it. When the strap to adjust the recline is fully tightened, he cannot sit correctly or comfortably. The back is two sections so when he's sitting up, his shoulders, neck and head are fully upright while the rest of his back doesn't even touch the back of the seat. I've attached a picture because I'm having trouble explaining it. It makes him slouch and lean to the side.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Miss C
Title: The best collapsible carriage for the price
Body: The best collapsible carriage for the price. It provides your little with all the comforts and has a bottom basket for storage. Easy to maneuver.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: L Borr
Title: it's ok...
Body: It is a pretty good compact stroller. Two cons: the seat back is some sort of cardboard and dips, so when my daughter sits in it, her back slumps in and she's ploughed. I hate that. I'd like her to be straight back. After about 6 months of using it every day, the button to fold it broke off. It's still usable and foldable, but I have to use my nails to fold it. Time for a new one.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ashley C.
Title: Poor quality, tiny cup holders, plastic wheels & too short
Body: I really do not like this stroller. It is too short for me (-5'6) and I have to hunch to push it. Also, the drink holders are abnormally small and I do not own a single cup that would fit in it! Maybe if you crumpled the bottom of a regular sized water bottle you could stuff it in there. However, definitely no child cups will fit in the child console. The wheels are so wobbly and a smooth plastic with no tread. This will slide all over the place. I used it once at a mall and my baby seemed so uncomfortable and only wanted to be held. She is fine in our large jogging stroller. I was hoping this would be a good stroller for shopping and airports but sadly, it is unusable.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ashley
Title: Love the basket, does not fold easily
Body: Lightweight and a huge basket on the bottom. Only issue is that the wheels have to turn a certain way to fully fold. You can't really fold it with one hand - well once in a while I get lucky and it works. I don't mind though, because it fits in my trunk open. Great for the price. Happy with this purchase.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Four Stars
Body: Good one
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Marcy pakula
Title: Five Stars
Body: This carriage is really sturdy. Went over rocks and bark. Wheels handle well. Easy to get child inside. Great for walks.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customerse Maria y sergio sergio
Title: Five Stars
Body: Very lightweight and easy to manouver.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: My daughter who just had her 4th child loves this stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Customers
Title: Three Stars
Body: Not suitable for a small baby without the use of a baby carrier. Car seat carrier worked well
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: audreyofdc
Title: Many POSITIVE FEATURES make this a keeper for us, but it's NOT a true 1-hand-fold
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: JPC
Title: Well made stroller!
Body: Excellent quality and value!
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Ron
Title: Ok Stoller
Body: My wife and I bought two of these for our daughters for a vacation trip. Our 3 yr old fits just fine, but or 4 yr is too big for this stroller. This stroller is smaller than it looks and all the cup holders are extremely small. You wont be able to fit a coke bottle or 12 ounce drink in the cup holders. A small sippy cup will fit. Besides the cup holders and our 4yr old being too big, it is a nice stroller for the price.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: Nice..
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Lori
Title: Great stroller!
Body: Great stroller! Light and easy to operate. Would recommend.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Sonia
Title: Five Stars
Body: Very lightweight and convenient. Doesn't take up lots of trunk space in car
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: Five Stars
Body: Nice and comfortable
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Diana
Title: Poor back design causes slumping
Body: Lightweight but fails to fold easily each time and our child slumps in seat due to bend in seat back. We had to temporarily reinforce with a board to give her proper back support until I can return it.I would not buy this item again.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Jess
Title: Won't close
Body: Horrible stroller! After finally getting it all put together the stupid thing doesn't fold down! It took 3 hours of me tinkering to try and figure out what the problem was. I finally got it collapsed down enough to shove in the box. I'm having it returned tomorrow.
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: isabella
Title: STAY AWAY!!!
Body: This stroller was bought for me as a gift for the sole purpose of TEMPORARY use only!!! I needed something light, portable, and yet affordable for my family trip to Italy (for visiting relatives). The height of the handles is short for me and I'm 5'5, but it's easy to get used to. This stroller was very convenient and great, AT FIRST. But upon my return home and being spoiled by the convenience of a lighter and smaller stroller compared to my son's heavy duty bulky stroller, I used it more and more for short walking trips. As of recently, it has become a major safety hazard to use it. More so for myself than my son. I almost fractured my leg on this the other day (I have major bruises on my front left leg) and then today I almost fell backwards down the front stairs with this. The thing that has made this stroller extremely dangerous for me to use are the front wheels. They get caught up very easily and if I'm walking, the rear metal axil gets jammed into my legs very fast and viciously. But I will express, this stroller has indeed become dangerous for not just me but my son as well. If the stroller gets caught on the sidewalk, every 2-3 seconds, and my son is chewing on the tray from teething, he is likely to get badly hurt and it's happened once so far.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: CLB FWT
Title: Overall a great stroller. It just seems a little on the ...
Body: Overall a great stroller. It just seems a little on the short side; my 2 year old nephew can't grow anymore if I want more use out of it. Otherwise, cupholders (both for adult & child) are a great size, it fit a sippy cup and a juice box. Big storage underneath - held a purse diaper bag and packages. He wasn't going anywhere but I could see the restraints useful for a smaller child (or a really bad driver). Fairly easy to put together, very easy to collapse. Definitely worth the price.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

The only thing that disappointed me were the cup holders (adult and child)--none of our cups will fit into them. Bummer.

Author: J. C. Lin
Title: Featherlight, smooth ride, no surprises
Body: Very light, sturdy, smooth ride and generally comfortable. It also stands quite easily when folded, which is convenient.A few things to note: the tray is a bit hard to pop on and off. A typical stroller will have a hinge and a latch. This stroller uses a clipping action of the semi-rigid plastic tray to the frame. Second, the back of the chair is somewhat reclined even at the most upright setting. I put it in quotes because the angle is defined by a strap that you tighten (upright) or loosen (reclined). The most upright angle is still fairly shallow, which means my child is always leaning a little bit back. Third, the cupholders, as mentioned by other reviewers, are indeed quite small and generally useless for their intended use. I still use them to store random things, so it's not a big deal. Also, I knew this coming in since I read so many Amazon reviews and this is a consistent criticism.Overall, though, the stroller meets our needs quite nicely.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Theresa Bogema
Title: Not worth the savings
Body: Our family of 4 grew to a family of 5 when we went to China last month to adopt a little girl who was 4. We knew we'd want a stroller for all the airports and everything we'd be doing while in country. We looked at a lot of reviews and strollers before ordering this for our trip. It does stroll, it was sturdy enough to fit her, the straps work, and so does the canopy. That is about it with positives. After about a dozen one hand folds it started to take two hands and now I can only get it to fold when I hold my breath right. The sliding feature no longer slides all the way so it is next to impossible to get folded. This may seem like a small complaint, but the cup holders are too small. No kid cup, water bottle, etc. that we gave her will actually fit into the cup holder on the tray or near the handle. Moving around a lot trying to hold liquids was hard. We did take this all the way to China and back and we've used it multiple times every day for a little over a month, but there is already a hole in the mesh stow underneath. Don't make the mistake we did - pay a little more for a better quality stroller.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: Andrew T.
Title: Perfect Umbrella Stroller
Body: I researched quite a bit before deciding on this umbrella stroller and I'm so glad I did. This stroller was recommended in the book Baby Bargains. It has a great canopy, is easy to fold, has a large basket underneath, and also has a removable tray. This stroller is perfect to keep in my trunk for errands with my little guy. I use the Baby Jogger City Mini around our neighborhood that has lots of uneven sidewalks and hills, but for shopping this stroller is fantastic!
Styles: Color: Slate Grey (Wheel Color May Vary)

Title: Love it!

Author: A.B.F.
Title: Couldn't be happier with this purchase
Body: Today was my first day using our new stroller and I absolutely love it. We went to the zoo today and made it thru the day perfect with not a single issue. My 2yr daughter couldn't wait to get in it. I will say tho bc my daughter is tall for her age and her legs just dangled there (she was too lazy to keep them on the foot rest) but for her long legs she didn't hit the front wheels once. It was a smooth ride for her and easy push for me. I like the handles on the stroller, super soft and not so low. It was great having that basket underneath too bc then I didn't have to carry everything in my backpack. It's super light weight which is a plus bc I have a bad back so sometimes picking up that damn jogger stroller was a struggle. I do wish the cup holders were bigger but so far that has been the only down fall. I highly recommend this stroller. Even my husband loves it and he was against the idea of even getting a new stroller bc he thought she was too old for one. If I run into any issues later I'll be sure to update this.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Author: jenk
Title: Great umbrella stroller
Body: Lightweight, easy umbrella stroller to carry around. We purchased this for our one year old so that we could take it to Disneyland. For the money, it's great - it's easy to fold and unfold, it's not too heavy for me to carry (I have an uppababy and this is definitely lighter), and the basket size is a decent size (it can hold a couple baby blankets, a backpack with baby stuff in it, and a portable baby table).Pros: Lightweight, narrow, and maneuvers well on smooth surfaces. It's easy to fold and unfold. The snack tray is very useful. The sunshade blocks the sun well in the front. There are two cupholders that are permanently attached to the stroller handle and it holds water bottles and Starbucks coffee cups perfectly.Cons: It doesn't recline all the way. It leans back about 45 degrees. It also does not prop up all the way, either. So the baby is always at an angle. The foot rest is very low so the baby starts to slump down and basically is held in to the seat by her crotch. The seat where she is sitting is at a slight downward angle, as well. It's not great for baby to nap in. There is a mesh opening in the back of the sunshade so you can look down on the baby when he/she is sitting in the stroller, but there is no cover so the baby's head is exposed to the sun that way. You cannot make the handle higher or lower. The snack tray has a cupholder but it is very narrow so it doesn't hold any of the baby's cups.For the price it's great. My husband loves it and would rather use this one than the Uppababy Cruz so we have both taking up room in our car trunk.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)

Title: Five Stars
Body: Love it!!

Title: The cup holders are way too small. My son's ...

Author: Amazon Customer
Title: This stroller is amazing! I recommend it to all my friends
Body: This stroller is amazing! I recommend it to all my friends. It has replaced both my expensive full size stroller and the umbrella stroller. Pros: super lightweight! Easy fold, stands upright when folded, large shade, deep recline (my toddler easily took a full nap laying back in the shade) & excellent price, I would've paid more it's so great Cons: small cup holders, not a truly one hand fold, I usually need 2 hands but still much easier than umbrella (there is a button twist mechanism in the handle to press and the stroller folds in line with the handle and sometimes wheels don't align properly for fold so you need to pick it up with other hand so weeks rotate and align, but it's so light this is no trouble IMHO) I bought this for a trip to Disney so we could fit it through the security conveyor belt and on and off Disney busses. I went to the store multiple time to try out different models but they were all too heavy/bulky so I took a risk and ordered it, I could not be more pleased. It is the most lightweight stroller I've ever seen and worked great for the trip. Now I use it as an all purpose stroller because it's so light and easy to lift into the car for trips to the store and less weight to push on walks to the park.
Styles: Color: Fire Red (Wheel Color May Vary)
